mkt_def.h File Reference

Header file for all MKT functions and types. More...

#include <afu_def.h>
#include <crsDef.h>
#include <AfuMcr.h>

Go to the source code of this file.

Macros

#define MKT_TRT   7059
 
#define MISSING_CRV   10 /* Missing curve */
 
#define NO_VAL_PNT   11 /* Not enough valid points */
 
#define VER_EXS   13 /* The name of vertex already exists*/
 
#define ERR_NO_RIGHT   14 /* Prices for this profile cannot be entered by user */
 
#define CTL_ASS_FST   15 /* The name of vertex can not contain any */
 
#define CTL_ASS_SND   16 /* of the following characters or substrings: */
 
#define CTL_ASS_THD   17 /* '.', ',', ':', ';', '_IV' */

#define MKT_VCM_MIS_COR   30 /* Missing correlation between assets */
 
#define MKT_VCM_MIS_HDT   40 /* Number of days since that want to obtain the historic prices */
 
#define MKT_VCM_PRI_ZER   50 /* Price 0.0 is converted in 0.000000001 */
 
#define MKT_VCM_MIS_DIR_VCM   60 /* Missing location directory for Vol&Cor matrixes */

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriFindTac (void *LdPri, char *Ctr, double *Tac)
 Find a accrued until tomorrow date for a contract in LdPri One important thing to be considered with this value is that on the previous date of the the coupon end, the accrued coupon amount will be 0.0. It is considered that 'tomorrow' is in the next coupon.
 
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriFindTaf (void *LdPri, char *Ctr, double *Taf)
 Find a 'full' accrued until tomorrow date for a contract in LdPri One important thing to be considered with this value is that on the previous date of the coupon end, the full coupon will be considered as accrued.

 Calculate the price of "letras" affected by the curve Crv.

 Calculates the "m_u" column, maturity/unit, e.g. "1 month".

Detailed Description

Header file for all MKT functions and types.

Acronyme
MKT

Header file for all MKT functions and types

Author
Edurne GORDOA - 18/Mar/2002

Macro Definition Documentation

#define AFU_BLD_BLN   "bln"
#define AFU_BLD_BLS   "bls"
#define AFU_MAX_RDT   10000.0
#define AFU_MKT_VCM_DCY   0.94
#define AFU_VMX_AXT_DUR   "Dur"
#define AFU_VMX_AXT_INI   "Ini"
#define AFU_VMX_AXT_STK   "Stk"
#define AFU_VMX_EQU_DFL_MAT   0
#define AFU_VMX_EQU_DFL_UNT   "D"
#define AFU_VMX_PRD_EQU   "equity"
#define AFU_VMX_PRD_IRG   "irg"
#define AFU_VMX_PRD_SWP   "swap"
#define CDSBSK_RDD_ANL   "Analytic"
#define CDSBSK_RDD_MCI   "Montecarlo"
#define CRV_MDL_CDF   "Cdf" /* Curve with deafult column in the 'x' axis */
#define CRV_MDL_CRV   "Crv" /* Curve with maturity/unit columns in the 'x' axis */
#define CTL_ASS_FST   15 /* The name of vertex can not contain any */
#define CTL_ASS_SND   16 /* of the following characters or substrings: */
#define CTL_ASS_THD   17 /* '.', ',', ':', ';', '_IV' */
#define CTY_CDIVOL   "CdiVol" /* CDSi volatility curve */
#define CTY_CDS   "cds" /* Credit Def. Swap Curve */
#define CTY_CDSI   "cdsi" /* Credit Def. Swap Index Curve */
#define CTY_CDSVOL   "CdsVol" /* CDS volatility curve */
#define CTY_COC   "Coc" /* Commodity price curve */
#define CTY_COMVOL   "ComVol" /* Commodity volatility curve */
#define CTY_DVDYLD   "DvdYld" /* Dividend yield curve */
#define CTY_EPR   "Epr" /* Equity prices curve */
#define CTY_EQUVOL   "EquVol" /* Equity volatility curve */
#define CTY_FRXVOL   "FrxVol" /* FOREX volatility curve */
#define CTY_FSP   "fsp" /* Swap Point Curve */
#define CTY_INX   "Inx" /* Index prices curve */
#define CTY_INXVOL   "InxVol" /* Index volatility curve */
#define CTY_YIELD   "yield" /* Yield Curve */
#define CTY_YLDVOL   "YldVol" /* Yield volatility curve */
#define ECH_IDE_DEF   "Default"
#define ECH_IDE_FEE   "Fees"
#define ECH_IDE_INT   "Interest"
#define ECH_IDE_OPT   "Option"
#define ERR_NO_RIGHT   14 /* Prices for this profile cannot be entered by user */
#define MISSING_CRV   10 /* Missing curve */
#define MKT_SRC_BLB   "BLB" /* Bloomberg */
#define MKT_SRC_DLE   "Deal" /* Price copied from a deal */
#define MKT_SRC_FIL   "MD file" /* Standard market data file */
#define MKT_SRC_LET_CRV   "Letras calculation" /* Letras price calculated from yield curve. */
#define MKT_SRC_MCI   "MC instrument calc" /* Monte Carlo instrument calculation */
#define MKT_SRC_RTF   "RT-file" /* Real time by file */
#define MKT_SRC_RTM   "RT-message" /* Real time by message */
#define MKT_SRC_WIN   "Window" /* Price entered from window */
#define MKT_TRT   7059
#define MKT_TYP_ADY   "Ady" /* Asset yield curve */
#define MKT_TYP_ASS   "Ass" /* Asset prices */
#define MKT_TYP_ASV   "Asv" /* Asset volatility curve */
#define MKT_TYP_BCO   "Bco" /* Base correlation curves */
#define MKT_TYP_BET   "Bet" /* Beta prices */
#define MKT_TYP_BND   "Bnd" /* Bond prices */
#define MKT_TYP_CDO   "Cdo" /* Cdo prices */
#define MKT_TYP_CDS   "Cds" /* Credit default swap curves */
#define MKT_TYP_CDSI   "Cdsi" /* Credit default swap index curves */
#define MKT_TYP_COC   "Coc" /* Commodity price curve */
#define MKT_TYP_COM   "Com" /* Comodity */
#define MKT_TYP_COR   "Cor" /* Correlation */
#define MKT_TYP_CPV   "Cpv" /* Commodity volatility curve */
#define MKT_TYP_DSV   "Dsv" /* CDS volatility curves */
#define MKT_TYP_DYC   "Dyc" /* Dividend yield curve */
#define MKT_TYP_ENE   "Ene" /* Energy */
#define MKT_TYP_EPC   "Epc" /* Equity price curve */
#define MKT_TYP_EPR   "Epr" /* Equity prices */
#define MKT_TYP_EPV   "Epv" /* Equity volatility curve */
#define MKT_TYP_FBP   "Fbp" /* Fixing bond price */
#define MKT_TYP_FMX   "Fmx" /* Fra matrix point */
#define MKT_TYP_FPR   "Fpr" /* Future prices */
#define MKT_TYP_FSP   "Fsp" /* Forex swap point curves */
#define MKT_TYP_FXG   "Fxg" /* Fixing curves */
#define MKT_TYP_FXV   "Fxv" /* FOREX volatility curve */
#define MKT_TYP_INX   "Inx" /* Index prices */
#define MKT_TYP_IXC   "Ixc" /* Index prices curve */
#define MKT_TYP_IXV   "Ixv" /* Index volatility curve */
#define MKT_TYP_NPR   "Npr" /* Fund prices */
#define MKT_TYP_OPR   "Opr" /* Option prices */
#define MKT_TYP_SIV   "Siv" /* CDSi volatility curves */
#define MKT_TYP_SPC   "Spc" /* Bond Spread */
#define MKT_TYP_SPO   "Spo" /* Forex spots */
#define MKT_TYP_VMX   "Vmx" /* Volatility matrix */
#define MKT_TYP_VOL   "Vol" /* Option volatilities */
#define MKT_TYP_YLD   "Yld" /* Yield curves */
#define MKT_TYP_YLV   "Ylv" /* Yield volatility curves */
#define MKT_VCM_MIS_COR   30 /* Missing correlation between assets */
#define MKT_VCM_MIS_DIR_VCM   60 /* Missing location directory for Vol&Cor matrixes */
#define MKT_VCM_MIS_HDT   40 /* Number of days since that want to obtain the historic prices */
#define MKT_VCM_MIS_PRI   10 /* Missing asset price */
#define MKT_VCM_MIS_VOL   20 /* Missing asset volatility */
#define MKT_VCM_PRI_ZER   50 /* Price 0.0 is converted in 0.000000001 */
#define MKT_VCM_TRT   7063
#define NO_VAL_PNT   11 /* Not enough valid points */
#define VER_EXS   13 /* The name of vertex already exists*/

enum mkt_fxg_mtc

Fixing rate calculation methods.

Fixing rate calculation methods

When a type is added it should be added in one of these functions:

  • MKTfxgGetMtcIsHst: for calculation from historical points
  • MKTfxgGetMtcIsDir: for direct calculation
Author
Name SURNAME - DD/Mmm/yyyy
Modified
  • Edurne GORDOA - 01/Apr/2002. Carried from fxg_def.h
  • Edurne GORDOA - 17/Sep/2014: Take into account mkt_fxg_mtc_cms_neg_zro and mkt_fxg_mtc_direct_neg_zro. Adapt comments to see the full information in documentation generated by doxygen
Enumerator:
mkt_fxg_mtc_nearest 

get the nearest rate

mkt_fxg_mtc_cms 

Like 'CMS EUR', capitalised

mkt_fxg_mtc_avg_not_used 

average (collat), should be removed it when collat is done in V15

mkt_fxg_mtc_avg_cap 

average capitalised

mkt_fxg_mtc_cap_not_used 

capitalised (collat), should be removed it when collat is done in V15

mkt_fxg_mtc_gap_nearest 

get the nearest taken account a gap (radio) of days

mkt_fxg_mtc_interpol 

interpolate

mkt_fxg_mtc_average 

Average

mkt_fxg_mtc_cap_1D 

Capitalised 1D even the week end

mkt_fxg_mtc_direct 

Without capitalised without average

mkt_fxg_mtc_nearest_cal 

Get the nearest rate (like 0 but use other curve)

mkt_fxg_mtc_cms_neg_zro 

Like 'CMS EUR', capitalised but when rate is negative interests are 0

mkt_fxg_mtc_direct_neg_zro 

Without capitalised without average, but when rate is negative interests are 0

Function Documentation

AFUMCR_EXP int BBconvertIntoSpot ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdSpots,
void *  Ld,
char *  RefDev,
int  ColDev,
int  ConvUnits,
int  NbCol,
  ... 
)

Convert amounts in a list into consolidation currency, & optionally to units.

Given a list with a currency column and one or more amount columns, multiply every amount by each currency spot to consolidate, and optionally, also convert the amount to RefDev units.

See in the following table the description of the behaviour of the function depending on the ConvUnits parameter:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Enumerated | Value | Convert to spot | Round | Return units -
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- CnvDevUntFinUntDec | -2 | Yes | Yes | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevUntFinUnt | -1 | Yes | Not | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevFoxUnt | 0 | Yes | Not | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevUnt | 1 | Yes | Not | Currency units (i.e. EUR) -
- CnvDevUntDec | 2 | Yes | Yes | Currency units (i.e. EUR) -
- CnvDevFoxUntRefDec | 3 | Yes | Yes | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Parameters
CtxDb connection.
LdSpotsSpot list (SPOTinit...)
LdList to be treated
RefDevConsolidation currency
ColDevCurrency column identifier
ConvUnitsConvert values. See header description
NbColNumber of column to be multiplied
...Amount column indexes
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 22/Oct/1999
Modified
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 24/Nov/2006: Use AFUccyGetIntDta function instead of infEchQnt and add Ctx parameter in this function and SPOTgetUnit function.
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 31/May/2007: Put correctly the section "modified" of the head.
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 13/Jan/2011: Call to lcBBconvertIntoSpotMrk
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 24/Sep/2012: index of columns of type int.
  • Edurne GORDOA - 10/Nov/2017: Improve function header
  • Josune BIKUNA - 23/Nov/2017: Add ColSpo parameter to lcBBconvertIntoSpotMrk with default value -1
See Also
BBconvertOneIntoSpot, BBconvertIntoUnits, BBconvertFromUnits, BBconvertIntoSpotMrk, BBconvertIntoSpotAdd
AFUMCR_EXP int BBconvertIntoSpotAdd ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdSpots,
void *  Ld,
char *  RefDev,
int  ColDev,
int  ColSpo,
int  ConvUnits,
int  NbCol,
  ... 
)

Convert amounts into consolidation currency, saving the used spot, & optionally to units.

Given a list with a currency column and one or more amount columns, multiply every amount by each currency spot to consolidate, and optionally, also convert the amount to RefDev units. The used spot rate will be saved into ColSpo value (see parameters)

See in the following table the description of the behaviour of the function depending on the ConvUnits parameter:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Enumerated | Value | Convert to spot | Round | Return units -
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- CnvDevUntFinUntDec | -2 | Yes | Yes | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevUntFinUnt | -1 | Yes | Not | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevFoxUnt | 0 | Yes | Not | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevUnt | 1 | Yes | Not | Currency units (i.e. EUR) -
- CnvDevUntDec | 2 | Yes | Yes | Currency units (i.e. EUR) -
- CnvDevFoxUntRefDec | 3 | Yes | Yes | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Parameters
CtxDb connection.
LdSpotsSpot list (SPOTinit...)
LdList to be treated
RefDevConsolidation currency
ColDevCurrency column identifier
ColSpoSpot column identifier in which the used spot rate must be saved. If this parameter corresponds to a valid column index (that is > -1), it will mean that the spot used for the conversion is wanted to save in that column. If this parameter is -1, it is ignored.
ConvUnitsConvert values. See header description
NbColNumber of column to be multiplied
...Amount column indexes
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 23/Nov/2017
See Also
BBconvertOneIntoSpot, BBconvertIntoUnits, BBconvertFromUnits, BBconvertIntoSpo
AFUMCR_EXP int BBconvertIntoSpotMrk ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdSpots,
void *  Ld,
char *  RefDev,
int  ColDev,
int  ConvUnits,
int  ColMrk,
int  NbCol,
  ... 
)

Convert amounts in marked lines, into consolidation currency, & optionally to units.

Given a list with a currency column and one or more amount columns, multiply every amount by each currency spot to consolidate, and optionally, also convert the amount to RefDev units. Only if the lines are marked (value in ColMrk column != 0

See in the following table the description of the behaviour of the function depending on the ConvUnits parameter:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Enumerated | Value | Convert to spot | Round | Return units -
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- CnvDevUntFinUntDec | -2 | Yes | Yes | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevUntFinUnt | -1 | Yes | Not | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevFoxUnt | 0 | Yes | Not | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevUnt | 1 | Yes | Not | Currency units (i.e. EUR) -
- CnvDevUntDec | 2 | Yes | Yes | Currency units (i.e. EUR) -
- CnvDevFoxUntRefDec | 3 | Yes | Yes | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Parameters
CtxDb connection.
LdSpotsSpot list (SPOTinit...)
LdList to be treated
RefDevConsolidation currency
ColDevCurrency column identifier
ConvUnitsConvert values. See header description
ColMrkMark column index (columns to be treated will be <> 0 (if -1: treat all lines.
NbColNumber of column to be multiplied
...Amount column indexes
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 23/Dec/2010
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 24/Sep/2012: index of columns of type int.
  • Edurne GORDOA - 10/Nov/2017: Improve function header
  • Josune BIKUNA - 23/Nov/2017: Add ColSpo parameter to lcBBconvertIntoSpotMrk with default value -1
See Also
BBconvertOneIntoSpot, BBconvertIntoUnits, BBconvertFromUnits, BBconvertIntoSpo, BBconvertIntoSpotAdd
AFUMCR_EXP int BBconvertOneIntoSpot ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdSpots,
void *  Ld,
int  Line,
char *  RefDev,
int  ColDev,
int  ConvUnits,
int  NbCol,
  ... 
)

Convert amounts in a line in a list into consolidation currency, & optionally to units.

Given a list with a currency column and one or more amount columns, multiply every amount by each currency spot to consolidate, and optionally, also convert the amount to RefDev units.

See in the following table the description of the behaviour of the function depending on the ConvUnits parameter:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Enumerated | Value | Convert to spot | Round | Return units -
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- CnvDevFoxUnt | 0 | Yes | Not | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
- CnvDevUnt | 1 | Yes | Not | Currency units (i.e. EUR) -
- CnvDevUntDec | 2 | Yes | Yes | Currency units (i.e. EUR) -
- CnvDevFoxUntRefDec | 3 | Yes | Yes | Finantial units (i.e. kEUR) -
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdSpotsSpot list (SPOTinit...)
LdList to be treated
LineIndex of the line to convert
RefDevConsolidation currency
ColDevCurrency column identifier
ConvUnitsHow to do convertion. See function header for description
NbColNumber of column to be multiplied
...Amount column indexes
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 30/Nov/1999
See Also
BBconvertIntoSpot, BBconvertIntoUnits, BBconvertFromUnits, BBconvertIntoSpotAdd
Modified
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 24/Nov/2006: Use AFUccyGetIntDta function instead of infEchQnt and Ctx parameter in this fucntion and SPOTgetUnit function.
  • Gema ACHA - 19/Apr/2012: Allow convert values to RefDev units and RefDev decimals
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 24/Sep/2012: index of columns of type int.
  • Edurne GORDOA - 08/Nov/2017: Round the amount into reference currency decimals and only for the asked line. If we use AFUccySetDevPre we are converting each time all the lines of the list. Bug corrected amounts were rounded after convert to EUR and they must be rounded before
AFUMCR_EXP int CalIntOpt ( char *  Dat,
char *  Clo,
double  Prx,
double  Stk,
double  Dfc,
double  DfcRho,
double  Vol,
char *  Cpu,
int  Ift,
double *  Prm,
double *  Dlt,
double *  Gmm,
double *  Veg,
double *  Tht,
double *  Rho,
char *  Prd,
char *  Dev 
)

Black & Scholes of an interest rate option.

Black & Scholes of an interest rate option. The used basis is "ACT/360" instead of "ACT/365" for the cdsi to obtain same results than Bloomberg. For the rest of products the used basis is "ACT/365". Swaptions may also be treated. The treated products in that method are:

  • irg-s (caplets/floorlets)
  • cds options
  • Swaptions.
Parameters
DatCalculation date
CloMaturity date of the option. For irg-s (Cap/floor) the maturity date will be the fixing date, that is, the beginning of the theorical loan.
PrxCurrent price of the underlying. Usually, the forward rate (ex: 3.45) but for the MMfutures it will be its price (ex: 97.34).
StkStrike of the option. Same format than Prx
DfcDiscount factor, calculated with a rate without risk, until maturity date of the option. In the irg (cap, floor) it will be the DF until the payment date
DfcRhoDiscount factor, calculated with a rate without risk, for Rho calculation
VolVolatility (in percentage)
Cpu'C': call, 'P': put
Ift1: the value of DfcRho are taken into account. 0: calculations are made with both values to 1
Prm(OUT) Option premium, it is in the same units that Prx is. For MMfutures it will be in percent. To obtain the premium amount it should be multiplied by the notional and divided by 100.
  • irg (cap, floors), it should be multiplied by the number of years of the 'loan'
  • CDS, CDSi: it should be multiplied by the BPV (or DV01 fwd)
  • swaptions: it must be multiplied by the notional and divided by 100
Dlt(OUT) Option delta, in unit, not percentages (for example, 23% will be 0.23). It can be used for calculate the premium for a new price. Example, with a Prx = 3.5% we obtain a Prm = 0.14301753% and a Dlt = 0.31670394. If the price is increased in 0.05%, until 3.55%, the new Prm should be similar to: NewPrm = 0.14301753 + 0.31670394 * 0.05 = 0.15885273. If we calculate the Prm for the new price we obtain 0.15943352. A part of the error can be elimimated considering the gamma.
Gmm(OUT) Option gamma, in unit, not percentages (for example, 23% will be 0.23). It can be used for calculate the premium for a new price. Example, with a Prx = 3.5% we obtain a Prm = 0.14301753%, a Dlt = 0.31670394 and a gamma of 0.46219991. If the price is increased in 0.05%, until 3.55%, the new Prm should be similar to: NewPrm = 0.14301753 + 0.31670394 * 0.05 + 0.5 * 0.4621999 * 0.05 * 0.05 = 0.15943048. If we calculate the Prm for the new price we obtain 0.15943352. The precission is bigger than using only the delta
Veg(OUT) Option vega, in percent. It can be used for calculate the premium for a new volatility. Example, with a Vol = 16.00% we obtain a Prm = 0.01004690% and a Veg = 0.33110621. If the volatility is increased in 1.00%, until 17.00%, the new Prm should be similar to: NewPrm = 0.01004690 + 0.33110621 * 1.00 / 100 = 0.01335796. If we calculate the Prm for the new volatility we obtain 0.01366825.
Tht(OUT) Option theta
Rho(OUT) Option rho
PrdProduct
DevCurrency
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
???? - ????
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 13/Nov/2001. Do not modify Clo, use local variable DatTmp
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 06/Oct/2003: Correct to avoid a warning
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 11/Apr/2005: Normalice the code. Even the function name, from fin_opt_fut to CalIntOpt
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 21/Apr/2005: Sustitue fin_opt_fut by CalIntOpt in the header's funcion. And correct a bug, DfcRho was used insted of DfcRho1
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 23/Nov/2006: Improve comments for Dfc (exception for irg)
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 29/Nov/2006: Improve comments for Prm (premium amount). Sustitute clCalBondBasis by clCalBasis
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 18/Dec/2006: Sustiute Rat and RatRho by Dfc and DfcRho respectively. Add error management. Uses Stk1 in sustitution of Stk and Frw in Prx
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 28/Dec/2006: Order code. Remake gamma and vega calculation
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Feb/2007: Delete unused variables.
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 19/Oct/2007: When calculating the basis, if the product is cdsi, use an ACT/360 basis instead of EXA/EXA in order to have same results than Bloomberg.
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 17/Jan/2012: Check if Prx negative set it no nearly zero
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 17/Jan/2012: Use DBL_M_EPSILON (Set Prx lower than DBL_M_EPSILON to DBL_M_EPSILON to avoid problems with the calculation algorithm)
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 19/Nov/2012: Correct header of function
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 18/Nov/2014: Add Swap options in header
  • Nerea RAMOS - 27/Nov/2014: Use ACT/365 instead of EXA/EXA to calculate the option duration in years for products != cdsi. Reorganise and correct comments
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 12/May/2015: Use MTHdisNsc instead of normale from cardinal. seeAlso : CalIntOptIrg, CalIntOptNor, CalIntOptIrgNor
AFUMCR_EXP int CalIntOptIrg ( char *  Dat,
char *  Clo,
double  Prx,
double  Stk,
double  Dfc,
double  DfcRho,
double  Vol,
char *  Cpu,
int  Ift,
double  Icp,
double  DfcBdt,
double *  Prm,
double *  Dlt,
double *  Gmm,
double *  Veg,
char *  Prd,
char *  Dev 
)

Black-76 of an interest rate option for IRG digitals.

Black-76 of an interest rate option for IRG digitals

Parameters
DatCalculation date
CloMaturity date of the option
PrxCurrent price of the underlying. Usually, the forward rate (ex: 3.45) but for the MMfutures it will be its price (ex: 97.34)
StkStrike of the option. Same format than Prx
DfcDiscount factor, calculated with a rate without risk, until maturity date of the option. In the irg (cap, floor) it will be the DF until the payment date
DfcRhoDiscount factor, calculated with a rate without risk, for Rho calculation
VolVolatility (in pourcentage)
Cpu'C': call, 'P': put
Ift1: the value of DfcRho are taken into account. 0: calculations are made with both values to 1
IcpIrg Cap or Floor coupon value
DfcBdtRisk free Discount factor. (until exercise date) ????????????
Prm(OUT) Option premium, in percent. To obtain the premium amount it should be multiplied by the notional and divided by 100. For the irg (cap, floors), it should be multiplied for the number of years of the 'loan', too.
Dlt(OUT) Option delta, in unit, not percentages (for example, 23% will be 0.23). It can be used for calculate the premium for a new price.
Gmm(OUT) Option gamma, in unit, not percentages (for example, 23% will be 0.23). It can be used for calculate the premium for a new price.
Veg(OUT) Option vega, in percent. It can be used for calculate the premium for a new volatility.
PrdProduct
DevCurrency
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Ruben GIL - 23/Jan/2007
Modified
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 09/Jan/2008: Do not divide Icp by 100.
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 24/Jan/2008: Use Black-76 instead of Black & Scholes
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 24/Jan/2008: Remove some not needed parenthesys (brakets).
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 17/Jan/2012: Check if Prx negative set it no nearly zero
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 17/Jan/2012: Use DBL_M_EPSILON (Set Prx lower than DBL_M_EPSILON to DBL_M_EPSILON to avoid problems with the calculation algorithm)
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 19/Nov/2012: Correct header of function
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 07/Nov/2014: Sonar corrections
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 21/Nov/2014: Sonar corrections
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 12/May/2015: Use "MTHdisNsc" function instead of "normale" from cardinal. seeAlso : CalIntOpt, CalIntOptNor, CalIntOptIrgNor
AFUMCR_EXP int CalIntOptIrgNor ( char *  Dat,
char *  Clo,
double  Prx,
double  Stk,
double  Dfc,
double  Vol,
char *  Cpu,
double  Icp,
double *  Prm,
char *  Prd,
char *  Dev 
)

Black-76 of an interest rate option for IRG digitals. NORMAL VERSION (vs lognormal)

Black-76 of an interest rate option for IRG digitals

Parameters
DatCalculation date
CloMaturity date of the option
PrxCurrent price of the underlying. Usually, the forward rate (ex: 3.45) but for the MMfutures it will be its price (ex: 97.34)
StkStrike of the option. Same format than Prx
DfcDiscount factor, calculated with a rate without risk, until maturity date of the option. In the irg (cap, floor) it will be the DF until the payment date
VolNormal volatility (in percentage)
Cpu'C': call, 'P': put
IcpIrg Cap or Floor coupon value
Prm(OUT) Option premium, in percent. To obtain the premium amount it should be multiplied by the notional and divided by 100. For the irg (cap, floors), it should be multiplied for the number of years of the 'loan', too.
PrdProduct
DevCurrency
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 29/JUN/2015

seeAlso : CalIntOptNor, CalIntOpt, CalIntOptIrg

AFUMCR_EXP int CalIntOptNor ( char *  Dat,
char *  Clo,
double  Prx,
double  Stk,
double  Dfc,
double  Vol,
char *  Cpu,
double *  Prm,
char *  Prd 
)

Black & Scholes of an interest rate option. NORMAL VERSION (vs lognormal)

Black & Scholes of an interest rate option. The used basis is "ACT/360" instead of "ACT/365" for the cdsi to obtain same results than Bloomberg. For the rest of products the used basis is "ACT/365" The treated products in that method are:

  • irg-s (caplets/floorlets)
  • cds options
Parameters
DatCalculation date
CloMaturity date of the option. For irg-s (Cap/floor) the maturity date will be the fixing date, that is, the beginning of the theoretical loan.
PrxCurrent price of the underlying. Usually, the forward rate (ex: 3.45) but for the MMfutures it will be its price (ex: 97.34).
StkStrike of the option. Same format as Prx
DfcDiscount factor, calculated with a rate without risk, until maturity date of the option. In the irg (cap, floor) it will be the DF until the payment date
VolNormal volatility (in percentage)
Cpu'C': call, 'P': put
Prm(OUT) Option premium, it is in the same units that Prx is. For MMfutures it will be in percent. To obtain the premium amount it should be multiplied by the notional and divided by 100.
  • irg (cap, floors), it should be multiplied by the number of years of the 'loan'
  • CDS, CDSi: it should be multiplied by the BPV (or DV01 fwd)
PrdProduct
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 29/JUN/2015
Modified
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 07/Jul/2015: Sustitute local lcMTHdisDen with MTHdisDen (math_def.h)

seeAlso : CalIntOptIrgNor, CalIntOpt, CalIntOptIrg

AFUMCR_EXP int CRVgetRefLeg ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Ref,
char *  Whe,
void **  LdVal 
)

Returns a list with the reference codes.

Returns a list with the reference codes. It uses the text passed in "Ref" as filter for the existent references. Also, there is the possibility to pass an extra where clause to be used in the reference selection.

Parameters
CtxDatabase access context
RefText that will be used to filter the references using it in a LIKE clause
WheWhere clause that will be added to select the references
LdVal(OUT). List of returned values. Column "val".
Returns
  • Error code (0 if OK)
Author
Gema ACHA - 21/Nov/2007.
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 20/Jun/2008: Remove some arguments. Do not oblige to pass a "1=1" if there is not any currency.

AFUMCR_EXP int CRVupdNewPnt ( void *  LdObj,
int  NewPnt 
)

Update new points flag.

Update new points flag.

  • If flag is set to 1, points have been changed and need confirmation.
  • If flag is set to 0, there is no need to modify curve points.
Parameters
LdObjObject list.
NewPntValue to set to the flag.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

Basilio TAMAYO - 18/Feb/2000

AFUMCR_EXP int CscGen ( void *  Ctx,
char *  dtCal,
char *  cc_dev,
double  cb_tau,
char *  cb_ech,
char *  cb_d1i,
int  cb_d1i_sl,

char *  cb_cpt,
int  cb_per,

double  cb_pem,
double  cb_ret,

double  cb_nom,
char *  cb_sft,
char *  cc_pay,
double  tc_rdt,
double *  prix,
double *  sensibilite,
double *  convexite 
)
Parameters
CtxDatabase connection
dtCal
cc_devCurrency.
cb_tauMontant du coupon.
cb_echMaturite du bond (date d'echeance).
cb_d1idate de debut du premier interet.
cb_d1i_slType du premier coupon.
cb_yibYield basis.
cb_acbAccrued basis.
cb_cptCoupon type.
cb_perPeriodicite.
cb_prmPrime de remboursement.
cb_pemPrix d'emission.
cb_retRetenue a la source.
tc_div
cb_nomNominal du titre.
cb_sftshifting method.
cc_pay
tc_rdt
prix
sensibilite
convexite
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Name SURNAME - DD/Mmm/2002.
Modified
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 24/Oct/2006: Add Ctx parameter.
AFUMCR_EXP int CTRcpnCalFlw ( void *  LdCtr,
int  Inx,
double  Rat,
char *  Bdt,
char *  Edt,
char *  ExaBdt,
char *  ExaEdt,
int  IsPerExa,
int  ExaSch,
double *  Cpn 
)

Calculate the coupon flow from the coupon rate.

Calculate the coupon flow from the coupon rate and depending on the period.

Parameters
LdCtrContract information list
InxLine in LdCtr where it is the desired contract
RatCoupon rate
BdtBegin date of the period to calculate the coupon. It can be different from the exact begin date of the period.
EdtEnd date of the period to calculate the coupon. It can be different from the exact end date of the period.
ExaBdtExact begin date of the period.
ExaEdtExact end date of the period.
IsPerExaFlag to indicate if the period for which the coupon flow is being calculated is exact or not. Sometimes, the first period is not exact.
ExaSchFlag to indicate if the calculations must be done with exact periods, this is, with the number of months and not with the number of days.
Cpn(OUT) Coupon flow
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 31/Oct/2001
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 20/Jan/2003. Correct the ACT/ACT method. The ACT/ACT basis of AFU is considered ACT/EXA by Cardinal
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 27/May/2004: Use ERRchk instead of ERRass when calling to DYNcbn[Chk]
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 22/Feb/2006: Add ACT/ACT_K, ACT/365_366
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Mar/2006: Add parameter Inx
  • Josune BIKUNA - 20/Jul/2007: Calculate correctly the percentage to apply to the coupon in case of defaults
  • Josune BIKUNA - 20/Jul/2007: Use MKTctrAplDfl function to apply the defaults percentage to the coupon
  • Josune BIKUNA - 23/Jul/2007: Add 'AplAlvCff' and 'AlvCff' parameters when calling to MKTctrAplDfl function
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 04/Mar/2011: Add accrued basis ACT/ACT_AUD
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Jul/2011: Long isma, divide the first period into 2
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Sep/2011: Rename ACT/ACT_AUD as ACT/ACT_RND.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 26/Jan/2017: in case of RUB currency, round coupon to 3 decimals.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 08/Mar/2017: Add basis ACT/ACT_ICMA, coupon is Rate / frequency
AFUMCR_EXP int CTRcpnEndFutRdt ( void *  LdCtr,
int  InxCtr,
char *  CalDat,
double *  EndCpn 
)

Calculate the amount of coupons that have ended but have the record date in the future.

Calculate the amount of coupons that have ended but they have the record date in the future. They must be considered as accrued. The function begins searching the coupons from the beginning.

Parameters
LdCtrContract list
InxCtrIndex of the contract in the list
CalDatCalculation date
EndCpn(out) Coupon, of the period ended before CalDat but that they have the record date in the future
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 09/Dec/2009: Use the function CTRisPdtFut to get the information if the payment date if future or not
  • Josune BIKUNA - 17/Dec/2009: If the payment date of the period is already in the past, continue with the next
  • Josune BIKUNA - 18/Dec/2009: Take into account that the given date can be closed
  • Josune BIKUNA - 24/Dec/2009: Optimise the code
  • Josune BIKUNA - 29/Mar/2010: From now on, use the record date instead of the payment date to know which are the coupons that although they have finished, they must be considered as accrued. The function has been renamed and the parameter RefBdt has been removed
AFUMCR_EXP double CTRcvtCbRet ( char *  dtDebCco,
char *  cc_dev,
double  cb_ret 
)

Return cb_ret.

Return cb_ret

  • Si deb >= '01-JAN-1997' –> cb_ret = 0.0

    Parameters
    dtDebCcoDate debut
    cc_devcurrency
    cb_retcb_ret
    Returns

AFUMCR_EXP int CTRdatesCoupons ( void *  LdCtr,
int  InxCtr,
char *  CalDat,
char *  ModDiv,
int *  RelPos,
char *  DebCco,
char *  FinCco,
double *  NxtCpn,
double *  NxtTau,
double *  NxtRmb,
int *  Per2End 
)

Retreives information of the coupon that includes one date.

Given a date it finds the coupon that includes it and returns this information: coupon init (deb), coupon end (end), coupon flow (cpn), bond interest for the coupon (tau), the nominal flow (rmb) and the number of periods.

CalDat |RelPos| DebCco | FinCco |NxtCpn |NxtTau|NxtRmb|Per2End

Previous first period| -1 |First beg.date|First beg.date| 0 | 0 | 0 |NbPer-1 Living period | 0 |Begin date |End date | Cpn | Tau | Rmb |NbPer-CntPer-1 Posterior last period| 1 |Last end date |Last end date | Cpn | Tau | Rmb | 0

| | | |0(ExDiv)| | |

  • In case the given date is equal to coupon end date, it is considered it is in the next coupon and the accrued will be 0.0.
Parameters
LdCtrContract list
InxCtrIndex of the contract in the list
CalDatCalculation date
ModDiv
RelPos(Out) Relative position of CalDat in the contract. -1 CalDat is previous the first coupon period of the contract 0 CalDat is in the living period of the contract +1 CalDat is posterior to the last coupon period of the contract
DebCco(Out) Begin date of the period where CalDat is
FinCco(Out) End date of the period where CalDat is
NxtCpn(Out) Coupon, of the period where CalDat is, really paid. The coupon amount will be: Notional * cpn / 100
NxtTau(Out) Face coupon of the period where CalDat is
NxtRmb(Out) Reimbursement of the period where CalDat is
Per2End(Out) Number of complete periodes from CalDat until the maturity of the contract
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 05/Sep/2014
See Also
CTRdatesCouponsTce
AFUMCR_EXP int CTRdatesCouponsTce ( void *  LdCtr,
int  InxCtr,
char *  CalDat,
char *  ModDiv,
int  TcpIed,
int *  RelPos,
char *  DebCco,
char *  FinCco,
double *  NxtCpn,
double *  NxtTau,
double *  NxtRmb,
int *  Per2End 
)

Retreives information of the coupon that includes one date.

Given a date it finds the coupon that includes it and returns this information: coupon init (deb), coupon end (end), coupon flow (cpn), bond interest for the coupon (tau), the nominal flow (rmb) and the number of periods.

CalDat |RelPos| DebCco | FinCco |NxtCpn |NxtTau|NxtRmb|Per2End

Previous first period| -1 |First beg.date|First beg.date| 0 | 0 | 0 |NbPer-1 Living period | 0 |Begin date |End date | Cpn | Tau | Rmb |NbPer-CntPer-1 Posterior last period| 1 |Last end date |Last end date | Cpn | Tau | Rmb | 0

| | | |0(ExDiv)| | |

  • In case the given date is equal to coupon end date, this function gives the possibility to consider:
  • - if the date belongs to next coupon, so the accrued will be 0.0
  • - if the date belongs to the current coupon, and the total (full) coupon is returned
Parameters
LdCtrContract list
InxCtrIndex of the contract in the list
CalDatCalculation date
ModDiv
TcpIedTotal coupon in end date (0/1). In case the given date is equal to coupon end date, this flag determinates the behaviour:
  • 0: if it must be considered that the date belongs to the next coupon, so the accrued coupon is 0.0
  • 1: if it must be considered that the date belongs to the current coupon, so the total current coupon is returned The 'normal' behaviour is 0, and in very limited occasions this parameter will be used as 1.
RelPos(Out) Relative position of CalDat in the contract. -1 CalDat is previous the first coupon period of the contract 0 CalDat is in the living period of the contract +1 CalDat is posterior to the last coupon period of the contract
DebCco(Out) Begin date of the period where CalDat is
FinCco(Out) End date of the period where CalDat is
NxtCpn(Out) Coupon, of the period where CalDat is, really paid. The coupon amount will be: Notional * cpn / 100
NxtTau(Out) Face coupon of the period where CalDat is
NxtRmb(Out) Reimbursement of the period where CalDat is
Per2End(Out) Number of complete periodes from CalDat until the maturity of the contract
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Modified
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 10/Apr/2000. Eliminate DYNread
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 01/Jul/2002. Per2End when previous to the start of contract
  • Josune BIKUNA - 05/Sep/2002. If the required date is bigger that the last coupon period end date, the information recovered must correspond to the last coupon.
  • Edurne GORDOA - 30/Sep/2003: Avoid compilation warnings
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 27/May/2004: Use ERRchk instead of ERRass when calling to DYNcbn[Chk]
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 13/Sep/2006: Improve comments of NxtCpn
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Oct/2008: Change name to some parameters to adapt to Almis rules.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 05/Sep/2014: Add the management of 'TcpIed' parameter. See description
See Also
CTRdatesCoupons

Parameters
LdCtr(in/out) Contract list
Returns
Error code. 0: Ok

AFUMCR_EXP int CTRfinCcoGen ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdCtr,
int  InxCtr,
char *  CalDat,
char *  ModDiv,
double *  Cco,
int *  NbjCco 
)

Calculate the accrued coupon and the number of days to next payment date.

Calculate the accrued coupon and the number of days to next payment date

  • In case the given date is equal to coupon end date, it is considered it is in the next coupon and the accrued will be 0.0.
  • IMPORTANT: The past coupons that have ended but have not paied yet must be considered as accrued also, that is, theis coupon amount must be added to the calculated accrued coupon.
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdCtrList of contracts
InxCtrIndex of the contract in the list
CalDatCalculation date
ModDiv
Cco(Out) accrued coupon.
NbjCco(Out) Number of accrued days; since the current coupon started
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 05/Sep/2014
See Also
CTRfinCcoGenTce
AFUMCR_EXP int CTRfinCcoGenTce ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdCtr,
int  InxCtr,
char *  CalDat,
char *  ModDiv,
int  TcpIed,
double *  Cco,
int *  NbjCco 
)

Calculate the accrued coupon and the number of days to next payment date.

Calculate the accrued coupon and the number of days to next payment date

  • In case the given date is equal to coupon end date, this function gives the possibility to consider:
  • - if the date belongs to next coupon, so the accrued will be 0.0
  • - if the date belongs to the current coupon, and the total (full) coupon is returned
  • IMPORTANT: The past coupons that have ended but have not paied yet must be considered as accrued also, that is, their coupon amount must be added to the calculated accrued coupon.
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdCtrList of contracts
InxCtrIndex of the contract in the list
CalDatCalculation date
ModDiv
TcpIedTotal coupon in end date (0/1). In case the given date is equal to coupon end date, this flag determinates the behaviour:
  • 0: if it must be considered that the date belongs to the next coupon, so the accrued coupon is 0.0
  • 1: if it must be considered that the date belongs to the current coupon, so the total current coupon is returned The 'normal' behaviour is 0, and in very limited occasions this parameter will be used as 1.
Cco(Out) accrued coupon.
NbjCco(Out) Number of accrued days; since the current coupon started
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Modified
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 13/Jul/1999: OIS, LdMkt is in LdCtr
  • Edurne GORDOA - 08/Mar/2000: parameteres in call to MKTfxgCalRat

  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 20/Nov/2001. Modify JPY
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Nov/2001. Add curve name as parameter to MKTfxgCalRat
  • Edurne GORDOA - 09/Apr/2002. Carried from ctrBond.c
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 22/May/2003: arrondMethod instead of Fround
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 22/Feb/2006: Add new methods: ACT/ACT_K and ACT/365_366
  • Josune BIKUNA - 11/May/2006. Init the returned values 'Cco' and 'NbjCco' to 0 at the beginning of the function. It is to remove possible previous values.
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 14/JUL/2006: Substitute g_gc_ctx by a call to GBgetCtx().
  • Ismael SERRANO - 11/Oct/2006: Use MTHfinRnd instead of arrondMethod.
  • Ismael SERRANO - 11/Oct/2006: Use MTHfinRnd instead of Ftruncate.
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 18/Oct/2006: Add AFUccyGetIntDta function and Ctx parameter.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 13/Jul/2007: Read CST mktYldCal to see how to calculate floating coupons

  • Josune BIKUNA - 29/Mar/2010: From now on, use the record date instead of the payment date to know which are the coupons that although they have finished, they must be considered as accrued. The function CTRcpnEndNpy has been renamed to CTRcpnEndFutRdt

  • Basilio TAMAYO - 08/Mar/2017: Treat new basis ACT/ACT_ICMA like ACT/ACT
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Nov/2017: Treat the case of russian issues; always with basis ACT/365. If it is public, use the coupon type; if private the facial rate of the issue.

CTRscGen CTRrendementGen
AFUMCR_EXP int CTRfxgCalFlw ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
void *  LdCfx,
int  InxFlwToFix,
void *  LdMkt0,
void *  LdCtr0,
int  InxCtr,
int  CalRat,
int  CalRatSpd,
int  CalCpn 
)

Contract variable bond fixing calculation.

Contract variable bond fixing calculation. This treatment has 3 steps:

  • - Get the rate from the curve. It can be skipped and the rate will be taken from the list passed as parameter.
  • - Calculate the total rate, this is, with all the spreads. It can be skipped and the total rate will be taken from the list passed as parameter.
  • - Calculate the coupon. It can be skipped and the coupon flow will be taken from the list passed as parameter.
  • It is possible to do the calculations only for a coupon or for all of them. See InxFlwToFix parameter.
Parameters
CtxDatabase conection
DatFixing date
LdCfxList of variable bond coupons to fix
InxFlwToFixIndex of the coupon for which tha calculation are done. If it is -1, all the coupons are get.
LdMkt0Market data list with the fixing curves (optional). The function will get it if it is NULL.
LdCtr0Contract list (optional). The function will get it if it is NULL
InxCtrIndex of the contract in LdCtr0
CalRatGet the rate from the fixing curve (1: Yes;0: No)
CalRatSpdCalculate the total rate, this is the rate with all the spreads (1:Yes; 0:No)
CalCpnCalculate the coupon flow (1: Yes;0: No)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 18/Oct/2001
CTRfxgCalFlw (Ctx, "13-MAR-2001", "c", LdCfx, 0, 1, 1, 1)
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 07/Nov/2001: Remove currency parameter. The currency is in the schedule definition.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 09/Nov/2001: Use CTRcpnCalFlw to calculate coupon flow
  • Josune BIKUNA - 17/Dec/2001: deb->bdt, fin->edt at the begining, and the contrary at the end.
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 28/Jan/2002: Add LdCtr0 parameter to avoid accessing to DB
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 26/Mar/2003: Not ERRchk after ERRend
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 27/May/2004: Use ERRchk instead of ERRass when calling to DYNcbn[Chk]
  • Iker ZURIARRAIN - 12/Oct/2005. Add parameter to MKTfxgChk
  • Iker ZURIARRAIN - 20/Oct/2005. Remove IsCur parameter from MKTfxgChk.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Mar/2006: Added parameter Inx to CTRcpnCalFlw.
  • Ismael SERRANO - 22/08/2006: Added InxCtr parameter.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 13/Jul/2007: Add parameter LdMkt0. The rate may be in a column called "rat" or "tau"

)

Parameters
CtxDatabase connection
LdCtrContract list
InxCtrLine number of the list

ModDiv
DpcDirty price

AFUMCR_EXP int CTRscGen ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdCtr,
int  InxCtr,
char *  CalDat,
char *  ModDiv,
double  Yld,
double *  Dpc,
double *  Sns,
double *  Cvx 
)

Calculation of dirty price, sensitivity and convexity from yield.

Calculation of dirty price, sensitivity and convexity from yield

Parameters
CtxDatabase connection
LdCtrContract list
InxCtrLine number of the list
CalDatCalculation date. For the deals: the value date. For the market data: the settlement date
ModDiv
YldYield in %/100 (example 0.05345 that means 5.345%)
Dpc(OUT) dirty price
Sns(OUT) sensitivity
Cvx(OUT) convexity
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Modified
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 10/Apr/2000. Eliminate DYNread
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 20/Nov/2001. Modify JPY
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 03/Jan/2002. Function header
  • Edurne GORDOA - 09/Apr/2002. Carried from ctrBond.c
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 25/Jun/2002. Treat zero periodicites
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/Jan/2003: Treat zero frequencies
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 22/May/2003: arrondMethod instead of Fround
  • Edurne GORDOA - 30/Sep/2003: Avoid compilation warnings
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 06/Nov/2003. Not use CTRgetPer.
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 26/May/2004: call to CrendementGen and CscGen with ERRchk
  • Josune BIKUNA - 22/Dec/2004. Modify the explatnation of the yield parameter because it must be in %/100 format instead of %
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 23/Feb/2006: Add new bases: ACT/ACT_K, ACT/365_366, NL/365
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 13/Jun/2006: Reorganise the code
  • Jesus Maria GARCIA - 30/Jun/2006: Add new base: Letras18/365
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 14/Jul/2006: Letras18*: change limit 376D to 1Y
  • Ismael SERRANO - 11/Oct/2006: Use MTHfinRnd instead of arrondMethod.
  • Ismael SERRANO - 11/Oct/2006: Use MTHfinRnd instead of Ftruncate.
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 18/Oct/2006: Add AFUccyGetPrcDev function and Ctx parameter.
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 15/Jun/2007: Improve description of CalDat
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 13/Jul/2007: Read application optin mktYldCal to see how to calculate floating coupons.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 17/Jun/2009: Add ACT/365_SMP base management. It is the same as ACT_365 with the difference that it only takes the final redemption premium to calculate the price and not the coupons (any of them)
  • Josune BIKUNA - 29/Jul/2009: When treating the floating bond type, skip the treatment in case the base is 'ACT/365_SMP'
  • Josune BIKUNA - 25/Nov/2009: For floating cases, for 'ACT/ACT' base, take into account that in case the calculation date is before the first period, the returned period begin and end dates are equal, so the number of year must be directly 0, otherwise a NaN will be calculated
  • Jesus Maria GARCIA - 08/Jun/2010: Use the type CLINT to call clCalDateDayGap otherwise there is a crash HP_UXia64
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 04/Mar/2011: Add accrued basis ACT/ACT_AUD
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 27/May/2011: Treat correctly the base 'ACT/365_SMP' when CalDat is greater than the maturity bond: do not add the coupon
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 07/Jun/2011: Treat long isma in ACT/ACT
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 13/Jun/2011: ACT/ACT: treat case when last period is longer/shorter
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 29/Jul/2011: ACT/ACT: treat case period is not 12M. Idem in ACT/182, ACT/365_CAD, GBP_method. Sns and Cvx are not more multiplied by FactRdtSns
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 04/Aug/2011: Undo all the changes of the 29/Jul/2011
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 04/Aug/2011: ACT/ACT + long isma + last period irregular: multiply by periodidite the irregular days
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 05/Sep/2011: Add BTP_method
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Sep/2011: Rename ACT/ACT_AUD as ACT/ACT_RND.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Sep/2011: BTP_method, in the last coupon get the end date of an imaginary extra coupon to calculate the days between end and payment date.
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 28/Nov/2011: ACT/ACT doesn't work if the frequency is not 1Y and the bond maturity is an end of month
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 02/Dec/2011: Treat "30/360_ISMA" new yield base.
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 19/Dec/2011: ACT/ACT doesn't work if the last period is not exact
  • Jon BARRUTIA & Ramon MARTINEZ - 26/Feb/2014: ACT/ACT: correct case when calculation date is previous to the begin date of the first period. We simulate that CalDat belongs to the first coupon. To avoid problems when testing that the last period is a exact period.
See Also

AFUMCR_EXP int gvSPOTgetUnit ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdSpot,
char *  DevRef,
char *  DevCvt,
double *  Spot 
)

Find the spot in Fox units for a couple of currencies in a spot list.

Find the spot in Fox units for a couple of currencies in a spot list. This function is equivalent to SPOTgetUnit but it's intended to be used when spots may not be available. When a spot cannot be found it DOES NOT show any alert message and it returns 1 instead of 0 (to avoid potential divisions by zero). Under error circumstances it returns an error code different to zero.

Parameters
CtxDB connection
LdSpotSpot list initialised with SPOTinit
DevRefReference currency
DevCvtCurrency to convert
Spot(out) Spot value in Fox units
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 02/Nov/1998
Modified
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 24/Nov/2006: Add AFUccyGetIntDta functioni and add Ctx parameter in this function.
AFUMCR_EXP int gvSPOTgetUnitDB ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Date,
char *  DevRef,
char *  DevCvt,
double *  Spot 
)

Find the spot in Fox units for a couple of currencies in the DB.

Find the spot in Fox units for a couple of currencies in the DB This function is equivalent to SPOTconv but it's intended to be used when spots may not be available. When a spot cannot be found it DOES NOT show any alert message and it returns 1 instead of 0 (to avoid potential divisions by zero). Under error circumstances it returns an error code different to zero. This function is created to enable modifying the treatment associated to a report printing (037, rapResPap) that checks spots without impacts on the others that use the same treatment (e.g. 035) but don't check spots.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DateReference date
DevRefReference currency
DevCvtCurrency to convert
Spot(out) Spot value in Fox units
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 02/Nov/1998
Modified
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 24/Nov/2006: Use AFUccyGetIntDta function instead of infEchQnt.
  • Amparo CAMARERO - 05/Nov/2012: Modify function header to match new DOXYGEN format
AFUMCR_EXP int gvSPOTScontrol ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Date,
void **  LdMisSpo 
)

Control missing spots.

Control missing spots. This function loads all the necessary spots (through the centralised function gvSPOTSgetList) and leaves all spots with at least one value at zero.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DateSpot date
LdMisSpo(out) Dynamic list to return values
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

Isma ETXEBERRIA - 11/Feb/1998
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 21/Nov/2008: Use <> instead of !=
AFUMCR_EXP int gvSPOTSgetList ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Date,
void **  LdSpotOut 
)

Get list of spots, deleting the devIn.

Get the list of all currencies (RefCurr, Curr) couples among the active currencies (RefCurr != Curr) with the existing values in the spot table. If no value is present a 0 will be obtained. Spots of the EUR zone are deleted

For each couple (dev1, dev2) two values are stored (val1, val2) for a date (dat).

Note
The calling function must carry out the error handling
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DateSpot date
LdSpotOut(out) Spots list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 08/Feb/1998
Modified
  • Isma ETXEBERRIA & Ramon MARTINEZ - 08/Feb/1998
  • Isma ETXEBERRIA & Ramon MARTINEZ - 13/Jan/1999.Delete spot or DevIn
  • Ruben SIERRA - 22/May/2002. In function DYNgenSort add param order
  • Ismael SERRANO - 21/Aug/2006. Use CSTReadPas
  • Ruben GIL -09/Nov/2006: Add Dev variable in CSTreadPasDB function
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 21/Nov/2008: Use <> instead of !=
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 06/Nov/2017: Initialise RefDev with the configured currency in AO.RefDev

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTadyChk ( void *  LdMci,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Controls ADY curves.

Controls ADY curves. We check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdMci) all ady curves come in the column 'Ady' of 'LdNec' list.
Parameters
LdMciStock list
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTasvChk ( void *  LdMci,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Controls ASV curves.

Controls ASV curves. We check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdMci) all asv curves come in the "Asv" column.
Parameters
LdMciStock list
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTaudAll ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Opr,
char *  Dpr,
char *  Dat,
char *  Trt,
void *  LdUse 
)

Audit market data.

Audit market data. The profile name for storing may be different of the profile name of the source. Read all current market data of the original profile Set the usage flag only in market data of the list of used market data (LdUse)

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
OprProfile of the origin of the market data
DprProfile for storing market data
DatAudit date
TrtTreatment code for which we must stock market data.
LdUseList of used market data (imc, Usg)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Note
This function is called from within a transaction
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 20/Apr/1999
Modified
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 27/Sep/2000. Stock data with other profile name
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 14/Mar/2002: use mkt_dta_trt_aud
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 27/Mar/2002: fix bug
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/May/2006: Add the usage flag in market data auditory table.
    • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add market data type parameter with empty value when calling to auditory function
    • Lorea NAVARRO - 23/Dec/2008: Modify the second parameter to MKTaudLst function
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Jul/2010: Audit also the index field (Idx)
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 03/Feb/2012: Add field Vdt.
See Also
MKTaudAllLd

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTaudLst ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdAuxDta,
char *  Pro,
char *  Dat,
char *  Typ,
char *  Trt,
void *  LdUse 
)

Audit market data given in a list.

Audit market data given in a list

  • These are the steps:
  • - Add profile, date, treatment and usage flag to market data list.
  • - Delete from database auditory for current date, profile and treatment. The user has the possibility to delete only one market data type. for instance, if the given market data list only contains that kind of market data values. See parameters.
  • - Save in market data auditory table the market data in LdDta.
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdAuxDtalist of market data to save in database (imc, val, sta, src -> adds pro, dat, mth, Usg)
ProProfile for storing market data
DatAuditory date
TypMarket data type (Epr, Fpr, Pri, Cds, ...). If empty or NULL, all types will be audited
TrtTreatment code for which we must stock market data.
LdUseList of maket data used for the treatment (imc, Usg)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Note
This function is called from within a transaction
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2006
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 31/Oct/2007: Convert it to public. Add the parameter Typ to give the possibility to audit only one market data type
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 11/Dec/2008: Audit only the used market data.
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 23/Dec/2008: Incrment the size of FrmMcd
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 23/Dec/2008: Modify the the second parameter to this function
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t

char *  Mth,
char *  Pro 
)

Get a profile that does not exist in the market data auditory table.

Get a profile that does not exist in the market data auditory table.

Parameters

MthMethod from which take the profile
Pro(out) Next profile. Must have allocated memory to write in with type PRO_TYPE.
Returns
  • Error code (0 if OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Nov/2008

char *  Pro,
char *  Dat,
char *  Typ 
)

Audit as 'afg' the revaluation mkt data values corresponding to a market data type.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTaudUsv ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdPro,
void *  LdTyp 
)

Audit current market data values in the treatment historic mkt data table as 'usv' trt.

Audit current market data values in the treatment historic market data values table as 'User saved data' ('usv') treatment, for the required profiles and market data types. The market data is audited for the application date.

  • If no profiles are required, all the official profiles will be taken
  • If no market data types are required, all the market data types will be taken
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdProList of profiles for which the market data values must be saved. If it is NULL, all the official profiles will be taken. It must have at least a column 'pro'.
LdTypList of market data types for which the market data values must be saved. If it is NULL, all the types will be taken. It must have at least a column 'typ'.
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 05/Nov/2007
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 30/Nov/2007: Save the market data for the application date instead of for system date
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 23/Dec/2008: Modify the calles to MKTaudLst function, in the LdDta parameter
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Jul/2010: Use function MKTgetOffPro to get all official profiles.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTbcoGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load historic base correlation curves into a single data structure.

Load historic base correlation curves into a single data structure. We may have some indications in LdMkt on which curves are necessary.

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatCalculation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 16/Jul/2007
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 26/Jul/2007: use MKTcrvFre instead of MKTyldFree
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 16/Jun/2009: Add Ctx parameter to MKTmcdSetImc function.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Feb/2012: Use standard function MKTgetHisDta
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTbetCal ( void *  LdTra,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Calculate beta prices. Obtain a list with betas between: Ass1 and Ass2; Ass2 and Ass1.

Calculate beta prices. Obtain a list with betas between: Ass1 and Ass2; Ass2 and Ass1 But take into account that indirect betas are not generated; that is, if there is a beta A –> B and another B –> C there is NOT calculated the beta A –> C

Parameters
LdTraDeals object
LdMktMarket data structure with list of beta
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 17/May/2004
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 24/May/2004: Add inverted betas in each iteration.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 29/Jul/2004: Correct error in field "itr"
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 17/Dec/2004: Get only betas and its inverse and not all combinations
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 15/Jul/2005: Modify the description of the function
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 03/Aug/2005: change algorithm to make the function faster. Avoid DYNjoins with large lists
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 04/Nov/2005: Undo last modification
  • David ROMERO - 20/Apr/2015: Avoid Sonar warning (redundant asignment to itself) for unused parameter

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTbetCnvVer ( void *  LdTra,
void *  LdBet,
void *  LdVer,
void **  LdRes 
)

Convert a list of deals/positions into equivalent positions within a list of vertexes.

Convert a list of deals/positions into equivalent positions within a list of vertexes

  • For each deal, get the most suitable vertex (from the list of vertexes) and the factor to convert the position in the original contract into the vertex (beta).
  • Make the convertion of positions

  • Group the new positions by vertex

    Parameters
    LdTraList of deals/positions. Columns: ctr, ntl
    LdBetBeta prices list
    LdVerList of valid vertexes for the treatment
    LdRes(out) List of deals/positions converted into positions of valid vertexes. Columns: ver, ntl.
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 21/May/2004
    Modified
    • Ruben GIL - 05/Apr/2013: Use size_t in DYNajoutexCol
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTbetExs ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Cod,
int *  Exs 
)

Indicates if a contract has associated beta or not.

Indicates if a contract has associated beta or not

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
CodContract
ExsFlag that indicates if a contract has associated beta or not. 1:yes; 0:no
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Aitziber BARRERO - 11/May/2009
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 01/Dec/2009: Almis rules.
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTbetFndAssBet ( void *  LdBet,
char *  Ass,
void *  LdVer,
char **  Ver,
double *  Bet 
)

For a given asset, search the most suitable vertex and its correspondent beta.

For a given asset, search the most suitable vertex from a list of vertexes and its correspondent beta

  • If the asset itself is in the list of valid vertexes, the beta is 1.0 and the vertex is the asset itself.
  • If not, search in the list of betas those with the asset against any vertex in the lists.

  • If there are more than one vertex in the list of betas, get the one with less iterations. NOTE : IS OBLAGATORY that the beta list (LdBet) must be have the all betas defined (With price or not price). If this list contain only the beta with its prices, this function visualized always the message: "Missing beta definition" For obtain the all beta list with its prices or not prices call to MKTbetGetAllBet function

    Parameters
    LdBetList of calculated betas
    AssFirst asset of the searched beta
    LdVerList of valid vertexes of the searched beta. Vertex column (cod) must be the first column
    Ver(out) Selected second asset. It reserves memory to save it; so, it must be liberated.
    Bet(out) Beta price between both assets
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 18/May/2004
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 21/May/2004: Change parameter names
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 26/Jul/2004: If Ass is in the list of vertex, the beta should be 1.0
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 15/Oct/2004: Verify if LdBet exists; otherwise, missing beta warning
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Oct/2004: Add seeAlso
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 27/Oct/2004: Change the column name from "ver" to "cod"
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Jul/2005: Complete description of function header
    • Lorea NAVARRO - 13/May/2009: Add new message in the warning (MIS_BET_VAL) and change the MISSING_BETA by MIS_BET_DFN
    See Also
    MKTbetGetAllBet,MKTbetFndBet

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTbetIniBetDfl ( void *  Ctx)

Initialises the existent beta definition with a default value.

Initialises the existent beta definition with a default value. This default value is taken from a cst constant which identifier is = "afuDflBet". If there is not a valid value into this flag, a 1.0 is used as a default value.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Jon BARRUTIA - 21/Jul/2006

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdiChk ( void *  LdTra,
int  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Controls CDSi curves.

Controls CDSi curves. We check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdTra) all cdsi curves come in the "crvCdi" column.
Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historic data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historic)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 25/May/2006
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 31/May/2006: Case there are not CDSI curves
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 07/Nov/2007: NO_VAL_PNT is an MKT_TRT error (generic for all MKT files)
  • Amparo CAMARERO - 05/Nov/2012: Modify function header to match new DOXYGEN format

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdiGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load historic CDSi prices into a single data structure, LdMkt.

Load historic CDSi prices into a single data structure, LdMkt

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatDate
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 30/May/2006:
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter when calling to MKTcrvGetHis
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
See Also
MKTcdiChk, MKTcdiCal

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdiTweCal ( char *  CalDat,
void **  LdMkt,
double  ShfVal 
)

Calculate tweaking of CDSI curves.

Calculate tweaking of CDSI curves.

  • For each CDSI curve
  • + For each point
  • - Duplicate the complete CDSI curve
  • - Shift a given value the value of the point of the CDSI curve
  • - Calculate the CPI curve associated with the shifted CDSI curve

  • - Save the CPI and CDSI shifted curves

    Parameters
    CalDatCalculation date
    LdMkt(in/out) Initial market data. Must have (checked and calculated) at least CDS curves, CPS curves, yield curves and recovery rates. Will add "CpiTwe"
    ShfValShifting value
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 31/May/2006
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 29/Mar/2007: Do not save shifted CDSI curves.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/May/2007: Undo last modification

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdsBskCal ( char *  Dat,
void *  LdTra,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Calculate CDS baskets.

Calculate CDS baskets. Calculate the alive weight of each basket. Since one or serveral components of a basket can be defaulted, the alive weight may not be 100.0 Calculate the time to default matrix by basket only for NTD deals.

In this function we add the Alv column to LlCdsBsk list with the weight basket.

Parameters
DatCalculation date
LdTra
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 02/Mar/2006
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Mar/2006: Not calculation. Matrix will be calcualted only it is really required. Matrix calculation is very expensive in time consumption.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Mar/2006: Calculate the total weight of a basket.
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 17/Mar/2007: Calculate the time to default matrix.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Mar/2007: Use macrodefinition CDSBSK_RDD_MCI. Manage destruction of matrix.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/May/2007: Make number of simulations always odd
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 17/May/2007: Always add Alv column
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 17/Jul/2007: Add CDO to get simulation matrix
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 05/Oct/2007: Change NthDefSim by MciDefSim
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 08/Oct/2007: Free matrix MtxCor and MtxTdf. Dont calcul the MtxTdf
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 24/Nov/2007: Add LdCdosc getting cds baskets
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 02/Dec/2007: Remove MciDefSim
  • Gema ACHA - 04/Dec/2007: Correct compilation errors
  • David ROMERO - 20/Apr/2015: Avoid Sonar warning (redundant asignment to itself) for unused parameter

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdsChk ( void *  LdTra,
int  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt,
int  ChkBsk 
)

Controls CDS curves.

Controls CDS curves. We check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdTra) all cds curves come in the "crvCds" column.
  • In the market data object (LdMkt) CDS baskets require CDS.
  • Mark the cds not used for NTD and CDO product in anaitycal method
Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historical data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historic)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
ChkBskFlag values
  • 0 no check references of CDS baskets.
  • 1 check references of CDS baskets getting all cds.
  • 2 check ref of CDS baskets getting only ref of montecarlo bsk method.
  • (For CDSI we get all the references)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Edurne GORDOA - 10/Apr/2003
Modified
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 27/May/2004: Use ERRchk instead of ERRass when calling to DYNcbn[Chk]
  • Iker ZURIARRAIN - 12/Oct/2005. Add IsCur parameter and give MIS_HIS_CRV warning when there's missing curve data and we're working with historics.
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 01/Feb/2006: Add comment done in the last modification (AFUdatCurHis is used instead of datCurHis for IsCur)
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Feb/2006: Check only distinct CDS curves. Change type of parameter IsCur Check that all points have valid value.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 03/Mar/2006: Pay attention to CDS basket references.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 08/Feb/2007: Add parameter ChkBsk to check (or not) also basket references.
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 08/Aug/2007: Add MKTcdsGetCdsUse to get only the cds used
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 07/Nov/2007: NO_VAL_PNT is an MKT_TRT error (generic for all MKT files)
  • Edurne GORDOA - 12/Nov/2012: Avoid doxygen warnings

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdsGetCalRes ( void *  LdCal,
double *  ValCpo,
double *  ValPpo,
double *  ValCre,
double *  ValPre 
)

Calculate CDS total values cpo, ppo, cre, pre.

Calculate CDS total values cpo, ppo, cre, pre – cpo : Potential for the coupon part – ppo : Potential for the principal part – cre : Realised for the coupon part – pre : Realised for the principal part

Parameters
LdCalPayment date list.
ValCpo(out) Potential for the coupon part.
ValPpo(out) Potential for the principal part.
ValCre(out) Realised for the coupon part.
ValPre(out) Realised for the principal part.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Manuel SANMARTIN - 26/Jan/2006.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdsGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load historic cds curves into a single data structure.

Load historic cds curves into a single data structure. We may have some indications in LdMkt on which curves are necessary.

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatCalculation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Alex RODRIGUEZ - 04/Jun/2004.
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 01/Mar/2006: get also the CpsYld column
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2006: get also field src
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Oct/2006: Not use static variable for column indexes
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 02/Aug/2007: Use MKTcrvFre instead of lcMKTcdsFree.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 03/Oct/2007: Use standard function MKTcrvGetHis.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter when calling to MKTcrvGetHis
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
  • Edurne GORDOA - 12/Nov/2012: Avoid doxygen warnings

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdsIniFlw ( char *  Bdt,
char *  Edt,
int  Mat,
char *  Unt,
char *  Dev,
char *  Adj,
char *  Pfl,
char *  Bas,
char *  Shl,
char *  Brk,
char *  EndMth,
char *  YldCrv,
char *  CdsCrv,
double  Spr,
double  Ntl,
void **  LdFlw 
)

Simulate the list of flows of a CDS operation.

Simulate the list of flows of a CDS operation

  • - LdFlw: List of flows:
  • + bdt: Begin date
  • + edt: End date
  • + pdt: Payment date
  • + dev: Currency
  • + crv: Curve name
  • + crvCds: CDS curve name
  • + bas: Calculation basis
  • + ide: Flow type (Interest, Fees, Default)
  • + mrk: Flag of flows to calculate.
  • + leg: Leg to calcul (0: Both, 1: Default, 2: Protection)
  • + ntl: Nominal
  • + cpn: Coupon, interest calculated (spr * aph)
  • + mat: Number of period frequency
  • + unt: unit of the period frequency
  • + Rrt: Recovery rate
  • + cpo: Potential for the coupon part
  • + ppo: Potential for the principal part
  • + cre: Realised for the coupon part

  • + pre: Realised for the principal part

    Parameters
    BdtBegin date of the fictitious operatoin
    EdtEnd date of the fictitious operatoin
    MatPeriod of flows
    UntUnit of time of the periods
    DevCds curve currency.
    AdjAdjustment: "Yes", "No"
    PflAdjustment method: follwing, modify following, ...
    BasCalculation basis
    ShlType of first irregular period: "Long", "Short"
    BrkBroken period: "End", "Begin"
    EndMthAdjustment at the end of month: "Yes", "No"
    YldCrvYield curve name (for discount factors)
    CdsCrvCDS/CPS curve name and recovery rate code.
    SprSpread
    NtlNotional
    LdFlw(out) List of flow periods
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 27/Feb/2006
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Mar/2006: Add column for recovery rate: Rrt
    • Ramon MARTINEZ - 20/Mar/2006: Correct treatment of closed/open dates
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Mar/2006: Use enum value CPS_LEG_BOTH
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Apr/2006: Multiply the coupon by the notional. Use more generic function to get list os periods: AFUdatGetLstDat. Add parameters Adj and Shl.
    • Ramon MARTINEZ - 16/Jun/2006: Add Dev to the list
    • Josune BIKUNA - 25/Sep/2007: Add AdjScp parameter with value 'All' when calling to AFUdatGetLstDat function
    • Josune BIKUNA - 13/Nov/2007: From now on, the AFUdatGetLstDat function receives a list of currencies instead of only one currency
    • Josune BIKUNA - 14/Nov/2007: Rename AdjScp -> AdjSco
    • Manuel SANMARTIN - 05/Feb/2010: Add the broken period and EndMth in AFUdatGetLstDat

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdsTweCal ( char *  CalDat,
void **  LdMkt,
double  ShfVal 
)

Calculate tweaking of CDS curves.

Calculate tweaking of CDS curves.

  • For each CDS curve
  • + For each point
  • - Duplicate the complete CDS curve
  • - Shift a given value all points from current point till the last point of curve
  • - Calculate the CPS curve associated with the shifted CDS curve

  • - Save the CPS curve and discard the CDS curve

    Parameters
    CalDatCalculation date
    LdMkt(in/out) Initial market data. Must have (checked and calculated) at least CDS curves, CPS curves, yield curves and recovery rates. Will add "CdsTwe" and "CpsTwe"
    ShfValShifting value
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Mar/2006
    • Manuel SANMARTIN - 28/Mar/2006: Change ValDat by CalDat.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 04/Apr/2006: carry from mktCps.c
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Oct/2006: check if there is CDS curves before calculation
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 25/Jun/2007: Save also tweaked CDS curves in object CdsTwe.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 02/Aug/2007: Use MKTcrvFind instead of MKTcdsFind and MKTcpsFnd
    • Manuel SANMARTIN - 07/Aug/2007: Add control with DYNgetNbLignes
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcdsTweFnd ( void *  LlCpsTwe,
char *  Crv,
void **  LdCpsTwe 
)

Find the list of tweaking curves of a CDS curve.

Find the list of tweaking curves of a CDS curve

Parameters
LlCpsTweList of CPS curves from shifted CDS curves
CrvCurve name
LdCpsTwe(out) Tweaking CPS curve list pointer (do not destroy!!)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Mar/2006
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 04/Apr/2006: carry from mktCps.c
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Jun/2007: Not use static variable columns

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcorBldCorMtx ( void *  LdMkt,
char *  Bsk,
double  Cor,
MATRIX *  MtxCor 
)

Build the correlation matrix using the basket correlation value.

Build the correlation matrix. The correlation value between

  • the same entities is 1.0. We dont use the curve correlation of basket.
  • To build the matrix we use the same correlation value between entities.
  • If we want to use specifics correlations values between entities the
  • input correlation value must be 0.0 >= Cor > 1.0, and we search the
  • value from MKTcorFndCor function.
Parameters
LdMktList of market data
BskBasket name
CorCorrelation value
MtxCor(out) Correlation matrix.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Manuel SANMARTIN - 01/Mar/2006.
Modified
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 26/Feb/2007: Build the correlation matrix using the market data structure.
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 14/May/2007: Use MTXone for basket with one ref.
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 10/Oct/2007: Add Cor value like parameter function.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcorCalAssCor ( void *  LdAss,
void **  LdCor 
)

Return a list with different pair of correlation between a list of assets.

Return a list with different pair of correlation between a list of assets.

Parameters
LdAssAsset List. It must be sorted by asset code and It must has "Ass", "NumKop", "MciCod", "Dev" columns defined where:
  • Ass: Asset code.
  • NumKop: Deal number. It can be '' but not NULL.
  • MciCod: Code of instrumen. It can be '' but not NULL.
  • Dev: Currency.
LdCor(out) Correlation prices list. It must exist and it has to have the follogin columns defined, "AssOne", "AssTwo", "Num", "MciCod", "Dev", "AssOneUmc", "AssTwoUmc" where :
  • AssOne: Asset one code.
  • AssTwo: Asset two code.
  • Num: Deal number.
  • MciCod: Code of instrument.
  • Dev: Currency.
  • AssOneUmc: Umc of AssOne.
  • AssTwoUmc: Umc of AssTwo.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Alex RODRIGUEZ - 27/Jul/2009:
Modified
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 28/Sep/2009: Returns also column dev.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t
  • Amparo CAMARERO - 15/Nov/2012: Modify function header to match new DOXYGEN format
