AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcpHisImc ( void *  Ctx,
char *  SrcImc,
char *  DstImc,
char *  BegDat,
char *  EndDat,
double  Fct 
)

Copy historic values from a market datum into another one (it is possible to apply a conversion factor to the price value). If the value is 1 no real conversion is applied.

Copy historic values from a market datum into another one (it is possible to apply a conversion factor to the price value). If the value is 1 no real conversion is applied Copy all historic market data from an imc into another imc between two dates and for all profiles It saves the market data with 8 decimals.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
SrcImcInternal market code source
DstImcInternal market code destination
BegDatBegin date
EndDatEnd date
FctConversion factor. It is applied to the price value
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 05/Apr/2001
Modified
  • Edurne GORDOA - 15/Apr/2002. Separate interface with engines and C treatment
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 02/Aug/2006: Use GBinsereEnBlocFmt instead of GBinsereEnBloc.
  • Jose M.NUNEZ - 27/May/2008: Use gb_lck_srd instead of syb_lck_shared
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 15/Feb/2010: Add Fct parameter. It is a conversion factor to can apply to the prices. If you want to mantein the same value put Fct as '1'
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Feb/2012: Call GBdmdLckTab with ERRchkGb instead of ERRchk
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcpiCal ( char *  CalDat,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Calculate CPI curves.

Calculate CPI curves.

  • CPI curves have not get and check functions. They are calculated from the CDSI curves. So, before calling this function the CDI and yield calcules must have been finished correctly

    LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcpsCal ( char *  CalDat,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Calculate CPS curves.

Calculate CPS curves.

  • CPS curves have not get and check functions. They are calculated from the CDS curves. So, before calling this function the CDS, yield and "recovery rate" calcules must have been finished correctly

    Parameters
    CalDatCalculation date
    LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Feb/2006
    Modified
    • Manuel SANMARTIN - 28/Mar/2006: Change ValDat by CalDat.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcpsCalBpv ( void *  LdSch,
void *  LdCps,
void *  LdYld,
char *  Dat,
char *  Bas,
int  BlmApx,
double *  Bpv 
)

Calculate BPV of CDS/CDSI option deals or CPS points.

Calculate BPV of CDS/CDSI option deals or CPS points. It adds to the schedule list (LdSch) some columns with some results:

  • Ryf: Risky factor forward (also called DV01fwd)
  • Dsf: Discount factor forward
  • Psf: Probability of solvency forward
Parameters
LdSch(in/out). Schedule list
LdCpsCps curve list
LdYldYld curve list
DatCalculation date
BasBase
BlmApxBloomberg aproximation (1) or not (0). Bloomberg aproximation means that the basis is rounded to the nearest integer
Bpv(out)Bpv
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Ruben GIL - 14/Jun/2007
Modified
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 10/Oct/2007: Only treat interest cashflows
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 19/Oct/2007: Basis calculation similar than Bloomberg depending on "BlmApx"
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 24/Oct/2007: Add some columns with some calculations
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcpsCalCpsCds ( int  CpsTyp,
char *  CalDat,
void *  LdMkt,
char *  CdsCrv 
)

Calculate CPS curve from one CDS curve using bisection method.

Calculate CPS curve from one CDS curve using bisection method. Calculate BPV for points of the curve

  • CPS : Solvency Probability Curve.
  • We need a CDS curve from one issuer (reference), the value date and the zero-coupon curve.
  • For each CDS curve point we need to know the maturity date, the basis, the spread and payment period.
  • This function calculates the lambdas (CPS curve) values for one CDS curve.
  • The structure of the CPS curve can be found in the descrition of the file
Parameters
CpsTypType of CPS. See type mkt_cps_typ for details
CalDatCalculation Date.
LdMktMarket data structure
CdsCrvCds curve code
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Manuel SANMARTIN - 20/Jul/2005.
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Feb/2006: Use LdMkt structure to encapsulate different market data
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 28/Mar/2006: Change ValDat by CalDat.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Oct/2006: Adapt it for CPI curves. New parameter CpsTyp
  • Ruben GIL - 28/May/2007: Add BPV column in the points of CDS curve list
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 02/Aug/2007: Use MKTcrvFind instead of MKTcdsFind
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcpsCalFrmPso ( char *  CalDat,
void *  LdPso,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Calculate CPS curves from a list of solvency probability.

Calculate CPS curves.

  • This function is useful to calculate CPS curves from lists of solvency probability. The list of solvency probability must have the following columns:
  • + Cie: Name of the counterparty the solvency is for. Will be the CPS curve code
  • + Dat: Date

  • + SvlPbl: Probability of solvency of counterparty Cie in date Dat, referred to CalDat. This values must be between 0.0 and 1.0

    Parameters
    CalDatCalculation date
    LdPsoList of probability of solvency
    LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list.
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Apr/2015
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcpsCdsVal ( int  CpsTyp,
char *  CalDat,
char *  ValDat,
void *  LdMkt,
void *  LdCal 
)

CDS value for a cds flow list using one Cps curve.

CDS value for a cds flow list using one Cps curve. – LdCal : – bdt : Begin date – edt : End date – pdt : Payment date – crv : Yield curve name – crvCds/crvCdi: CDS curve code. Same code to get CPS curve and recovery rate – ide : Flow type (Interest, Fees, Default) – mrk : Flag to calculate flow – leg : Leg to calcul. See cps_leg_typ for details – ntl : Nominal – cpn : Coupon, interest calculated (spr * aph) – cpo : Potential for the coupon part – ppo : Potential for the principal part – cre : Realised for the coupon part – pre : Realised for the principal partLmb

Parameters
CpsTypType of CPS. See type mkt_cps_typ for details
CalDatCalculation date
ValDatValue date: NULL calculations of the CPS curve. So, ValDat will be calculated inside this function with the currency of the curve ValDat revaluation of deals. ValDat should have been calculated with the account currency
LdMktMarket data structure.
LdCal(in/out) List of payment periods to value
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Manuel SANMARTIN - 26/Jan/2006.
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Feb/2006: Use structure LdMkt
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Mar/2006: Set recovery rate in per unit; not percentage. If a flow is of leg "both", calculate it as default and protection flow.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Mar/2006: Get recovery rate from deal it it has its own.
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 20/Mar/2006: Get the validity of the recovery rate is wrong
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Mar/2006: Use MKTcpsSimDflDat to get the default date
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 27/Mar/2006: TEST_MKT_CPS: traces to test
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 28/Mar/2006: Change ValDat by CalDat.
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 25/Apr/2006: move printf of the default leg and add print -—
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Jun/2006: Fees flows, only discount
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 19/Jun/2006: MKTcpsSimDflDat: add ValDat and modify NewBdt
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Oct/2006: Adapt it for CPI curves. New paramter CpsTyp
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 30/Mar/2007: ValDat management
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 22/Mar/2011: Manage call to lcMKTcpsCdsValCalCpn

)

Calculate coefficient like posible rate to do default in a period.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcpsSimDflDat ( char *  Bdt,
char *  Edt,
char *  ValDat,
double  Fct,
char *  NewBdt,
char *  DflDat,
double *  Acc 
)

Calculate the simulated default date of a period.

Calculate the simulated default date of a period.

  • The simulated default date is a date between the begin and end date of the period. It is calculated as a fraction of the period.
  • If the value date is after the begin date of the period, the period is considered as if it started in value date, because the probability of a default before the value date is 0.0.
  • Also calculate the portion of the accrued from the real begin date of the period until the simulated default date.

  • Note that the value date is considered to be always before end date, this check will be done previous to the calling of this function.

    Parameters
    BdtBegin date of the period
    EdtEnd date of the period
    ValDatValue date
    FctFraction of the period to put the default date in
    NewBdt(out) Begin date of the "new" period. Memory should be allocated
    DflDat(out) Medium date. Of type CDA_TYPE.
    Acc(out) Accrued fraction from the begin date of the period until the default date
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Mar/2006:
    Modified
    • Manuel SANMARTIN - 28/Mar/2006: Change ValDat by CalDat.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/May/2006: If Bdt equals Edt, return an accrued of 0.0
    • Ramon MARTINEZ - 16/Jun/2006: Add parameter Dev and modify type of NewBdt – Ramon MARTINEZ - 19/Jun/2006: ValDat and modify NewBdt

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcrist ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
char *  Dat,
void *  LdTyp,
void *  LdAls 
)

Cristalise current market data values.

Get the list of imc, values to cristalise for a date and a profile

  • Get the list of imc's, values to cristalise from mkt_dta_his of previous date

  • Only enter market data that has no value in destination books of LdAls. In GV, update table mkt_dta_his and, in Fox, mkt_dta.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    ProProfile
    DatDate
    LdTypList of market data types
    LdAlsList of als to diffuse
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 27/Jul/2000

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcrvChk ( char *  MktTyp,
void *  LdTra,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Controls curves: Verification that required curves exist.

Controls curves. We check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdTra) all curves come in the column <MktTyp> of 'LdNec' list.
Parameters
MktTypMarket data type (see enumsAfu.dat; afuTyp enumerate's values)
LdTraStock list
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Jon BARRUTIA - 23/Jan/2007
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Feb/2007: Use standard function ITFgetEnuLab
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 10/Oct/2007: Corrected the mark to delete not used curves
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 06/Nov/2007: Do not call to lcMKTcrvChkNecCrv. Do one function with both
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 07/Nov/2007: Add a call to lcMKTcrvChkOneCrv to check if valid points exist
  • Amparo CAMARERO - 05/Nov/2012: Modify function header to match new DOXYGEN format
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 13/Nov/2014: Use ERRchk instead of ERRass when calling to DYNcbn[Chk]

  • Josune BIKUNA - 04/Nov/2014: For 'EquVol' and 'DvdYld', recover also the contract associated to the curve
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcrvGetDflVal ( void *  LdCrv,
int  EtpMth,
double  Dfl,
double *  Val 
)

Interpolate a value for a default in a curve.

Interpolate a value for a default in a curve. To calculate the interpolate value, the list of the curve points have val and dfl columns

Parameters
LdCrvList of points of curve
EtpMthExtrapolation method. See enum crv_etp_mth for details.
DflDefault
Val(out) Interpolated value
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Jan/2004
Modified
  • Ruben GIL - 25/May/2007: Rename function from MKTylvGetVal to MKTcrvGetVal. Add function procedure in MKTcrvGetValItp
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 25/Jul/2007: Different methods of external interpolation.
See Also
MKTcrvGetVal
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcrvGetDflValItp ( void *  LdCrv,
int  EtpMth,
double  Dfl,
int  ColVal,
int  ColDfl,
double *  Val 
)

Interpolate a value for a date in a curve.

Interpolate a value for a date in a curve

  • Search the first point with default after or equal to Dfl.
  • If there is a point with same default, return its value.
  • If Dfl is between two points, linear interpolation between previous and next point value
  • If Dfl is previous to the first point of the curve with a valid value, depends on the extrapolation method.
  • + Horizontal extrapolation: return the value of the first point.
  • + Extrapolation with one point: create a curve point with 0.0 value for the default of 0.0. Make a straight line between that new point and the first point of the curve and calculate the value where it cuts the requested default.
  • + Extrapolation with two points: make a straight line between first and second point and calculate the value where it cuts the requested default.
  • If Dfl is bigger than last point of the curve with a valid value, depends on the extrapolation method.
  • + Horizontal extrapolation: return the value of the last point.
  • + Extrapolation with one point: return the value fo the last point.

  • + Extrapolation with two points: make a straight line between last point and the point previous to the last one and calculate the value where it cuts the requested default.

    Parameters
    LdCrvList of points.
    EtpMthExtrapolation method. See enum crv_etp_mth for details.
    DflDefault whose value is requested.
    ColValValue column
    ColDflDefault column
    Val(out) Interpolated value
    Returns
    Error code (0 if OK).
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 26/Jul/2007
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 27/Jul/2007. Init Dfl2 to correct compilation warning.
    See Also
    MKTcrvGetValItp
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcrvGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
char *  Cty,
char *  Typ,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdCrv 
)

Load historic curves into a single data structure.

Load historic curves into a single data structure.

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatCalculation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
CtyCurve type
TypMarket data type
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdCrv(out) Curve list. Must be freed with function MKTcrvFre
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 30/May/2006
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Oct/2007: Get also prices from mkt_dta_his_arc table.
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 19/Oct/2007: Correct the order by clause for SQS
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 21/Feb/2008: Don't force the 'val' value to 0.0 when the historic price for a point of a curve is not valid.
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 16/Jun/2009: Add Ctx parameter to MKTmcdSetImc function.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 08/Feb/2010: Add 'dfl' column when getting data
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Feb/2012: Add also field Vdt (Valid Date)
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Feb/2012: Use standard function MKTgetHisDta
  • Josune BIKUNA - 04/Nov/2014: For 'EquVol' and 'DvdYld', recover also the contract associated to the curve

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcrvGetValItp ( void *  LdCrv,
int  EtpMth,
char *  Dat,
int  ColVal,
int  ColPdt,
double *  Val 
)

Interpolate a value for a date in a curve.

Interpolate a value for a date in a curve

  • Search the first point with date after or equal to Dat.
  • If there is a point with same date, return its value.
  • If the date is between two points, linear interpolation between previous and next point value
  • If the date is previous to the first point of the curve with a valid value, depends on the extrapolation method.
  • + Horizontal extrapolation: return the value of the first point.
  • + Extrapolation with one point: create a curve point with 0.0 value in the begin date of the first point. Make a straight line between that new point and the first point of the curve and calculate the value where it cuts the requested date.
  • + Extrapolation with two points: make a straight line between first and second point and calculate the value where it cuts the requested date.
  • If the date is after the last point of the curve with a valid value, depends on the extrapolation method.
  • + Horizontal extrapolation: return the value of the last point.
  • + Extrapolation with one point: return the value fo the last point.

  • + Extrapolation with two points: make a straight line between last point and the point previous to the last one and calculate the value where it cuts the requested date.

    Parameters
    LdCrvList of points.
    EtpMthExtrapolation method. See enum crv_etp_mth for details.
    DatDate to interpolate
    ColValValue column
    ColPdtDate column
    Val(out) Interpolated value
    Returns
    Error code (0 if OK).
    Author
    Ruben GIL - 25/May/2007
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Jun/2007: Find the first valid points, it may not be the first one.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 25/Jul/2007: Different methods of external interpolation.
    See Also
    MKTcrvGetDflValItp
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTcrvIsPntVld ( void *  LdCrv,
int  Pnt,
short *  Vld 
)

Error code (0 if OK).

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTctrAplDfl ( void *  LdCtr,
int  InxCtr,
int  AplCff,
char *  Dat,
double *  Mnt,
double *  AlvCff 
)

Apply a contracts defaults percentage to an amount.

Apply a contracts defaults percentage to an amount. The function will search for the defaults percentage that corresponds to the required date and depending on the init and end tranche defined in the contract for the defaults, it will reduce the given amount in the percentage according to the defaults percentage.

  • - if the defaults percentage is lower than the init tranche, the amount will not be affected
  • - if the defaults percentage is greater than the end tranche, the amount will be penalized completely and it will return 0.0 as amount
  • - if the defaults percentage is between init and end tranche, the percentage to penalize will be calculate as: (defaults pcg. - init tranche) / (end tranche - init tranche) * 100 This will be the percentage in which the given amount will be reduced
Parameters
LdCtrList of contracts
InxCtrIndex contract in the list of contracts
AplCffFlag that indicates if the calculate alive coefficient (from the deafult value) must be applied in the given amount or it must be only returned as an output value
DatDate for which the default value is required
Mnt(in/out) Amount in which the defaults percentage must be applied if it is necessary
AlvCff(out) Alive coefficient that remains on the given amount once the percentage in which the given amount is reduced is calculated. This value is a percentage that is already divided into 100, so its goes between (0 - 1) Notice that the given amount will be reduce only in case 'AplCff' parameter is 1, but this value will be always returned.
Returns
Error code. 0: Ok
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 19/Jul/2007
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 23/Jul/2007: Add the possibility to get as an output value the percentage in which the given amount is reduce and that has been calculated from the correspondant default value. Besides that, give also de possibility to not applied this percentage

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTctrGetCtr ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdTra,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load required contracts, with bond schedule information for bonds.

Load required contracts, with bond schedule information for bonds. So far only the required bond, future and equity contracts are loaded.

  • Get also the contracts for asset swap deals in the same contract list. These contracts will be synthetic bond contracts formed from the information of the bond and swap contracts of the asset swap deals, this is, they will be similar to the bond contract but with the swap schedule which it is not matched.
  • The contract names for asset swap synthetic contracts will be a bit special. Each synthetic bond contract of asset swaps must have a different contract name although the bond contract is the same (the synthetic bond cash depends on the swap deal). The original bond contract name will be stored in ctrBnd column, and the 'ctr' column will be formed with '}{' characters followed by the num deal.
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdTraDeals object
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 16/Mar/1999
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 29/Jun/1999: Add LdBndo
  • Edurne GORDOA - 12/Jun/2000. Add LdEquc
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 16/Jan/2002: use CTRinitIn instead of CTRinitAll1
  • Josune BIKUNA - 24/Jul/2002. In the contract list, add the contracts for asset swap deals. Each asset swap deal will have a different contract although the bond contract is the same, as it depends on the swap contract.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 29/Jul/2002. Destroy correctly contract lists
  • Josune BIKUNA - 27/Dec/2002. Get also contracts for the deals in LdBndcBdeNotAs, LdBndcBdeAs
  • Edurne GORDOA - 30/Sep/2003: Get also contracts for CDO cash
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 19/Apr/2004: Add LdEfuc and LdEfuo
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 21/Apr/2004: Remove LdEfuo
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 21/Apr/2004: Add LdEquo
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 02/Jun/2004: Take LdEfuc's "cte"
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 20/Nov/2007: Add LdCdosc
  • Josune BIKUNA - 06/Dec/2007: Add LdFndc
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 15/Jul/2014: Add LdBndVer
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTctrGetDfl ( void *  LdCtr,
int  InxCtr,
char *  Dat,
double *  Dfl 
)

Update the rate (tau) and coupon (cpn) of variable bond flows.

From the contract default values schedule, get the default value that correspond to a required date.

Parameters
LdCtrList of contracts
InxCtrIndex contract in the list of contracts
DatDate for which the default value is required
Dfl(out) Default value corresponding to the required date. It is a percentage value, this is, between (0 - 100)
Returns
Error code. 0: Ok
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 19/Jul/2007
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 25/Jul/2007: Convert the function to public
  • Josune BIKUNA - 25/Jul/2007: From now on, the function receives the complete contract list instead of only the defaults schedule
  • Josune BIKUNA - 28/Sep/2007: Improve the description of 'Dfl' parameter
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTctrGetDflAlvCff ( double  Dfl,
double  Idf,
double  Edf,
double *  AlvCff 
)

Get the alive coefficient that corresponds to a given default amount.

Get the alive coefficient that corresponds to a given default amount

Parameters
DflDefault amount. It is a percentage, this is, a value between (0 - 100)
IdfInit tranche for the defaults
EdfEnd tranche for the defaults
AlvCff(out) Alive coefficient that corresponds to the given default amount. This value is a percentage that is already divided into 100, so its goes between (0 - 1)
Returns
Error code. 0: Ok
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 19/Jul/2007
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 28/Sep/2007: Improve the description of 'Dfl' parameter

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTctrUpdCtrAs ( void *  LdBndcAs)

Update contract name for asset swap.

Update contract name for asset swap. Each synthetic bond cash deal for an asset swap must have a different contract name although the bond contract is the same (the synthetic bond cash depends on the swap deal).

  • The original bond contract name will be stored in ctrBnd column, and the 'ctr' column will be formed with '}{' characters followed by the num deal.
Parameters
LdBndcAsList of bond cash deals of asset swap deals
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 06/Mar/2003
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t

)

    LdAlsList of books (als)
    Returns

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTdycChk ( void *  LdTra,

)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTdycGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load historic yield dividend curves into a single data structure.

Load historic yield dividend curves into a single data structure. We may have some indications in LdMkt on which curves are necessary.

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatCalculation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 29/Oct/2014

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTeprCalYld ( void *  LdMkt)

Calculate the dividend_yield of each equity contract.

Calculate the dividend_yield of each equity contract We need to calculate the dividend_yield of each contract. To do it, we have to:

  • For each contract:
    • Get contract's events
    • Get 'Cash dividends' (evncdi)
    • Sort (Descending) contract's events taking into account the value date (dt3)
    • Take the list of dates of the last known event date's year. For example: We have events for these dates:
      • 03/02/2004
      • 16/06/2004
      • 03/02/2005
      • 16/06/2005 The last event date that we know is 16/06/2005. And then the list = (03/02/2005, 16/06/2005). Note: The last date that we know it is possible to be future even past
    • Sum Amount per share (fl1) column's value —> A
    • Take the market value of the contract —> B
    • And dividend_yield = A/B
    • We need in percentage, so (A/B)*100
Parameters
LdMktList of market data
Returns
Error code (0: Ok)
Author
Aitziber BARRERO - 26/May/2004
Modified
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 20/Jul/2004: Check correctly if we have lignes in LdEchCshDiv list
  • Aitziber BARRERO - 21/Jul/2004: Liberate memory
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/Jun/2011. Cast to avoid compilation warning

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTeprChkMul ( void *  LdTra,
void *  LdMul,
void *  LdDat,
int  MktPrd,
int  War 
)

Check equity/fund prices multidate list.

Check equity/fund prices multidate list Get the first date for each equity contract For all later dates, check there is a value for each contract

Parameters

LdMulList of multidate prices
LdDatList of dates
MktPrdType of product (equity or fund )

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTeprGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Equity prices historic data retrieval.

Equity prices historic data retrieval.

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatHistorisation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 26/Jul/1999
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Sep/2000. Get also column src
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 22/Jan/2001. Sentence corrected
  • Edurne GORDOA - 27/Feb/2002. Modifications to get historic data from correct table depending on if we are in FOX or GV
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 14/Mar/2002: use mkt_dta_trt_aud, mth = 'rdd'
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 17/Sep/2002. Correct bug. Add a blanck space into a where clause.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Oct/2007. Get also prices from mkt_dta_his_arc table.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Feb/2012: Use standard function MKTgetHisDta

void *  LdObj,
void **  LdEpr 
)

Read equity prices.

Read equity prices

Parameters
Ctxchannel to database
ProProfile
LdPosList with deals with position. If NULL all contracts are get

LdCtrList of selected contracts to filter data. If null there is not filtering
LdIsnList of selected isin codes to filter data. If null there is not filtering

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTepvChk ( void *  LdTra,
AFUdatCurHis  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Control equity yield volatility curves.

Control equity yield volatility curves. Check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdTra) all curves come in the "Epv" column.
Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historical data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historical)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 29/Oct/2014
Modified
  • David ROMERO - 20/Apr/2015: Avoid Sonar warning (redundant asignment to itself) for unused parameter

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTepvGetCtrEpv ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdCtr,
void **  LdEpv 
)

Get from database the equity yield volatility curve codes defined for the given contracts.

Get from database the list of equity yield volatility curve codes defined for the given contracts.

  • The function will return a list with these columns:
  • - ctr: contract associated to the equity yield volatility curve
  • - crv: equity yield volatility curve code
  • - dev: currency of the equity yield volatility curve code
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdCtrList of contracts for which the equity yield volatility curves are wanted. It must have at least one 'ctr' column
LdEpv(out) Resulting list with the yield volaility curves
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 27/Oct/2014

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfspCalDfc ( void *  LdMkt,
char *  Dev,
void *  LdCrvDev,
char *  CalDat,
char *  Dat,
double *  Dfc 
)

Interpolates the discount factor for a forex swap point curve.

Interpolates the discount factor for a forex swap point curve

Parameters
LdMktMarket data object list
DevCurrency
LdCrvDevYield curve for the currency
CalDatCalculation date
DatDiscount factor date
Dfc(out) Discount factor at Dat
Returns
Error code (0: Ok)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 14/Apr/1999
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 15/Nov/2005: Corrected treatment for INDIRECT quotation modes
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 15/Nov/2005: Corrected the calculus for the spot date. The lag to calculate the spot date is not hard coded: it is taken from a cst: afuLagSpo.
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 15/Nov/2005: Use the AFUdatGetLagSpo function instead of access directly to cst to recover the afuLagSpo value
  • Edurne GORDOA - 23/Jan/2015: Take into account O/N and T/N points to calculate the discount factor
  • Josune BIKUNA - 28/Sep/2017: Correct the management of the forex swap point value. The forex swap point value 'Fsp' must be sum to the spot rate exchange 'Spo', but both values must be in the same quoatation mode DIRECT/INDIRECT respecting to the fsp reference currency ('FxDev'). As the previously recovered spot rate exchange is always DIRECT, in case the quotation type of the currency in the fsp curves is INDIRECT, the inverse must be calculated
  • Josune BIKUNA - 27/Oct/2017: Correct the calculation of the disccount factor depending on the quotation type (DIRECT, INDIRECT)
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfspCalFwp ( void *  LdMkt,
char *  Qmr,
char *  Dev,
char *  Dem,
char *  Crv,
char *  Crm,
char *  Bdt,
char *  Edt,
double  Prf,
char *  Dat,
double *  Fwp 
)

Calculates the forward price of a forex using swap point curves.

Calculates the forward price of a forex using swap point curves

Parameters
LdMktMarket data objects list. It has to have the following objects: "Fsp", "Dev", "Spo" and "Frf"
QmrQuotation mode for main-result: DIRECT, INDIRECT
DevMain currency
DemResult currency
CrvNot used
CrmNot used
BdtNot used
EdtEnd date
PrfNot used
DatCalculation date. It is used to calculate the spot date
Fwp(OUT). Calculated forward price
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Jon BARRUTIA - 05/May/2006
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 14/Jun/2006: Redo the forward price calculation
  • Edurne GORDOA - 23/Jan/2015: Take into account O/N and T/N points to calculate forward price
  • David ROMERO - 20/Apr/2015: Avoid Sonar warning (redundant asignment to itself) for unused parameters and simplify if cases of FwpDev and FwpDem variables.
Algorithm
  • Calculate the swap point of Dev vs. USD:
  • + For O/N type points: (FwdPrx = SpoPrx - (FspTN + FspON) / Pip)
  • + For T/N type points: (FwdPrx = SpoPrx - FspTN / Pip)
  • + The rest (FwdPrx = SpoPrx + Fsp / Pip)
  • Calculate the swap point of Dem vs. USD:
  • + For O/N type points: (FwdPrx = SpoPrx - (FspTN + FspON) / Pip)
  • + For T/N type points: (FwdPrx = SpoPrx - FspTN / Pip)
  • + The rest (FwdPrx = SpoPrx + Fsp / Pip)
  • *Fwp = FwpDem / FwpDev;
  • if (strcmp (Qmr, "DIRECT") == 0) *Fwp = *Fwp;
  • else *Fwp = 1 / *Fwp;

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgCalAcc ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdCC,
char *  Fxg,
char *  ValDat 
)

Calculation of the accrued coupon from a list with TMP.

Given a list where in every line there is a fixing data, begin date, end date and a rate, this function calulates the accrued from the last date (the newest) to the others. The calculated value isn't the CC (aCcruec Cupon) but CC * NbDays / (Bas / 100). This value will be stocked in a column called 'CC', if it doesn't exist it will be created. Also get in a column the equivalent daily 'CC' ('Column EquCC').

  • Name of the columns: bdt, edt, rat
  • Note: if dev and fdv are not identical, it will be a problem with ValDat if dev is opened but fdv is closed, because we'll never get a period that finish in ValDat
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdCC(in/out) List with input information and for stock calculated values
FxgFixing code
ValDatValue date (RemDec). Date for the end date in the last date in the list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Ramon MARTINEZ - 05/Feb/1999
Modified
  • Edurne GORDOA - 17/Apr/2000. Round only when number of decimals is different from -1
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 05/May/2000. Bug in CC calculation
  • Edurne GORDOA - 17/Jul/2000. Remove lines which begin date is after the value date before add a line for where we have not rates.
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 15/Apr/2003: DYNcbn -> DYNcbnChk
  • Josune BIKUNA - 17/Sep/2003. Avoid compilation warnings
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 14/Jan/2004. Add column EquCC. Use ERRchk instead of ERRass in call to function DYNcbnChk.
  • Ismael SERRANO - 11/Oct/2006: Use MTHfinRnd instead of arrondMethod.
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 29/Oct/2012: Modification in header to avoid doxygen warnings
  • Edurne GORDOA - 17/Sep/2014: Take into account mkt_fxg_mtc_cms_neg_zro

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgCalSav ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
int  MktSta,
void *  LdFxg,
void *  LdAls 
)

Save in database a list of fixings and their dependents.

Save in database a list of fixings and their dependents.

  • Remove from LdFxg the fixing points that are not capturable
  • Calculate the dates (fdt, edt, bdt) of each fixing
  • Add to the list of fixing points those dependants
  • Save the fixing rates with the given status in current book and LdAls
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatFixing date
MktStaMarket data status the fixings will be saved with (See mkt_def.h for details)
LdFxgFixing values (imc, val) (sorted by imc)
LdAlsList of books to diffusse
Returns
Error code. 0: Ok
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 01/Nov/2002
Modified
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 29/Oct/2012: Modification in header to avoid doxygen warnings

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgCpFxgRates ( void *  Ctx,
char *  CrvSet,
char *  Dev,
void *  DatOrg,
void *  DatDst,
int  IsGv,
int  Sta,
int  CpToGvIfNot 
)

Copy the fixing rates of a fixing day into other fixing days.

Copy the fixing rates of a fixing day into other fixing days If between the original date DatOrg and DatDst are more than one day, the fixings rates will be copied for all those days. If CrvSet and Dev are empty all the fixings rates will be copied, but the fixing rates to copy can be specified by CrvSet in IN format, this is, between brackets, or by Dev, which will be the currency of the fixing rates to copy.

  • Examples:
  • - Copy the fixing rates of fixing curves ESP MIBOR, EUR LIBOR of fixing date 27-JAN-1999 to 29-JAN-1999 with status copied MKTfxgCpFxgRates (Ctx, "('ESP MIBOR', 'EUR LIBOR')", "", "27-JAN-1999", "29-JAN-1999", 0, mkt_sta_copied, 1)
  • - Copy the fixing rates of the ESP fixing curves of fixing date 27-JAN-1999 to 29-JAN-1999 MKTfxgCpFxgRates (Ctx, "", "ESP", "27-JAN-1999", "29-JAN-1999", 0, mkt_sta_copied, 1)
Parameters
CtxDatabase conection
CrvSetFixing curves in IN mode. If no Fixing curves are wanted, empty string.
DevCurrency. If no currency is wanted, empty string.
DatOrgFixing date of the original fixing rates to copy
DatDstDestiny fixing date to copy the fixing rates
IsGvIs Global View flag. Used only to diffusion.
StaStatus to save the values
CpToGvIfNotIf the fixing rates must be copied to GV if there are not yet. This parameter is onlu take into account if IsGv is 0.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 10/Feb/1999
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 08/Jun/2004. Use MKTgetDffAls instead of MBOOKgetMktAls
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 14/May/2008: Take diffusion books depending on diffusion books type, call to MKTgetDffTypAls
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgFind ( void *  LdFxg,
char *  Cod,
void **  LdFxgCrv,
int *  Mtc 
)

  • Jon BARRUTIA - 15/Apr/2003: DYNcbn -> DYNcbnChk
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 27/May/2004: Use ERRchk instead of ERRass when calling to DYNcbn[Chk]
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgGetDepPnt ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdFxg,
void **  LdDep 
)

Get list of fixing points that depend on the ones in LdFxg.

Get list of fixing points that depend on the ones in LdFxg

  • Get the distinct imc's in LdFxg
  • Get from DB the (non capturable) points that depends on those imc's
  • For each fixing date in LdFxg
  • + Get the imc's of points in LdFxg that are modified for the date
  • + Get the list of poins dependant on the above imc's
  • + Calculate the dates for the dependant points
  • + Copy to dependant points the new rate of their original points
Parameters
CtxData base context
LdFxgList with fixing-point data with columns imc, rat and fdt.
LdDep(out) List of fixing points dependant on the ones in LdFxg with date fields and rate value
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 27/Nov/2001
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/May/2002. Correct call to DYNgenSort
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 16/Jun/2009: Add Ctx parameter to MKTmcdSetImc function.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgGetFdt ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Fxg,
char *  DevSet,
char *  Dat1,
int  OpDat1,
char *  Dat2,
int  OpDat2,
void **  LdFdt 
)

Get the fixing dates of a fixing curve reference.

Get the fixing dates of a fixing curve reference. The limits of the fixing dates to recover can be specified using Dat1 and Dat2. Both dates have another parameter that indicates the type of the operator to use with the date, this is, it can be indicate that the fixing date must be greater, smaller, ... than the date passed as parameter. The possible values for the operators of the dates are:

  • DYN_WH_OP_EQUAL
  • DYN_WH_OP_DIFFERENT
  • DYN_WH_OP_GREAT
  • DYN_WH_OP_GREAT_EQUAL
  • DYN_WH_OP_SMALL
  • DYN_WH_OP_SMALL_EQUAL
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
FxgFixing curve reference for which the fixing dates are required
DevSetMultiple dev can be selected or not, this is esential in the case that it isn't any Fixing curve selected.
Dat1First date limit to fixing date. If no date limit is wanted, this parameter can be empty string
OpDat1Operator to apply to Dat1. See description
Dat2Second date limit to fixing date. If no date limit is wanted, this parameter can be empty string
OpDat2Operator to apply to Dat2. See description
LdFdtAt the end of the function, stores the fixing dates required
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 15/Feb/1999
Modified
  • Maider GALDOS - 26/Jun/2001. Added Dev, DevWhere and FxgWhere.
  • Maider GALDOS - 09/Aug/2001. Corrected for multiple selection of Dev. Now is called DevSet.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Nov/2001. Use table mkt_mcd
  • Josune BIKUNA - 17/Sep/2003. Avoid compilation warnings

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgGetFxgNam ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Fxg,
char *  Dev,
int  AddNoCap,
void **  LdFxg 
)

Get all the fixing curve references for a multiple currency.

Get all the fixing curve references for a multiple currency The resulting fixing curve references will be returned in a list. This list will have an only column 'fxg' with the distinct fixing curve references found for the set of currences DevSet.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
FxgFixing curve reference inserted by the user to be used as a filter
DevCurrency. It can be multiple selection
AddNoCapWhether the non-capturable curves
LdFxg(out) Fixing curve references, column fxg
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgGetFxgRatCal ( void *  Ctx,
char *  StrFxg,
char *  Dat,
void **  LdFxgRat 
)

Get all the component fixing rates of a fixing curve.

Get all the component fixing rates of a fixing curve. These are the fixing rates of the point defined in OthImc. The dates are the begin of Dat month until Dat (or the begin of previous month until Dat, if Dat < Fda (e.g.: 5h of month for EURIBOR BOE) If the component fixing rates of one or several fixing curves are required, these fixing curves must be especified in CrvSet parameter in IN format, this is, between brackets. The fixing rates which are among the dates DatFrom and DatTo are recovered,

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
StrFxgString with the fixing curves
DatInitial date for recovering fixing rates
LdFxgRat(out) list of fixing
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 10/May/2010
Get the fixing rates of fixing curves ESP MIBOR, EUR LIBOR between
fixing dates 27-JAN-1999 and 29-JAN-1999
MKTfxgGetFxgRatCal (Ctx, "('EURIBOR BOE', 'USDLIBOR BOE')",
"27-JAN-1999", "fdt", "29-JAN-1999", "fdt",
0, 0, &LdFxgRat)
Get the fixing rates of the ESP fixing curves between begin date
27-JAN-1999 and end date 29-JAN-1999
MKTfxgGetFxgRates (Ctx, "", "ESP",
"27-JAN-1999", "bdt", "29-JAN-1999", "edt",
0, 0, &LdFxgRat)
See Also
MKTfxgGetFxgRates
Modified
  • Lorea Navarro 30/OCT/2012: Modification in header to avoid doxygen warnings
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgGetFxgRates ( void *  Ctx,
char *  CrvSet,
char *  DevSet,
char *  DatFrom,
char *  FldDatFrom,
char *  DatTo,
char *  FldDatTo,
int  OutJoin,
int  ExcNoCap,
int  CpLastIfNot,
void **  LdFxgRat 
)

Get all the fixing rates of a fixing curve or a currency.

Get all the fixing rates of a fixing curve or a currency. If the fixing rates of one or several fixing curves are required, these fixing curves must be especified in CrvSet parameter in IN format, this is, between brackets. If the fixing rates of a currency are required, the currency must be especified in Dev parameter. The fixing rates which are among the dates DatFrom and DatTo are recovered, This dates correspond to FldDatFrom and FldDatTo fields of mkt_his_fxg table respectively.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
CrvSetFixing curves in IN mode. If no Fixing curves are wanted, empty string.
DevSetMultiple currency. If no currencies are wanted, empty string.
DatFromInitial date for recovering fixing rates
FldDatFromField of mkt_his_fxg which represents DatFrom date
DatToEnding date for recovering fixing rates
FldDatToField of mkt_his_fxg which represents DatTo date
OutJoinGet the fixing rates information unless the fixing rates are not in fixing rates table.
ExcNoCapExclude the fixing rates of non-capturable curves
CpLastIfNotCopy last known fixing rates if missing
LdFxgRat(out) list of fixing
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 03/Feb/1999
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 14/May/1999. Add CpLastIfNot parameter. If this parameter has value 1, call lcMKTfxgGetFxgRateLastVal
  • Edurne GORDOA - 29/Feb/2000. Get cp1 column
  • Maider GALDOS - 17/Jul/2001. Dev changed by DevSet.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Nov/2001. Added parameter Dat to lcMKTfxgGetFxgRateLastVal
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 03/Dec/2002. Check if exist CrvWhere, DevSet.
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 12/May/2003: Sort by maturity date instead of mat, unt
  • Amparo CAMARERO - 12/Mar/2007: Name of local variables changed (CrvWhere => CrvWhe, DevWhere => DevWhe, CapWhere => CapWhe, StrOutJoin => StrOutJoi). Size of CrvWhe and DevWhe variables dynamically reserved
  • Amparo CAMARERO - 23/03/07: Size of AND condition of SQL sentence also dynamically reserved
  • Gema ACHA - 12/May/2008: Convert to Ansi-SQL
  • Gema ACHA - 29/May/2008: Correct Ansi-SQL conversion
  • Mikel ARETXAGA - 16/Feb/2015: Set correct cast to avoid compilation warnings.
Get the fixing rates of fixing curves ESP MIBOR, EUR LIBOR between
fixing dates 27-JAN-1999 and 29-JAN-1999
MKTfxgGetFxgRates (Ctx, "('ESP MIBOR', 'EUR LIBOR')", "",
"27-JAN-1999", "fdt", "29-JAN-1999", "fdt",
0, 0, &LdFxgRat)
Get the fixing rates of the ESP fixing curves between begin date
27-JAN-1999 and end date 29-JAN-1999
MKTfxgGetFxgRates (Ctx, "", "ESP",
"27-JAN-1999", "bdt", "29-JAN-1999", "edt",
0, 0, &LdFxgRat)
See Also
MKTfxgGetFxgRatCal
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgGetFxgRatesToFix ( void *  Ctx,
char *  CrvSet,
char *  DevSet,
char *  DatFrom,
char *  DatTo,
int  ExcNoCap,
void **  LdFxgRat 
)

Get all the fixing rates of a fixing curve or a currency to fix.

Get all the fixing rates of a fixing curve or a currency to fix. If the fixing rates of one or several fixing curves are required, these fixing curves must be especified in CrvSet parameter in IN format, this is, between brackets. If the fixing rates of one or several currencies are required, the currencies must be especified in DevSet parameter in the same format than CrvSet Only the fixing rates whose fixing date is between DatFrom and DatTo. The recovered fixing rates must fullfit the condition that the date for which the references to fix are getting must be open for the fixing currency.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
CrvSetFixing curves in IN mode. If no Fixing curves are wanted, empty string.
DevSetMultiple Currency. If no currency is wanted, empty string.
DatFromInitial fixing date for which the references to fix are be getting
DatToEnding fixing date for which the references to fix are be getting
ExcNoCapFlag to see if non-capturable points must be excluded or not
LdFxgRat(out) List of fixing rates to fix.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 03/Feb/1999
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 14/May/1999. Add the parameter CpLastIfNot to call MKTfxgGetFxgRates
  • Josune BIKUNA - 14/May/1999. Add the parameter CpDatFld to call lcMKTfxgGetFxgRateLastVal
  • Maider GALDOS - 09/Aug/2001. Dev changed by DevSet.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 29/Nov/2001.Added one parameter to lcMKTfxgDelNotOpen
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 12/May/2003: Sort by maturity date instead of mat, unt
  • Iker ZURIARRAIN - 20/Jan/2006: Check if dates are correct (end date is greater than begin date, and is not greater than the application date).
  • Iker ZURIARRAIN - 01/Mar/2006: Do not check if end date is greater than application date.
Get the fixing rates of fixing curves ESP MIBOR, EUR LIBOR on 29-JAN-1999 fixing date,
even the non-capturable ones
MKTfxgGetFxgRatesToFix (Ctx, "('ESP MIBOR', 'EUR LIBOR')", "",
"29-JAN-1999", "29-JAN-1999", 0, &LdFxgRat)
Get the fixing rates of the ESP fixing curves on 29-JAN-1999 fixing date, but only
the capturable ones
MKTfxgGetFxgRatesToFix (Ctx, "", "ESP", "29-JAN-1999", "29-JAN-1999", 1, &LdFxgRat)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxgGetTmpCrv ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdDev,
void **  LdCrv 
)

Get the curves with an only 1D point for some currencies.

Given a list of currencies (it may be empty) get all the fixing curves with an only 1D point. This is to know the name of the TMP1D or EONIA curves because en each site they can have different names. The resultant list is sorted by fixing curve and currency

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdDevCurrencies list. It may be NULL. Currencies are get from dev column
LdCrv(out) List of fixing curves with next columns (fxg, dev)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Edurne GORDOA - 20/Sep/2003
Modified
  • David IGLESIAS - 16/Oct/2003: This functi? has been changed from FIT to AFU. Only changes the name of the function in order of to respect the codification rules. Old Function name was FITmktFxgGetTmpCrv.

char *  Dat,
void *  LdDta 
)

Set the tmp 1D/eonia fixing rate of a date to a list of data depending on the currency.

Set to a list of data the fixing rate value that corresponds to each tmp 1D/eonia's fixing curve on a date. If the rate column (rat) does not exists in the input list it is added. If there is not fixing rate for a curve on the date the rate is initialised to 0.0

DatDate for which take fixing rates

Returns

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxvChk ( void *  LdTra,
AFUdatCurHis  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Control forex yield volatility curves.

Control forex yield volatility curves. Check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdTra) all curves come in the "Fxv" column.
Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historical data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historical)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 29/Oct/2014
Modified
  • David ROMERO - 20/Apr/2015: Avoid Sonar warning (redundant asignment to itself) for unused parameter

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxvFndWthDev ( void *  LdFxv,
char *  Dev,
void **  LdCrv 
)

Search for a curve of a given currency in a curve list, which should be found.

Search for a curve of a given contract in a curve list, which should be found, because we assume that MKTfxvChk has been executed beforehand.

Parameters
LdFxvList of forex yield volatility curves
DevCurrency for which the forex yield volatility curve is wanted
LdCrv(out) Curve list pointer (do not destroy!!)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 28/Oct/2014
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTfxvGetDevFxv ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdDev,
void **  LdFxv 
)

Get from database the forex yield volatility curve codes defined for the given currencies.

Get from database the list of forex yield volatility curve codes defined for the given currencies.

  • The function will return a list with these columns:
  • - crv: forex yield volatility curve code
  • - dev: currency of the forex yield volatility curve code
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdDevList of currencies for which the forex yield volatility curves are wanted. It must have at least one 'dev' column
LdFxv(out) Resulting list with the yield volaility curves

)

Load historic forex yield volatility curves into a single data structure.

Load historic forex yield volatility curves into a single data structure. We may have some indications in LdMkt on which curves are necessary.

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatCalculation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)

Search for a curve of a given currency in a curve list, which may not be found.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetAllDta ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Get all market data values for a profile.

Get all market data values for a profile.

  • In case the current connection is not on a MO book, there are two source possibilities for recovering data. To know which will be the market data source table from where the data are recovered, the value of the application option "afuMktGet" is checked:
  • - If its value is 0, the market data are recovered in the normal way, this is, from current market data table (mkt_dta)
  • - If its value is 1, the market data are recovered for treatment historic market data table (mkt_dta_trt_aud). In this case, the treatment for recovering market data must be configured in the string value of the same applicatin option. The date used to recover the data will be the application date (global variable "AppDat").
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
ProProfile
LdMkt(out) Market data object
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 05/May/2000
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Sep/2000. Get also src field
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 31/May/2006: Order LdMcd by imc, not cod
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Jun/2006: Undo last change.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 30/Nov/2007: Add the possibility to recover data from the treatment historic market data

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetDffAls ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
void **  LdAls 
)

Returns the list of the books in diffusion for the market data.

Returns the list of the books in diffusion for the market data. If it is called with a date, it returns only the books that are in the specified date. Otherwise (if NULL), it returns all the books. To get the possible books, it accedes to the book_trt table; with the 'AluDff' treatment.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatDate to compare with the selected books. Otherwise, NULL.
LdAls(Out) Diffusion alias list. It returns NULL if no books in diffusion.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Jon BARRUTIA - 07/Jun/2004
Modified
  • Ismael SERRANO - 22/Aug/2006: Use AluDff instead of MktDff
See Also
MKTgetDffTypAls
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetDffTypAls ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
int  DffTyp,
void **  LdAls 
)

Returns a list with diffusion books for market data limited by a given type.

Returns a list with diffusion books for market data limited by a given type. If it is called with a date, it returns only the books that are in the specified date. Otherwise (if NULL), it returns all the books defined for diffusion. To get the possible books, it accedes to the book_trt table; with the 'AluDff' treatment. Also, it limits these selected books with a specified type in the "DffTyp" argument.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatDate to compare with the selected books. Otherwise, NULL.
DffTypSpecified book type. It can be: MBdffAll,MBdffTdb,MBdffNdf
LdAls(Out) Diffusion alias list. It returns NULL if no books in diffusion.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Jon BARRUTIA - 09/May/2008
See Also
MKTgetDffAls
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetDta ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
char *  Typ,
char *  Cod,
void **  LdDta 
)

Get all market data values for a given type.

Get all market data values for a given type.

  • In case the current connection is not on a MO book, there are two source possibilities for recovering data. To know which will be the market data source table from where the data are recovered, the value of the application option "afuMktGet" is checked:
  • - If its value is 0, the market data are recovered in the normal way, this is, from current market data table (mkt_dta)
  • - If its value is 1, the market data are recovered for treatment historic market data table (mkt_dta_trt_aud). In this case, the treatment for recovering market data must be configured in the string value of the same applicatin option. The date used to recover the data will be the application date (global variable "AppDat").
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
ProProfile
TypMarket data type (if NULL all)
CodCode (if NULL all)
LdDta(out) Market data list (cod, imc, val, sta, src, Idx, Vdt)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author

  • Josune BIKUNA - 30/Nov/2007: Add the possibility to recover data from the treatment historic market data
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Feb/2012: Get also field Vdt

BdtTakes data which date is great or equal to this begin date. RDB format

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetDtaTim ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
char *  TimIni,
char *  TimEnd,
int  OnlVld,
void *  LdImc,
void **  LdVal 
)

Get prices entered after a Tim (date+time) until another Tim.

Get prices entered after a Tim (date+time) until another Tim

  • Get the last valid market data values previous to or after a date.
  • For each market datum element (LdImc) get the last date with value that is not dirty.

  • The output list will be sorted by imc.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    ProProfile
    TimIniTime initial (date + time)
    TimEndTime final (date + time)
    OnlVldFlag to get only valid prices (1) or all type of prices (0)
    LdImcList of IMCs. The list must have the column imc and if is possible the column typ with the market data type.
    LdVal(out) List of market values recovered from database: imc, dat, val, sta, Idx
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 08/Oct/2010
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Sep/2012: Not join market data tables with MktDtaDic, it slows the select too much.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 02/Oct/2012: If there are not any market data inserted after TimIni return NULL list.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 05/Nov/2012: Include market data with minimum index.

)

Get historic market data value for some UMC and for the some dates.

Get historic market data value for some UMC and for the some dates. It returns a list with the following columns:

  • "imc": Internal market data code

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetMainPro ( void *  Ctx,

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetMktPro ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
char **  MktPro 
)

Given a profile, get the associated market data profile.

Given a profile, get the associated market data profile. The profiles have an optional field to define the associated market data profile. If nothing is defined, if profile has no parent, get the profile itself. If something is defined, it is returned.

  • There are profiles only used to configure some methods (revaluation, sensitivity, etc...). These profiles don't store market data, they have another profile (the parent profile) to get their market data.
  • If a profile is of the type that store market data, the result will be the same input profile.
  • This function returns the associated market data profile if it exist.
  • This function looks for the possible associated market data of the treated profile.
  • + If the treated profile has a valid market data profile, it returns it.

  • + If not:

    • if it has a valid father profile with a valid market data profile, returns it.
    • if it has a valid father profile with an invalid market data profile, returns the father
    • if not, it returns the treated profile
    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    ProOriginal profile name
    MktPro(out) Market data profile name (Must be freed)
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 03/Nov/2004
    Modified
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 21/Nov/2011: Add the concept of associated market data profile and treat it
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetNdfDat ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Als,
char *  Sit,
char *  NdfDat 
)

Get the date of a non-leaf book. That is, the maximum date of its terminal books.

Get the date of a non-leaf book. That is, the maximum date of its terminal books.

  • Get all books that hang from current context book, look for the newest date.

  • If the book is a non-leaf book, call recursively to this function.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context, a non-leaf book.
    AlsAlias of current book.
    SitSite of the current book.
    NdfDat(out) Non-leaf book date. Reserve memory with CDA_TYPE.
    Returns
    • Error code (0 if OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 27/Apr/2009
    Modified
    • Ruben GIL - 22/Feb/2010: ALU impacts: Add new variable in CSTreadDatDB function

void **  LdPro 
)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetOpnDayMktClo ( char *  Dat,
char *  Mth,
char *  OpnDat 
)

Returns an open date taking into account the MktCloDat option.

Returns an open date taking into account the MktCloDat option; this is, the returned value depends on AO.ide = 'MktCloDat'

  • if "1": market data are managed on closed dates so the returned date is a copy of the input
  • if "0": market data are not managed on closed dates so it returns the previous or following open day depending on Mth parameter
Parameters
DatDate to calculate the preceding/following open date
Mth"P" preceding, "F" following.
OpnDat(out). Calculated open date. Reserved memory as CDA_TYPE.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Jon BARRUTIA - 01/Jun/2011
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 23/Jan/2012: Compilation error corrected
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 11/Jan/2013: Add Mth parameter
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 19/Feb/2015: Taken from RDDgetOpnDayMktClo

void **  LdDat

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetTrtAllDat ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Trt,
char *  Pro,
char *  CloDat,
void **  LdDat 
)

Get the list of all pending dates to run a treatment.

Get the list of all pending dates to run a treatment.

  • The initial date will be usually the last open date of previous year.
  • There is one A.O. (AfuTrtDay) with the date without year ("10-FEB", for instance) so that if application date if previous to that date start from the last open date of 2 years ago.
  • Starting from that date:
  • + get all (open or not) dates since last treatment done (profile.frd)
  • + add individual pending dates (PndTrt)

  • + remove individual dates where the pending treatment is already done (PndTrtDon)

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase connection
    TrtTreatment code.
    ProProfile
    CloDatLast closed date, in case profile must be
    LdDat(out) List of dates to treat treatment. Dat.
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 02/Nov/2010
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Nov/2010: Correct increase counter of dates.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Jan/2011: Error if there is not last treatment date for profile.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Nov/2011: Do not include the end date of previous year.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Dec/2011: Get only open dates or all, according to AO MktCloDat
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 03/May/2012: Add parameter CloDat, with the date of closing book
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Oct/2012: Include last date of previous year.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Mar/2014: Date in profiles.frd may be pending in some cases (if market data have entered for that date)
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetUseImc ( void *  LdMkt,
void **  LdImc 
)

Get the list of market data used for a treatment.

Get the list of market data used for a treatment. It joins market data of distinct types in a single list of imcs.

  • It should be called after the check of all market data, when the unnecessary data are removed.
  • Treated data types are:
  • + Curves:
  • "Siv", "Cds", "Cdsi", "Dsv", "Coc", "Cpv", "Dyc", "Epc", "Epv", "Fxv", "Fsp", "Ixc", "Ixv", "Yld", "Ylv"
  • + Prices: "Epr", "Fpr", "Npr", "Pri", "Vol", "Spo", "Com", "Inx", "PriUmc"
  • + Spread

  • + Option prices

    Parameters
    LdMktMarket data object
    LdImc(out) List of used imcs (imc, val, sta, src, Usg)
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 15/May/2006
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 31/May/2006: ADd Cdsi curves
    • Josune BIKUNA - 16/Oct/2007: Add the management of yield volatilities curves (Ylv)
    • Josune BIKUNA - 16/Oct/2007: Add a specific treatment for option prices as their value is stored in 'opr' column instead of 'val' column
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 10/Feb/2009: Add 'Coc', 'Cpv and 'Com'.
    • Josune BIKUNA - 27/Apr/2009: Add the management of 'Spc' when getting the used imc
    • Josune BIKUNA - 30/Apr/2009: The 'Pri' object contains also the used spreads (their imc, value, status and source). They must be also retuned in the list of used imc-s
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 07/Jul/2009: Add Cor.
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 07/Jul/2009: Add some missing market data types
    • Josune BIKUNA - 29/Jul/2009: Correct the curve names Cdi->Cdsi, Epr->Epc
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Feb/2012: Add valid date (Vdt)
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTgetVldDatVal ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
char *  Dat,
int  Prv,
int  OnlVld,
void *  LdImc,
void **  LdVal 
)

Get the last valid market data values previous to or after a date.

Get the last valid market data values previous to or after a date.

  • For each market datum element (LdImc) get the last date with value that is not dirty.

  • The output list will be sorted by imc.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    ProProfile
    DatDate, it may be NULL
    PrvFlag to get the values previous (1) or posterior (0) to the date.
    OnlVldFlag to get only valid prices (1) or all type of prices (0)
    LdImcList of IMCs. The list must have the column imc and if is possible the column typ with the market data type.
    LdVal(out) List of market values recovered from database: imc, dat, val, sta
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 21/Aug/2009
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Aug/2009: Add new parameter OnlVld
    • Ruben GIL - 31/Aug/2009: Correct parameter name Onlvld –> OnlVld
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Oct/2009: Delete parameter Nbd. Make if faster, do not get value imc by imc, get all together.
    • Jesus Maria GARCIA - 28/Oct/2009: Get the market data for fixing rates. Get the market data type if it doesn't exists in LdImc
    • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 21/Sep/2010: Add Idx to resulting list (MktDtaDic index)
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Feb/2012: Add also field Vdt
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTinxGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load historic index prices into a single data structure, LdMkt.

Load historic index prices into a single data structure, LdMkt

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation.
Parameters
CtxDatabase connection
DatPrices date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure (Add object "Inx")
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Oct/2004
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2006: Add parameter MktHis
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter to MKTgetHisDta
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Apr/2008: call common function to get current and historic market data.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTisDtaCnf ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
char *  Typ,
char *  Cod,
int *  Cnf 
)

Check if there is any dirty value in a set of market data for a profile.

Check if there is any dirty value in a set of market data for a profile. If any of the market datum of the set has a status of dirty, the complete set is considered as not confirmed.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
ProProfile
TypMarket data type
CodCode (if NULL all)
Cnf(out) if there are not dirty values (1) or there are (0)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

)

Add in database a list of missing market data.

Add in database a list of missing market data

  • If a market datum (imc, pro, dat, src) is already stored as missing, do not add it again, only set the status as the given by parameter.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    LdImcList of market data that was nos recovered: imc, dat.
    LdProList of market data profiles
    DatDate
    SrcSource string code.
    StaStatus to store missing market data as. See enum mkt_mis_status for details
    Returns
    Error code (0 if OK).
    Author

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdBlbSetImc ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdBlb,
void **  LdOut 
)

Set the Imc corresponding to the Bloomberg code of a list.

Set the Imc corresponding to the Bloomberg code of a list.

  • We get this list from Global View (if we're not already in Gv).

  • Information is obtained from the mkt_mcd table. If a umc (user market code) is not defined for a given imc, the imc itself is used.

    Global variables
    • App: to see if we are in GV or not. If we are not, it changes connection to hook database
    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    LdBlbList of Bloomberg market codes. Add columns imc, typ, cod, prd and dev
    LdOut(out) List of imcs in LdBlb
    Returns
    Error code. 0: Ok
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Jun/2009
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 18/Nov/2009: Add also code.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 29/Apr/2011: Add also prd and dev columns
    See Also
    MKTmcdUmcSetImc
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdCalCrdKey ( int  Vol,
char *  Ent,
char *  Dev,
char *  Pre,
char *  CrdKey 
)

Calculate the credit derivative key for an entity, currency and seniority.

Calculate the credit derivative key for an entity, currency and seniority. The curve code is formed as:

  • If wanted volatility curve [Vol = 1]: <Entity><Currency><Prelation order>
  • If not [Vol = 0]: <Entity><Currency><Prelation order>
Parameters
Vol(1) if volatility curve; (0) if not.
EntEntity code
DevCurrency code
PrePrelation order (Seniority) short code
CrdKey(out) Unique code. Variable of type CUR_TYPE
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Feb/2006
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 09/Oct/2007: Vol argument added
  • Ruben GIL - 29/Oct/2012: Apply doxygen rules

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdCreMcdOneBok ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdOpr,
int  Del 
)

Create the missing mkt_mcd records that must exist and don't.

Create the mkt_mcd records that must exist. It can delete all existent data if the "Del" parameter is set to a value different to zero.

  • Get the list of all defined imc-s in database.
  • Get the list of bond, future, equity and fund contracts, yield, cds and fsp curve points, fixing curve points and spots
  • For each of the above lists
  • + Add the imc column to each list

  • + Insert in database the imc-s that are not already defined

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context.
    LdOprOption position
    DelFlag to indicate if the data should be removed before re-creating or not (0).
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Jul/2000

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdGetMisTyp ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Typ,
char *  Pro,
void *  LdImc,
void **  LdMisImc 
)

Get the missing market data record that it has been already set a value.

Get the missing market data record that it has been already set a value If the market data type has value then it is used to get the missing market data record else the list with imc is used.

  • The resulting list has these colummns:
  • + imc : internal market data code
  • + dat : missing market data record date
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
TypMarket data type. It can be NULL
ProProfile of market data
LdImcList with the imc to check if they are missing market data record. It is must exists the column 'imc'. It can be NULL
LdMisImc(OUT) list with the missing market data record that it has been already set a value
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdGetUmc ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Typ,
char *  Whe,
void **  LdUmc 
)

Get all the existing user market codes for a market data type.

Get all the existing user market codes for a market data type.

  • The retuned list will have the columns:
  • - umc: user market code. In case this value is not valid, it will be initialise with the value of the internal market code ('imc')
  • - typ: market data typ
  • - cod: FIT internal code
  • - mat: maturity
  • - unt: maturity unit
  • The retuned list will sorted by 'umc'
Global variables
  • App: to see if we are in GV or not. If we are not, it changes connection to hook database
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
TypMarket data type for which the market codes are required. It can be NULL or empty and in that case all the market types wil be recovered
WheWhere clause to be added in the user market codes selection. It must begin with " AND ..."
LdUmc(out) Market codes list
Returns
Error code. 0: Ok
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 06/Jun/2007
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 01/Jul/2007: Call to lcMKTmcdGetUmc
  • Jesus Maria GARCIA - 28/Oct/2009: Added in the description the new columns in the return list
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdGetUmcImc ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Typ,
char *  Whe,
void **  LdUmc 
)

Get all the existing user market codes for a market data type.

Get all the existing user market codes for a market data type.

  • The retuned list will have the columns:
  • - imc: internal market code
  • - umc: user market code. In case this value is not valid, it will be initialise with the value of the internal market code ('imc')
  • - typ: market data typ
  • - cod: FIT internal code
  • - mat: maturity
  • - unt: maturity unit
  • The retuned list will sorted by 'umc'
Global variables
  • App: to see if we are in GV or not. If we are not, it changes connection to hook database
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
TypMarket data type for which the market codes are required. It can be NULL or empty and in that case all the market types wil be recovered
WheWhere clause to be added in the user market codes selection. It must begin with " AND ..."
LdUmc(out) Market codes list
Returns
Error code. 0: Ok

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdHis ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdImc,
char *  Mod 
)

Historise market data codification in database.

Historise market data codification in database.

  • Note that the data historised is obtained from database. So if the modification is a deletion this function must be called before the proper deletion. In the other cases, after the update in database.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context, GV
    LdImcList of internal market data codes. The list must have the column imc.
    ModMode of modification of the event. See FSA_MOD_XXX for details.
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)

)

Vol(1) if volatility curve; (0) if not.

DevColColumn name of the currency
PreColColumn name of the prelation order

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdSetImc ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Typ,
void *  Ld 
)

Set IMC, Internal Market data Code.

Set IMC, Internal Market data Code. If the market data structure is a contract price then a UMC is created from the contract code or ISIN

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
TypMarket data structure
LdList of codes. According to the type of data, need some columns or another ones:
  • ImcAss: "cod"
  • ImcBet: "cod", "pnt"
  • ImcCdf: "cod", "dfl", "pnt"
  • ImcCrv: "cod", "mat", "unt", "pnt"
  • ImcCtr: "cod", "ctr"
  • ImcFbp: "cod"
  • ImcFxg: "cod", "mat", "unt"
  • ImcInx: "cod"
  • ImcOpt: "cod", "npa", "BlnTyp", "cpu", "stk", "ech", "oop". "npa", "BlnTyp" are used only for the structured blind options. "BlnTyp" can not to come into the list.
  • ImcSpc: "cod"
  • ImcSpo: "cod", "ved"
  • ImcVmx: "cod", "Stk", "IniMat", "IniUnt", "DurMat", "DurUnt"
  • ImcVol: "cod", "cpu", "stk", "ech"
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 28/Apr/1999
Modified

  • Basilio TAMAYO - 04/MAY/2000: Do not need point type any longer, but we need point code (pnt) to distinguish Mmfuture points

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdSrtVmx ( char *  Fst,
char *  Snd,
char *  Trd,
void *  LdVmx 
)

Sort a volatility matrix list by the concepts that form the IMC.

Sort a volatility matrix list by the concepts that form the IMC: maturity (ASC), duration (ASC) and strike (ASC). Note that the list is not sorted by the IMC. It takes from the IMC the maturity, duration and strike and sorts the list.

Parameters
LdVmxDeals object
FstFirst order criterion (AFU_VMX_AXT_INI, AFU_VMX_AXT_DUR, AFU_VMX_AXT_STK)
SndSecond order criterion (AFU_VMX_AXT_INI, AFU_VMX_AXT_DUR, AFU_VMX_AXT_STK)
TrdThird order criterion (AFU_VMX_AXT_INI, AFU_VMX_AXT_DUR, AFU_VMX_AXT_STK)
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Jon BARRUTIA - 23/Jul/2007 modifies:
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 03/Dec/2007: Add sorting parameters
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdUmcSetImc ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdUmc,
void **  LdOut 
)

Set the Imc corresponding to the Umc-s of a list.

Set the Imc corresponding to the Umc-s of a list.

  • We get this list from Global View (if we're not already in Gv).

  • Information is obtained from the mkt_mcd table. If a umc (user market code) is not defined for a given imc, the imc itself is used.

    Global variables
    • App: to see if we are in GV or not. If we are not, it changes connection to the hook database

    LdUmcUmc list. Add columns imc, typ, cod, prd and dev

Update market data internal market codes (IMC) for betas

    LdMcdOldList with the old betas (only imc)
    LdMcdNewList with the new betas to create (imc, cod, dev and pnt)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdUpdCieImc ( void *  Ctx,
char *  OldCie,
char *  Cie 
)

Updates market data codes (internal and user codes) for one counterparty name change.

Updates market data codes (internal and user codes) for one counterparty name change.

  • Get the list of CDS curves that have this counterparty (CDS curve names depend on the counterparty).
  • Set the new curve names with the new counterparty code
  • Update all market data of curve points with new curve code Same with the volatility curves of a CDS. Same with the entity recovery rate.

  • Josune BIKUNA - 16/Jul/2007: From now on, there is a curve model in with the 'x' axis is formed with a column called 'default' (dfl) instead of maturity/unit, so the value for this new column must be recovered when recovering the points.
