AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdUpdCtrImc ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Trtm,
char *  Prd,
char *  OldCtr,
char *  Ctr,
char *  TeoBlbCod,
char *  TeoUmc 
)

Updates market data codes (internal and user codes) for contracts.

Updates market data codes (internal and user codes) for contracts. It also calculates the UMC taking into account the method defined into the 'umcMth' cst flag.

  • When umcMth is 'isin', get ISIN code from cb_emi.
  • When umcMth is 'code', get contract code from cc_ctr.
  • When calculating the umc; take into account that is possible to have multiple contracts with same ISIN code, so treat it (done only when the calculation method defined with 'umcMth is 'isin').
  • If get market data from Bloomberg add the Bloomberg code for fixed income (ISIN), funds (ISIN) and equity (ISIN + stock market).

  • If the market data from Bloomberg is managed, calculate the Bloomberg code for fixed income (ISIN), funds (ISIN) and equity (ISIN + stock market). This Bloomberg code will not be always calculated:

    • - In case the user has modified it, it will NOT be overwritten although the characteristics, for instance the ISIN has changed
    • - In case the user has NOT modified it, it will be overwritten only if the characteristics change, for instance the ISIN has changed
    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context.
    TrtmTreatment mode.
    PrdProduct.
    OldCtrPrevious name of contract.
    CtrContract.
    TeoBlbCodTheoretical Bloomberg code the contract should have before any contract modification. Use the function MKTmcdBlbGetCod for getting this value
    TeoUmcTheoretical user market code the contract should have before any contract modification. Use the function MKTmcdCalCtrUmc for getting this value
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Mikel ARETXAGA - 04/Jun/1999
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO & Mikel ARETXAGA - 09/Jun/1999 Reimplemented.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Aug/1999 Reimplemented
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 18/Oct/1999 Add case of treatment "v" for diffusion.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Dec/1999 If not in Global View, update table mkt_dta_his.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 18/Jan/2000 Check 'umcMth' cst for default umc's
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2000 Update market data only if contract type is valid
    • Itziar BIKENDI - 03/Jul/2000 Change '!= NULL' for 'IS NOT NULL' in GBloadRecord.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/Jul/2000: In modification mode, update imc only when contract has been changed. Remove the check of unique umc.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Sep/2000. If contract is not in database, go out
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 29/Nov/2000. Add case of product "fund"
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 25/Apr/2001. Treat table mkt_ver and mkt_his_sdd_aud
    • Josune BIKUNA - 22/Jan/2002. Destroy contract list within 'for' loop
    • Josune BIKUNA - 06/Feb/2002. If there is not market types list, end.
    • Edurne GORDOA - 28/Feb/2002. If we are in GV update mkt_dta_his else update mkt_dta_rdd_aud
    • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 14/Mar/2002: use mkt_dta_trt_aud
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 01/Apr/2003: MKTmcdGetTyp uses product instead of metaproduct
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 05/Nov/2003. Initialise Vbles. 'Imc', 'OldImc' to avoid lint w2k warnings.
    • Iker ZURIARRAIN - 07/Oct/2005. When umcMth is 'isin', get ISIN code from cb_emi, not cb_isn.
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 24/Nov/2005. When umcMth is 'code', get contract code from cc_ctr.
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 20/Dec/2005. When calculating imc and umc for Ctr market data type; take into account that is possible to have multiple contracts with same ISIN code, so treat it. Done only when the calculation method defined with 'umcMth is 'isin'.
    • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 06/Apr/2006: Add OldCtr to lcMKTmcdCtlUmc calls
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 12/Mar/2008: Without modifying IMC, take into account afuAst table
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 18/Jun/2009: Add the Bloomberg code.
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 16/Jun/2009: Add Ctx parameter to MKTmcdSetImc function.
    • Jesus Maria GARCIA - 25/Feb/2010: Use the new contract code to control the UMC
    • Jesus Maria GARCIA - 01/Mar/2010: Not set the Bloomberg code if we are in modification mode and the old Bloomberg code is empty
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 27/Oct/2011: lcMKTmcdBlbCod –> MKTmcdBlbGetCod
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 28/Oct/2011: Add TeoBlbCod parameter. If the Bloomberg code the contract has now and the theoretical one it should have without any contract modifications (value passed as parameter) are equal, it means that the user has not manipulated the Bloomerg code so it can be overwritten with the new theoretical one that corresponds right now in case it is different. Otherwise, that is, it will mean that the user has manipulated the code, and it is mantained.
    • Ruben GIL - 09/Mar/2012: Add new parameter in lcMKTmcdGetUmcFld function and adapt query to allow both parameters of the function
    • Ruben GIL - 22/Aug/2012: Add call to MKTmcdHis function to historice market data codification
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 25/Jul/2014: Add parameter TeoUmc, not always modify the umc
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Nov/2014: correct mistake: substitute '&' with '&&'
    • Nerea RAMOS - 17/Jan/2017: Set an information message if the contract is not found
    • Nerea RAMOS - 08/Feb/2017: Set an information message only in creation mode
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdUpdFxgPnt ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdMcdOld,
void *  LdMcdNew 
)

Update market data internal market codes (IMC) for fixing curve points.

Update market data internal market codes (IMC) for fixing curve points.

  • Depending on the existence of list will create, delete or modify market codes.

  • Both list must have equal number of lines and in the same order

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context.
    LdMcdOldList with the old points (only imc)
    LdMcdNewList with the new points to create (imc, cod, dev, unt and mat)
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Nov/2001
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2003: In modifying mode, change also the fixing rates in the past.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 18/Aug/2003: Bug, mistake in list to get ColImcOld
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 05/Nov/2003. Initialise Vbles. 'ColDev', 'ColMat', 'ColUnt', 'ColCod', 'ColImc', 'ColImcOld' to avoid lint w2k warnings.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 29/Oct/2004: update also table mkt_ver
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 11/Mar/2008: Update also tables afuAst and mkt_ver (it was not modified). Use macrodefinition MKT_TYP_FXG instead of hard coded text.
    • Ruben GIL - 22/Aug/2012: Add call to MKTmcdHis function to historice market data codification

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdUpdOprVol ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Typ,
void *  LdMcdOld,
void *  LdMcdNew 
)

Update market data internal market codes (IMC) for option price and volatility.

Update market data internal market codes (IMC) for option price and volatility

  • Depending on the existence of list will create, delete or modify market codes.
  • Both list must have equal number of lines and in the same order

  • Cannot delete market data because it can be more than on

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context.
    TypType of market data: "Opr" for option price; "Vol" for option volatility
    LdMcdOldList with the old options (only imc)
    LdMcdNewList with the new options to create (imc, cod, dev, prd, ech, cpu and stk)
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 05/Apr/2004
    Modified
    • Ruben GIL - 22/Aug/2012: Add call to MKTmcdHis function to historice market data codification
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmcdUpdPreImc ( void *  Ctx,
char *  OldPre,
char *  Pre 
)

Updates market data codes (internal and user codes) for one counterparty name change.

Updates market data codes (internal and user codes) for one counterparty name change.

  • Get the list of CDS curves that have this prelation order (CDS curve names depend on the prelation order).
  • Set the new curve names with the new prelation order
  • Update all market data of curve points with new curve code
  • Get the recovery rates with current prelation order

  • Set the new codes for those recovery rates

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context.
    OldPrePrevious prelation order short name.
    PreNew prelation order short name.
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Feb/2006
    See Also
    MKTmcdUpdCieImc

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmxfCalFwd ( char *  Mxf,
char *  Crv,
void *  LdMkt,
char *  Dat,
char *  Bdt,
char *  Edt,
char *  Bas,
double *  Fwd 
)

Calculate a forward rate interpolated from the matrix or the hybrids.

Calculate a forward rate interpolated from the matrix or the hybrids In the market data list passed as parameter (LdMkt), it must exist at least an object 'Mxf' containing the matrixes for the calculations.

Parameters
MxfFra matrix code
CrvYield curve code
LdMktMarket data object list
DatCalculation date
BdtBegin date
EdtEnd date
BasCalculation basis
Fwd(out) Forward yield
Returns
Error code (0: OK) algorith:
  • Tij here represents an existing point in the matrix
  • Ti here represents a point already interpolated on between Tij and Tij+1
  • T is the final interpolated forward type
  • Interpolation between T11, T12, T21 and T22 is carried out first between T11 and T12 to get T1 and between T21 and T22 to get T2, and after between T1 and T2 to get T, as follows:
  • 4 cases are treated. Three of them require interpoling.

  • A number represents one of the interpolation cases

    D1 D D2 D1 D D2

    s1 | T11 | | T21 | s1 | T11 | 3 | T21 |
    s | T1 | T | T2 | s | 2 | 4 | |
    s2 | T12 | | T22 | s2 | T12 | | T22 |
  • Extrapolation on the durations axis has been introduced. It is noted that this extrapolation is only valid for durations close to the last duration. Isma - 07/Jun/1999
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 22/Apr/1999
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 13/Oct/2003: Warnings.
  • Ruben GIL - 29/Oct/2012: Apply doxygen rules
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmxfChk ( void *  LdTra,
int  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Control fra matrixes.

Control fra matrixes

  • Note: Used matrixes are marked, but those not used are not removed.
Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historic data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historic)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Algorithm
  • Mark all used matrixes
  • Mark recursively all parent matrixes for spread matrixes
  • Verify that all non-spread matrix have at least a non-null value
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 21/Apr/1999
Modified
  • Edurne GORDOA - 05/Jun/2000. Used ERRsetWarn
  • Iker ZURIARRAIN - 12/Oct/2005. Add IsCur parameter and give MIS_HIS_MXF warning. Also change MISSING_MXF to MIS_MXF.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmxfGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Get LdMxf object (historical)

Get LdMxf object (historical)

  • Note: When the object is not correctly created there may be memory left without freeing.
  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatCalculation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
LdMkt(out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 09/Aug/1999

  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 14/Mar/2002: use mkt_dta_trt_aud

  • Ruben GIL - 29/Oct/2012: Apply doxygen rules

)

Get LdMxf object.

  • Note: When the object is not correctly created there may be memory left without freeing.
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatCalculation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book and "mkt_dta_trt_aud" data source. If it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
DtaSrcData source ("mkt_dta" or "mkt_dta_his" or "mkt_dta_trt_aud"). It can not be NULL, but in case of empty (""), the data source will be "mkt_dta_his".
LdTraDeals object, NULL for market data entry

Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Jul/2000
Modified
  • Edurne GORDOA - 09/Apr/2002. Separate interface with engines and C treatment
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 13/Oct/2003: Warning. DYNcbn -> DYNcbnChk
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 11/Jun/2004: Specific error.
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 23/Nov/2004: call to lcMKTmxfRea
  • Ruben GIL - 29/Oct/2012: Apply doxygen rules
See Also
MKTmxfRea, lcMKTmxfRea
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTmxfUpdateImc ( void *  Ctx)

Updates market data codes internal market codes (IMC).

Updates market data codes internal market codes (IMC).

  • The algorithm tries to minimise the time when all imc-s are already defined, which will be the typical case.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context.
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Isma ETXEBERRIA - 18/Aug/1999

    • Ruben GIL - 30/Oct/2012: Apply doxygen rules

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTnprGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Fund prices historic data retrieval.

Fund prices historic data retrieval.

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatHistorisation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 30/Nov/2000
  • Edurne GORDOA - 27/Feb/2002. Modifications to get historic data from correct table depending on if we are in FOX or GV
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 14/Mar/2002: use mkt_dta_trt_aud
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2006: Add parameter MktHis
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Oct/2007: Get also historic data from mkt_dta_his_arc
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Feb/2012: Use standard function MKTgetHisDta
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Feb/2012: Correct the type of market data.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKToprAddImc ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdOpr,
void *  LdVol 
)

Update the market data codes for option price and volatility.

Update the market data codes for option price and volatility

  • Create or update market datum of new option deals
  • Do not delete because it could happen that there are more than one deal with same values and the market datum would be still necessary. par :
    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context (FO book)
    LdOprList of values for option price: npa, typ, cod, dev, prd, ech, cpu, stk, imc. It can be NULL
    LdVolList of values for option volatility: npa, typ, cod, dev, prd, ech, cpu, stk, imc. It can be NULL
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Apr/2004
    Modified
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 08/Jun/2004. Use MKTgetDffAls instead of MBOOKgetMktAls
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 08/Jun/2004: Check if LdAls exists
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 14/May/2008: Take diffusion books depending on diffusion books type, call to MKTgetDffTypAls
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 19/May/2008: Call to MKTgetDffAls instead of MKTgetDffTypAls. This function will be called from FO. It will go to his 'hook' to get the diffusion books. So it is not necessary to limit the books, it won't arrive never to a master MO book (multi-site).
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 18/Jul/2008: It receives a list with the deals data instead of a deal number

AFUMCR_EXP int MKToprGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load option prices + volatilities into data structure (historic)

Load option prices + volatilities into data structure (historic) Adds 2 objects to the market data structure ("Opr" and "Vol"), but in the checking phase, both are grouped into only one ("Opr").

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatDate
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 06/Aug/1999
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Sep/2000. Get also column src
  • Edurne GORDOA - 28/Feb/2002. Get data from mkt_dta_rdd_aud
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 14/Mar/2002: use mkt_dta_trt_aud
  • Josune BIKUNA - 03/Dec/2003. Use mkt_dta_trt_aud or mkt_dta_his depending if in GV or not
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2006: Add parameter MktHis
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Oct/2007: Get also historic data from mkt_dta_his_arc
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Feb/2012: Use standard function MKTgetHisDta

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriAddPrxQuo ( void *  Ctx,
void **  LdDta 
)

Add different bond prices according the quotation mode.

Add bond prices according the quotation mode for each contract, dat combination. This function only can be used for bond prices market data It adds colums to save clean price (BndPriCpc), dirty price until settlement date (BndPriDpc), dirty price until current date (BndPriDac), dirty price until following date (BndPriTac)

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdDta(IN/OUT) List with the market data values (bond prices). The list must have these columns:
  • typ : market data type
  • ctr : contract code
  • dat : generation date
  • val : price And following columns are added:
  • BndPriCpc : (OUT) clean price
  • BndPriDpc : (OUT) dirty price with accrued till settlement date
  • BndPriDac : (OUT) dirty price with accrued till generation date
  • BndPriTac : (OUT) dirty price with accrued till next date
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Jon BARRUTIA - 27/May/2013
Modified
  • Jesus Maria GARCIA - 30/May/2013: Check if there are not bond contracts

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriCalMdfDur ( void *  LdPri,
void *  LdCtr,
char *  Dat,
char *  Ctr,
double *  Dur 
)

Calcule duration of one bond.

Calcule duration of one bond.

  • Duracion
  • Duracion modificada = ------------—
  • (1 + TAE)
  • SUM ((Nby * Flw) / pow ((1 + TAE), Nby))
  • Duracion = --------------------------------------—
  • SUM (Flw / pow ((1 + TAE), Nby))
  • Duracion
  • Duracion modificada = ------------—
  • (1 + Yld)
  • SUM ((Nby * Flw) / pow ((1 + Yld), Nby))
  • Duracion = --------------------------------------—
  • SUM (Flw / pow ((1 + Yld), Nby))
  • Where:
  • + SUM = Summatory of all flows
  • + Nby = Time in years from the flow payment date until date Dat.
  • + Flw = Flow.
  • + Yld = Yield from the market data price.

  • For frns, duration is sensitivity divided into dirty price (both calculated with only the current period).

    Parameters
    LdPriList of bond market data
    LdCtrContract list.
    DatCalculation date
    CtrContract code
    Dur(out) Duration
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Feb/2010
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Nov/2010: Get the dirty price with the accrued of calculation date.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Nov/2010: Make calculations with TAE, not yield.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Feb/2011: Change maximum TAE as 1000.0
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 10/Jun/2011: Carried from FIT applocation and changed name (previous name was FDPcalDurBnd). Also Ctx and Yld180 parameters have been removed.
    • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 16/Jun/2011: Desglose it in two functions (MKTpriCalMdfDur and MKTpriCalMdrWthDpc)
    Note
    moved from FdpCmp.c. Re-moved from FIT FdpFcn.c. See MKTpriCalMdrWthDpc
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriCalMdrWthDpc ( void *  LdCtr,
char *  Dat,
char *  Ctr,
double  Dpc,
double *  Dur 
)

Calcule duration of one bond.

Calcule duration of one bond.

  • Duracion
  • Duracion modificada = ------------—
  • (1 + TAE)
  • SUM ((Nby * Flw) / pow ((1 + TAE), Nby))
  • Duracion = --------------------------------------—
  • SUM (Flw / pow ((1 + TAE), Nby))
  • Duracion
  • Duracion modificada = ------------—
  • (1 + Yld)
  • SUM ((Nby * Flw) / pow ((1 + Yld), Nby))
  • Duracion = --------------------------------------—
  • SUM (Flw / pow ((1 + Yld), Nby))
  • Where:
  • + SUM = Summatory of all flows
  • + Nby = Time in years from the flow payment date until date Dat.
  • + Flw = Flow.
  • + Yld = Yield from the market data price.

  • For frns, duration is sensitivity divided into dirty price (both calculated with only the current period).

    Parameters
    LdCtrContract list.
    DatCalculation date
    CtrContract code
    DpcDirty price
    Dur(out) Duration
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Alex RODRIGUEZ - 16/Jun/2011:
    Modified
    • Lorea NAVARRO - 29/Oct/2012: Modification in header to avoid doxygen warnings
    Note
    moved from FdpCmp.c. Re-moved from FIT FdpFcn.c. Desglose it in two functions: (MKTpriCalMdfDur and MKTpriCalMdrWthDpc)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriCerRfr ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Cdt,
char *  Pro,
int  MngCnv,
void *  LdTraObj,
void **  LdCod,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Spread pricer refresh.

Calculates the price having a date, calculation date, curve, profile, for a list of contracts

Parameters
CtxDB context
DatDate
CdtCalculation date
ProProfile to get the curve
MngCnvManage conversion. Flag to see how to calculate the flows:
  • 0 Ignore conversions (call/put) taking allways all coupons
  • 1 Manage conversions (call/put) taking coupons till first conversion date
LdTraObjObject of lists of deals. It can be NULL. If it is NULL, the object of deals will be generated with the contract list LdCod passed as parameter
LdCod(in/out) Contract list
LdMkt(out) Market data
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriCerSpr ( void *  Ctx,
int  Line,
char *  Cdt,
int  MngCnv,
void *  LdMkt,
void **  LdCod 
)

Spread pricer.

Recalculates the price. For each contract, take its curve, and shift it. Estimate unfixed flows with the original curve and calculate contract's price using the the shifted curve to discount every flow.

Parameters
CtxDatabase connection
LineLine to recalculate
CdtCalculation date
MngCnvManage conversion. Flag to see how to calculate the flows:
  • 0 Ignore conversions (call/put) taking allways all coupons
  • 1 Manage conversions (call/put) taking coupons till first conversion date
LdMktMarket data
LdCod(in/out) Contract list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 07/Jan/2002
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 18/Dec/2003. When shifting the curve, this is, adding the spread value to the curve points, add it to the zero coupon curve.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/May/2005: new parameter Ctr in CVTprice and Ctr and Nat in TYPEcotation
  • Lorea NAVARRO - 17/Oct/2006: Removed the call get_dev_enu function and add Ctx paramter.
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 07/Nov/2007: MISSING_CRV is an MKT_TRT error (generic for all MKT files)
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/Oct/2008: Use centralised function to convert prices from one quotation to another: AFUprdQuoCnvPrx
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 28/Oct/2009: Add Country ("") parameter to GETmrgCash.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriFindTac ( void *  LdPri,
char *  Ctr,
double *  Tac 
)

Find a accrued until tomorrow date for a contract in LdPri One important thing to be considered with this value is that on the previous date of the the coupon end, the accrued coupon amount will be 0.0. It is considered that 'tomorrow' is in the next coupon.

Note
MODIFICATIONS ON THIS FUNCTION MUST TAKE INTO ACCOUNT THE FUNCTION MKTpriGetPriZero ().
Parameters
LdPriBond price list
CtrContract code
Tac(out) Accrued of tomorrow
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 14/Dec/2012
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 08/Oct/2013: Set a DYNcbnChk to detect easier a possible error if any column does not exist
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriFindTaf ( void *  LdPri,
char *  Ctr,
double *  Taf 
)

Find a 'full' accrued until tomorrow date for a contract in LdPri One important thing to be considered with this value is that on the previous date of the coupon end, the full coupon will be considered as accrued.

Note
MODIFICATIONS ON THIS FUNCTION MUST TAKE INTO ACCOUNT THE FUNCTION MKTpriGetPriZero ().
Parameters
LdPriBond price list
CtrContract code
Taf(out) Tomorrow accrued full
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 04/Sep/2014

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Bond prices historic data retrieval.

Bond prices historic data retrieval

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatHistorisation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 26/Jul/1999
Modified

  • Josune BIKUNA - 26/Aug/1999: Sort by 'cod' column
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Sep/2000. Get also column src

  • Edurne GORDOA - 27/Feb/2002. Modifications to get historic data from correct table depending on if we are in FOX or GV
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 14/Mar/2002: use mkt_dta_trt_aud
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2006: Add parameter MktHis

  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Feb/2012: Use standard function MKTgetHisDta

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriGetPri ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
void *  LdTra,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load bond prices into a single data structure, LdMkt.

Load bond prices into a single data structure, LdMkt

  • Get also the prices for asset swap deals in the same price list. These prices will correspond to synthetic bond contracts formed from the information of the bond and swap contracts of the asset swap deals, this is, they will be similar to the bond contract but with the swap schedule which is not matched, so each price will correspond to an asset swap deal.
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
ProProfile
LdTraDeals object
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Note
MODIFICATIONS ON THIS FUNCTION MUST TAKE INTO ACCOUNT THE FUNCTIONS MKTpriGetPriZero (), MKTpriGetHis ().
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 16/Mar/1999
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 25/Jun/1999: Add LdBndo
  • Isma ETXEBERRIA & Mikel ARETXAGA - 30/Aug/1999: Add LdFutc and LdFuto
  • Josune BIKUNA - 24/Jul/2002. In the prices list, add the prices for asset swap deals. Each asset swap deal will have a different price although the bond contract is the same, as it depends on the swap contract.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 27/Dec/2002. Get also proces for LdBndcBdeNotAs, LdBndcBdeAs
  • Edurne GORDOA - 30/Sep/2003: Get also prices for cdo cash
  • Manuel SANMARTIN - 19/Jul/2007: Remove cdo, dont need get bond price for cdo.
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriGetPriZero ( void *  LdTra,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Create a price list for the BdE next date (useless)

Create a price list for the BdE next date (useless).

  • This list is created to ensure that all prices are available with a value of 0.0 because it's used for matured deals.
  • Get also the prices for asset swap deals in the same price list. These prices will correspond to synthetic bond contracts formed from the information of the bond and swap contracts of the asset swap deals, this is, they will be similar to the bond contract but with the swap schedule which is not matched, so each price will correspond to an asset swap deal.
Parameters
LdTraDeal list
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 29/Jun/1999
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 27/Oct/2003. Add the 'spc' (market spread) column in the price list
  • Gema ACHA - 30/Jun/2006: Set LdTra as parameter. Get the prices for asset swap deals
  • Josune BIKUNA - 06/Jul/2006: Add the management of LdBndcBdeNotAs, LdBndcBdeAs lists
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 08/Oct/2013: Add dac and tac columns
  • Josune BIKUNA - 04/Sep/2014: Add taf column (tomorrow accrued full)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriPrcCalCco ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdCtr,
char *  DatCal,
double  RndPrx,
int  Typ,
void **  LdRes 
)

Specific calculations of bond pricers 'Yield from price' or 'Price from yield'.

Specific calculations of bond pricers 'Yield from price' ou 'Price from yield' to calculate the accrued coupon. The results are returned if a list. Depending on the value of the calculation type the results will be different:

  • If the calculation type is 1, this is, 'Accrued', the returned list will have the columns:
  • - 'CalVal': accrued
  • - 'Sns' : nb days of accrued
  • If the calculation type is 2 or 3, this is, 'Price form yield' or 'Yield from price', the returned list will have the columns:
  • - 'CalVal': price if 'price from yield' and yield if 'yield from price'
  • - 'Sns' : sensibilite
  • - 'Cnv' : convexite
  • - 'Drt' : duration
  • - 'Cpr' : cpc (Clean price)
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdCtrList with the contrat information
DatCalCalculation date
RndPrxBond contract price (always in dirty price)
TypCalculation type. 1: Accrued; 2: Price form yield; 3: Yield from price
LdRes(OUT) Result list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Note
Obtained from ContFin.c file of FIT project.
Author
Alex RODRIGUEZ - 16/Jun/2011:
Modified
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 13/Jul/2011: Reorganice funtion to manage Typ == 2 and Typ == 3 cases.
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriSavDef ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdAls,
char *  Dat 
)

Save default prices for bonds, futures and equities in a list of books.

Save default prices for bonds, futures and equities in a list of books In each als, get the list of bond, future and equities without prices for each official profile and set its val to 100.0 or 10.0, according to the quotation type, in current and historic data tables

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdAlsList of alias
DatDate to save data
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 29/Sep/2000
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 21/Dec/2016. Use MKTgetOffPro to get list of profiles.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTpriUpdQuo ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdCod 
)

Update existing market data whose quotation has changed.

Update existing market data whose quotation has changed.

  • In current book update the current and historic market data for the list of codes
  • In the books to diffuse, update only the current market data.

  • If the quoation type of a contract has changed, besides updating market data, the contract has to be updated. The contract has a field (cb_typ) which stores this information.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase conexion.
    LdCodList of codes with change of quotation: cod, imc, OldQuo, NewQuo, OldQtp, NewQtp
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2005
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 25/May/2005: Get all distinct pairs of val-dat for each imc.
    • Josune BIKUNA - 22/Jun/2006: If the quoation type ('price', 'yield') of a contract has been changed (price -> yield or yield -> price), the contract has to be update. The contract has a field (cb_typ) which stores this information.
    • Ismael SERRANO - 22/Aug/2006: Use AluDff instead of MktDff
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Oct/2008: Add new parameter Dev in AFUprdQuoCnvPrx

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTproGetPro ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
char *  FthPro,
char *  MktPro,
void *  LdPty,
void *  LdRfq,
int  Ndh,
void **  LdPro 
)

Get the list of profiles that match a set of conditions.

Get the complete information of profiles that match a set of conditions. This function is quite general, so it can be used in a wide range of necessities.

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
ProName of the profile. If it is NULL or "", ignore this condition.
FthProName of the parent profile. If it is "" ignore this condition. If it is NULL make sure that the parent profile is NULL, otherwise fill the name
MktProName of the market data profile. If it is "" ignore this condition. If it is NULL make sure that the market data profile is NULL, otherwise fill the name
LdPtyList of profile type (See enum rdd_pro). Column "Pty"
LdRfqList of revaluation frequency (See enum rdd_frq_typ). Column "Rfq"
NdhFlag of saving market data in next date treatmente. If it is -1, ignore it.
LdPro(out). List of profiles with all fields of the table, order by "pro".
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 13/Dec/2016

WheWhere clause to add as condition (i.e. "AND UPPER (pro) LIKE '%XX%'"
LdPro(out). List of profiles with all fields of the table, order by "pro".

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTrrtChk ( void *  LdTra,
int  IsCur,

)

Control all necessary recovery rates are in market data object.

Control all necessary recovery rates are in market data object.

  • If Cds object from LdMkt is already checked we already know which recovery rates are needed

  • See which ones of the required Rrt are not present and set a warning for each of them.

    Parameters

    IsCurCurrent or historic data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historic)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTsavDta ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Pro,
void *  LdDta,
int  SavTyp,
int  MktCal,
char *  MktDat,
int  MktDatTyp,
int  Rmv,
void *  LdAlsNdf,
void *  LdAlsTdb 
)

Update the mkt_dta on a base.

Update the mkt_dta on a base The explanation of types of value source can be found in MKTsavOneDta algorith: For each element in LdDta If value modified on purpose (column new)

  • Save value and status of datum
  • If profile is the main one copy value to rest of profiles If old value accepted
  • Modify status of datum If MktDat is not NULL historise the saved data If LdAlsNdf is NULL avoid to control if all books are in spected date If LdAlsTdb is NULL avoid to control if all books are in spected date
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
ProProfile
LdDtaList of data to update (imc, src, new, [val], [sta], Vdt)
SavTypType of saving. See mkt_sav_typ in mkt_def.h
MktCalCalculation methods. See enum mkt_cal. Only with SavTyp is MKT_SAV_CAL.
MktDatModification date
MktDatTypType of data saving according to the date. See mkt_sav_dat_typ for details
RmvFlag to delete from the list the market data that is not modified.
LdAlsNdfList of books with other books in diffusion
LdAlsTdbList of terminal diffusion books
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 04/May/1999
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 21/Jan/2000 Rewrite function having in mind the current and new status of data. Join MKTsavDta and MKTsavDtaPro in a single function.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Aug/2000. Add parameter SavTyp and MktDat.
  • Edurne GORDOA - 23/Aug/2000. Use profiles type enumerated for pty
  • Basilio TAMAYO & Mikel ARETXAGA - 19/Oct/2000.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Jan/2001. New management of SavTyp.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Jan/2002. Add crystallisation case
  • Edurne GORDOA - 18/Mar/2002. Carried from mkt.c
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 01/Nov/2002. Add parameter LdAls
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 15/Oct/2003. Initialise Vble. 'ColPro' to avoid w2k lint warnings.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 24/Nov/2003. After saving the data passed as parameter,if the data corresponds to bond prices, try to calculate and save their associated bond spreads.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Feb/2009: Divide books to diffuse between terminal and intermediary ones.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Jun/2010: Define variable WekDay as CLINT
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Jul/2010: Add a new list (LdIgn) with the list of imc-pro that must be ignored and not save in database.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 21/Oct/2010: Nott need column src in LdDta.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTsavMis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
void *  LdDta,
int  His 
)

Add missing market data in LdDta for all official profiles.

Add missing market data in LdDta for all official profiles

  • Get all official profiles
  • Get all profiles and market data in database from the list LdDta

  • If it doesn't exist, add it and set an info.

    DatApplication date.
    LdDtaList of market data (cod, imc, val, Idx)
    HisFlag to save also historic (1) or only current (0) market data

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTsavOneDta ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Imc,
char *  Pro,
double  Val,
int  ValSrc,
int  Idx,
int  Sta,
char *  Vdt,
int *  NbUpd 
)

Update a market datum for an imc.

Update a market datum for an imc with a value and a status, depending on the status of the current datum and the source of value, it will carry on some actions or others.

  • The different sources of data (ValSrc) are:
  • - MKT_VAL_NEW : User entered a new value for this profile.
  • - MKT_VAL_OLD : User accepted the old value for this profile without modifying it.
  • - MKT_VAL_INH : User entered a new value for another profile and pro inherits value in case of mkt_sta_dirty or mkt_sta_copied.
  • - MKT_VAL_INH_ALL: User entered a new value for another profile and pro inherits value in case of mkt_sta_dirty, mkt_sta_copied, mkt_sta_rtfile or mkt_sta_rtcalc.
  • - MKT_VAL_RTM : Real Time process modified this value for this profile.
  • Each of them manages the current data in a different way according to the current status of market datum.
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
ImcImc of the datum to update
ProProfile
ValValue to update
ValSrcSource of the value-profile. See mkt_val_typ in mkt_def.h
IdxIndex of the market data dictionary
StaNew status of market datum. See mkt_dta_status in mkt_def.h
VdtValue date (date the market datum is originally for). It may be NULL
NbUpdNumber of market data updated in database. It may be 0 or 1.
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 21/Jan/2000
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Sep/2000. Add parameter Src
  • Basilio TAMAYO & Mikel ARETXAGA - 19/Oct/2000. Add default case
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Jan/2001. Add parameter Sta
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Jan/2002. Add new source (MKT_VAL_CRY) for crystallisation
  • Edurne GORDOA - 18/Mar/2002. Carried from mkt.c
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 29/Oct/2002. Make it simplier and change where clauses to take advantage of the index on table.
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 31/May/2003. Add two decimals more to 'val' field. (6–> 8).
  • Josune BIKUNA - 29/May/2009: When the market data value source is MKT_VAL_INH_ALL, the rest of profiles must be also inherit the value in case of mkt_sta_rtfile and mkt_sta_rtcalc
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 26/Nov/2009: Add parameter NbUpd.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/Dec/2009: Update database if there is a change of value or status.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 26/Jul/2010: Add the market data dictionary index Idx and delete Src.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 03/Feb/2012: Add parameter Vdt (value date)
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Feb/2012: Call GBdmdSelCnt with ERRchkGb instead of ERRchk
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Mar/2016: If status of market dataum is mkt_sta_close, only update if the new status is also mkt_sta_close
Note
Modifications must be carried in parallel with MKTsavOneHisDta
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTsavOneHisDta ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Imc,
char *  Pro,
char *  Dat,
double  Val,
int  ValSrc,
int  Idx,
int  Sta,
char *  Vdt,
int *  NbUpd 
)

Update a historic market datum for an imc.

Update a historic market datum for an imc, date and profile with a value and a status.

  • Depending on the status of the current datum and the source of value, it will carry on some actions or others.
  • Each of them manages the current data in a different way according to the current status of market datum.
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
ImcImc of the datum to update
ProProfile
DatDate
ValValue to update
ValSrcSource of the value-profile. See mkt_val_typ in mkt_def.h
IdxIndex of the market data dictionary
StaStatus of datum
VdtValue date (date the market datum is originally for). It can be NULL
NbUpdNumber of market data updated in database. It may be 0 or 1.
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Sep/2009
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Sep/2000. Add parameter Src
  • Basilio TAMAYO & Mikel ARETXAGA - 19/Oct/2000. Add default case
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Jan/2002. Add new source (MKT_VAL_CRY) for crystallisation
  • Edurne GORDOA - 18/Mar/2002. Carried from mkt.c
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 29/Oct/2002. Make it simplier and change where clauses to take advantage of the index on table
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 31/May/2003. Add two decimals more to 'val' field. (6–> 8).
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/Sep/2009: Add parameter NbUpd.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 15/Oct/2009: When the market data value source is MKT_VAL_INH_ALL, the rest of profiles must be also inherit the value in case of mkt_sta_rtfile and mkt_sta_rtcalc

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTspoChk ( void *  LdTra,
AFUdatCurHis  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Controls spot list. It sets warning messages in case market data is missing.

Controls spot list. It removes spots for not used currencies except the currency defined into the 'FspDev' applicacion default option.

It sets warning messages in case market data is missing

Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historic data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historic)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 19/Mar/1999
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTspoChkFxgSpo ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  AccDev,
void *  LdFxgSpot 
)

Compare the fixing spots with the revaluation spots.

Verify if the fixing spots passed as parameter are equal to those spots which have been used to revaluate deals. For each difference, a warning message will be created.

Parameters

DatCalculation date
ProProfile
AccDevAccount currency
LdFxgSpotList of fixing spots
Returns
Error code. 0: Ok

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTspoGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load spots of the day (historical)

Load spots of the day (historical)

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatSpot date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 08/Jun/1999

  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Aug/1999. Substitute DYNlookUpInfo with DYNlookUp
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Sep/2000. Get also column src

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTspoMkt2Spo ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdDta,
char *  Dat,
void **  LdSpo 
)

Convert the list of spot market data into a list with spot format.

Convert the list of spot market data into a list with spot format

  • Add new lines to the list of spot market data to complete all active currencies.
  • Calculate the values of the newly completed lines with values in database

  • Convert the LdDta into the structure of table spot

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    LdDtaList of market data (columns imc and val)
    DatDate
    LdSpo(out) List of spot values with columns dev1, val1, dev2, val2. To be used in gvSPOTSaveList. Dev1 is always reference currency and val1 1.0
    Returns
    Error code. 0: Ok
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 04/Nov/2002
    Modified

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTspoNorm ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdVal,
char *  RefDev,
void **  LdSpo 
)

Normalise a list obtained from table "spot".

Normalise a list obtained from table "spot". Convert a list with dev1, dev2, val1 and val2 columns into a LdSpo with the columns described in the heading of this module, that is: cod, ved and val. Input list has the spots between all combinations of two currencies Output list has only the spots between reference currency and all other currencies that have different meta-currency than RefDev

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdVal(in) List of spot in fixing format (dev1, dev2, val1, val2) as obtained from SPOTinit. Assume that refDev is always in dev1
RefDevReference currency for LdSpo
LdSpo(out) List of spot in mkt format (cod, ved, val)
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Jul/2000
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Jul/2000. New version

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTtarCalRat ( void *  LdMkt,
char *  Crv,
char *  Dat,
char *  ValDat,
char *  Bdt,
char *  DfcDat,
char *  Dev,
double  Bas,
double *  Rat 
)

Calculate a TMP average rate in a date.

Calculate a TMP average rate in a date for estimating the forward interest of a variable repo or loan.

Calculate the rate and construct the structure of Tar object as long as it is needed. First call to this function will create Tar object in LdMkt and sucessive calls will complete the data

The method builds the Tar (TMP average rate) curve by calculating the TMP forward rates after a yield curve.

The first time this function calculates values for all the dates from ValDat to DfcDat. Further calls may find the target date calculated. If this is not the case all dates from the last calculated to the current one will be calculated.

If the period has begun (Bdt <= Valdat) the rate calculate will be directly taken, else the froward from Bdt to DfcDat will be calculated

Parameters
LdMktList of objects
CrvCurve name
DatCalculation date
ValDatValue date (RemDec)
BdtBegin date of the period
DfcDatDate when the rate should be calculated
DevCurrency of the curve
BasBase used to convert the discount factor into rate
Rat(out) Rate at the asked date
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Ramon MARTINEZ - 10/Jul/2000
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 30/Aug/2000. If Rate has been already calculated return its value.
  • Mikel ARETXAGA - 17/Oct/2000. Add "tmp" column to "LdTar" to save TMP rates.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTtarFree ( void **  Obj)

Free tar curves.

Free tar curves

Parameters
ObjTar curve object
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Ramon MARTINEZ - 11/Jul/2000

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTvmxDefCnf ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdObj,
char *  Mod,
char *  OldMtx,
char *  Mtx,
char *  Ccy 
)

Confirmation of the volatility matrix definition window.

Confirmation of the volatility matrix definition window.

  • Save the init dates, durations and strikes of the matrix.
  • Construct a list with the imcs to create, delete and modify in database.
  • Save the imcs.

  • In current books and books in diffussion.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    LdObjList of objects of volatility matrix window.
    ModMode of volatility matrix definition window
    OldMtxOld volatility matrix code
    MtxNew volatility matrix code
    CcyCurrency
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)

    Basilio TAMAYO - 08/Dec/2006

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTvmxGetVmxMtx ( void *  LdVmx,
char *  Vmx,
char *  Zax,
int  ZaxMat,
char *  ZaxUnt,
double  ZaxStk,
void **  LdOut 
)

Returns the matrix of volatilities data list.

Returns the matrix of volatilities data list. The list has N columns called b0, b1... The number of columns depends on the number of points defined for the X and Y axes.

Parameters
LdVmxMatrix of volatilities data list
VmxMatrix code
ZaxConcept saved into the Z axis ("Ini", "Dur" or "Stk")
ZaxMatIf "Ini" or "Dur", maturity unit
ZaxUntIf "Ini" or "Dur", maturity unit term
ZaxStkIf "Stk", strike value
LdOut(out) Matrix data list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Jon BARRUTIA - 24/Jul/2007

  • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Feb/2012: Set new field Vdt (Valid date)
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Apr/2012: If get last price, there are two date fields: the first one with date of exchange time and the second with date in local time.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Feb/2015: If close file, set pointer as NULL
See Also
MKTxchBlbGetHisDta

Read the historic market data values from the Bloomberg answer file.

MKTxchBlbGetDta
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTxchBlbGetHisMkt ( void *  Ctx,
int  BlbTsk,
int *  RqtKey,
int *  Ord,
void *  LdImc,
char *  Bdt,
char *  Edt,
int  PrxFrq,
void **  LdDta 
)

Get historic market data values within a period of dates from Bloomberg data license.

Get historic market data values within a period of dates from Bloomberg data license.

  • Generate a new request file with the market data codes that must read from Bloomberg.
  • Send to Bloomberg host the request filename and get the answer file. Read it in a list.
  • Sort the list by date and Bloomberg code.
  • If there is only one date to ask prices for, use the getdata program with single point history fields.
  • If there are more than one date, use the gethistoroy progrma.

  • Exception: fund prices are not informed in "single point history"

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    BlbTskFlag to set a request, get an anser or both. See enum afu_blb_tsk_typ.
    RqtKey(in/out) Key of the request block. If unknown, set -1
    Ord(in/out) Order of current request file in the request block.
    LdImcList of market data identifiers to ask prices for. Columns: imc, BlbCod
    BdtBegin date of the prices
    EdtEnd date of the prices.
    PrxFrqPrice frequency. See enum mkt_blb_his_frq_typ (mkt_def.h) for details.
    LdDta(out) List of market data.
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Oct/2009
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 02/Mar/2010: Add PrxFrq parameter
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Apr/2010: Add posibility to link request with a terminal user.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 01/Jul/2010: Add parameters LnkUsr, LnkSnb and LnkWks in call to lcMKTxchBlbGetCurDta
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Sep/2010: remove parameter Lnk.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 04/Jan/2012: Include source per fixed income prices.
      • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Jan/2017: Use AO BlbBndPty to know if requeste prices for fixed income will be bid prices or medium prices.
      • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Nov/2017: Add parameter BlbTsk to know if must set a request to BLB, get the answer or both at the same time
      • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Nov./2017: Add parameters RqtKey and Ord
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTxchBlbGetMkt ( void *  Ctx,
int  BlbTsk,
int *  RqtKey,
int *  Ord,
char *  Dat,
int  BlbMktPrx,
void *  LdMcd,
void **  LdDta 
)

Get current market data values from Bloomberg data license.

Get current market data values from Bloomberg data license.

  • If date of market data is more than one day past, ask for historic prices.
  • Generate a new request file with the market data codes that must read from Bloomberg.

  • Send to Bloomberg host the request filename and get the answer file. Read it in a list.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    BlbTskFlag to set a request, get an anser or both. See enum afu_blb_tsk_typ.
    RqtKey(in/out) Key of the request block. If unknown, set -1
    Ord(in/out) Order of current request file in the request block.
    DatMarket data date.
    BlbMktPrxPrice to get from Bloomberg. See mkt_blb_prx_typ for details.
    LdMcdList of market data to ask Bloomberg for; typ, imc, BlbCod, PrxSrc
    LdDta(out) List of market data.
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Jun/2009
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Sep/2009: check AO BLBmkt to read or not market data from Bloomberg.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Oct/2009: New parameters in call to MKTxchBlbRqtFil
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Mar/2010: Add parameter Lnk.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 21/Apr/2010: Add paramter Dat. Make historic request if Dat is a past date.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Sep/2010: Get data for different accounts depending on the type of data to ask for.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Sep/2010: Remove parameter Lnk
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 24/Nov/2010: Set the pricing source as exclusive
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Jan/2017: Use AO BlbBndPty to know if requested prices for fixed income will be bid prices or medium prices.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Nov/2017: Add parameter BlbTsk to know if must set a request to BLB, get the answer or both at the same time
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Nov/2017: Add parameters RqtKey and Ord

)

Generate a new request file with historic market data codes to read from Bloomberg.

Generate a new request file with historic market data codes to read from Bloomberg.

Parameters
BlbTskFlag to set a request, get an anser or both. See enum afu_blb_tsk_typ.
RqtFilFull name of the file that is going to be generated with the requested codes.
BlbUsrBloomberg user
LnkUsrBloomberg Terminal account's user to link request to. It can be NULL.
LnkSnbBloomberg Terminal account's serial number to link request to.
LnkWksBloomberg Terminal account's workstation number to link request to.
AnsFilComplete name of the Bloomberg answer filename
LdMcdList of market data codes to read from Bloomberg.
BdtBegin date of the historic prices
EdtEnd date of the historic prices
PrxFrqPrice frequency. See enum mkt_blb_frq_typ for details.
MktPrxTypType of price to request: ask, bid or medium. See mkt_blb_prx_typ for details.
ExcSrcExclusive source flag.
PrxSrcPrice source code. It may be NULL
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

)

Generate a new request file with the market data codes that must read from Bloomberg.

Generate a new request file with the market data codes that must read from Bloomberg.

  • If the terminal account user number is NULL, do not link the request.

    Parameters

    BlbUsrBloomberg Data License user
    LnkUsrBloomberg Terminal account's user to link request to. It can be NULL.
    LnkSnbBloomberg Terminal account's serial number to link request to.
    LnkWksBloomberg Terminal account's workstation number to link request to.

    LdMcdList of market data codes to read from Bloomberg.
    MktDatTypType of price to get from Bloomberg according to the date. See mkt_blb_prx_dat_typ for details.
    MktPrxTypType of price to request: ask, bid or medium. See mkt_blb_prx_typ for details.
    ExcSrcFlag of exclusive source
    DatDate.
    Returns

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTxchImpMkt ( void *  Ctx,

void *  LdPro,
int  Src,
int  Mis,
int  PrvInf,
void *  LdAsk,
void *  LdImp,
int  SavTyp,
int  UpdFxgSpo 
)

Standard import of market data.

Standard import of market data

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatDate the prices are for. Only used if the source is Bloomberg.
LdProList of profiles: column "pro"
SrcSource type: See enum mkt_src in mkt_def.h for details.
MisFlag to indicate that market data to save are missing market data. (1 or 0)
PrvInfSet an info of market data previous to Dat.
LdAskList of all imc and date whose price is requested. If a pair (imc, dat) of this list is not included in the list of market data (LdImp) add the imc to ask later.
LdImp(in/out) Market data list. Columns: val, dat. According to Src: 0, "umc"; 1, "BlbCod"
SavTypType of saving. See mkt_sav_typ in mkt_def.h
UpdFxgSpoif there are spot prices update also the fixing spots (1) or not (0)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTxchSavMisMkt ( void *  Ctx,
int  BlbTsk,
char *  Src,
int  AskDay 
)

Save market data that were missing in previous requests.

Save market data that were missing in previous requests.

  • Get all market data that are missing from previous market data requests.
  • In case of Bloomberg source:
  • * for every date when there is any missing market date.
  • + Ask for all market data prices of that date

  • + Separate market data for every profile and save them (during the saving, if any market datum is not recovered from source, keep it in the table of missing market data.

    Parameters
    CtxDatabase context
    SrcSource string code.
    BlbTskFlag to set a request, get an anser or both. See enum afu_blb_tsk_typ.
    AskDayNumber of missing dates to ask for:
    +mkt_mis_ask_all to ask for all dates
    +mkt_mis_no_ask not ask for any date
    Returns
    Error code (0 if OK).
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 30/Oct/2009
    Modified
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Nov/2009: New parameter in MKTxchImpMkt to indicate that we are managing missing market data.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Nov/2009: MKTxchImpMkt, parameter list of profiles.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 28/Jan/2010: Bloomberg source, not ask for data without a Bloomberg code.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Apr/2010: Add parameter Lnk in call to MKTxchBlbGetHisMkt.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 08/Jun/2010: Add paramter LdAsk in call to MKTxchImpMkt
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Sep/2010: Remove parameter Lnk in call to MKTxchBlbGetHisMkt.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Nov/2010: Add parameter AskDay.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 20/Jan/2011: New parameter (PrvInf) in call to MKTxchImpMkt
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Sep/2011: New parameter (SavTyp) in call to MKTxchImpMkt
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 27/Dec/2012: Separate fund market data, they are requested to Bloomberg all days together. So we reduce the number of request files and make treatment faster.
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Apr/2017: Add new parameter UpdFxgSpo in call to MKTxchImpMkt
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Nov/2017: Add parameters RqtKey and Ord in call to MKTxchBlbGetHisMkt

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldCal ( char *  CalDat,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Carries out all calculations on yield curves for a given date.

Carries out all calculations on yield curves for a given date

  • Bond prices, CDS and CDSI curves make use of yield curves for their own calculations. So, before calculating bond prices (MKTpriCal), CPS curves (MKTcpsCal) and CPSI curves (MKTcpiCal) the yield curves calculation must be already done.

    Parameters
    CalDatCalculation date
    LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Isma ETXEBERRIA - 01/Feb/1999
    Modified
    • Mikel ARETXAGA - 13/Jul/1999: Test for LdYld existence modified.
    • Josune BIKUNA - 24/Sep/1999: Add dev column to LdYld
    • Josune BIKUNA - 28/Sep/1999: Add ccd column to LdYld
    • Josune BIKUNA - 07/Oct/1999: Copy ccd column to LdYld only if it is valid
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Mar/2000: Calculate discount factor without considering cms or non-cms
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 26/Jul/2000. Column ccd is already at curve level as it has been modified in MKTyldGetYld
    • Basilio TAMAYO - 05/Sep/2000. Calculate dates first of all. This was done in the MKTyldGet
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldCal2ndEoY ( char *  CalDat,
char *  Dev,
int  InxEoY0,
void *  LdCrv 
)

Add the second EoY point to a curve after having calculated dates.

Add the second EoY point to a curve after having calculated dates The behaviour of this function intends to obtain the same result MKTyldCalDatesCrv (CalDat, Dev, LdCrv, 0) MKTyldCal2ndEoY (CalDat, Dev, InxEoY0, LdCrv) than if we had done MKTyldCalDatesCrv (CalDat, Dev, LdCrv, 1));

Parameters
CalDatCalculation date
DevCurve currency
InxEoY0Line in the list of first EoY point
LdCrv(in/out) Curve list of points with the dates columns
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 18/Oct/2001
Modified
  • Jordi CAMARASA - 16/Jul/2008: Parse CLINT variable into int before doing the DYNputData
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldCalCrv ( char *  CalDat,
void *  LdCrv 
)

Calculates the discount factors for all points of a curve.

Calculates the discount factors for all points of a curve algorith:

  • Convert all values into the same format
  • Calculate DF of Overnight and Tom Next points if they exist
  • If there are future points
  • + Calculate non-future points in a row until the first future date
  • + Calculate all future points in a row
  • + Calculate non-future points in a row from the last future date
  • else
  • + Calculate all non-future points in a row
  • Calulate (interpolate) points that have no value
  • Calculate EoY (End of Year) points, if they exist
Parameters
CalDatCalculation date
LdCrvYield curve
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Mar/2000
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Jul/2000. Remove parameter LdMkt
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 08/Sep/2000. Column dfc set as static variable
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 07/Aug/2001. Dfc set to not valid at the begining
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 03/Oct/2001. Add function lcMKTyldCalEoY
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 15/Oct/2003. Initialise Vble. 'PrvMmf' to avoid w2k lint warnings
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 21/Nov/2003: correct case that the begin of first MMfuture cannot be directly calculated. New function lcMKTyldIniDfcMmf
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 27/May/2004: Use ERRchk instead of ERRass when calling to DYNcbnChk
  • Edurne GORDOA - 23/Oct/2014: Correct MMfuture points Dfc calculation. Take into account the begin date of each point instead of supposing that the begin date of the next future point is the end of current point
Note
  • LdCrv must be sorted by payment date (pdt column)
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldCalCsp ( char *  Ctr,
char *  Crv,
char *  Dat,
void *  LdMkt,
void **  LdCsp 
)

Get a copy of curve Crv with every point shifted the spread of contract Ctr.

Get a copy of curve Crv with every point shifted the spread of contract Ctr Calculate the spread of bond contract Duplicate the curve of Crv Add the spread to the Zero Coupon of each point of curve, except the EoY types Recalculate the discount factor of modified curve This calcul requires that LdMkt has Yld, Pri and Ctr objects.

Parameters
CtrContract
CrvCurve code
DatDate
LdMktMarket data
LdCsp(out) Contract spread'ed curve
Returns
Error code (0 if OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Nov/2000
Modified
Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Oct/2001. Do not shift EoY points
Note
The new structure is not stored in LdMkt. So it is responsability of the user to delete the new structure with function MKTyldCrvDestroy
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldCalDatDfc ( void *  LdCrv,
char *  CalDat,
char *  ValDat,
char *  Dat,
double *  Dfc 
)

Interpolate a Discount Factor in a reference date in a yield curve.

Interpolate a Discount Factor in a reference date in a yield curve, i.e. the discount factor is not calculate in the same date that the curve reference date, but in other one (DF from Dat until ValDat)

Parameters
LdCrvList of discount factors.
CalDatDate when the curve was calculated
ValDatReference date when calculating the discount factor
DatDate to interpolate the discount factor
Dfc(out) Discount Factor interpolated. If it is not possible to interpolate, -1
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Ramon MARTINEZ - 05/Jul/2000
Modified
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 04/Jan/2008: Complete header explanation
See Also
MKTyldCalDfc

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldCalDatesCrv ( char *  CalDat,
char *  Dev,
void *  LdCrv,
int  DupEoY 
)

Calculate the date columns for one curve.

Calculate the date columns for one curve.

  • nbd: days from CalDat till edt.
  • nbp: days from CalDat till pdt.
  • bdt: Begin date
  • edt: End date
  • pdt: Payment date
Parameters
CalDatCalculation, revaluation date. Necessary for MMfuture points
DevCurrency of the curve.
LdCrv(in/out): LdCrv (pty, pnt, adj, pfl, ffx, per, mat, unt) -> LdCrv (nbd, bdt, edt, pdt)
DupEoYDuplicate the EoY point or not. When displaying the points of a curve should not duplicate, for internal calculations, do it.
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 18/Jan/1999
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 21/Feb/2000
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Jul/2000. Remove LdMkt parameter, all attributes of points are in LdCrv, no need external LdMkt
  • Mikel ARETXAGA - 06/Sep/2000. Substitute DYN_STRING by DYN_DATE for date type columns
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Sep/2000. Add "nbd", "bdt", "edt" and "pdt" columns only if they do not exist. So this function can be called more that once with the same curve and different date.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Sep/2000. Calculate payment date with payment lag and sort the resulting list by this date.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 07/Nov/2001. Init lcCrvColEdt, lcCrvColPdt and lcCrvColNbp
  • Edurne GORDOA - 02/Apr/2002. Rename MKTyldDecalMatUnt by AFUdatDecalMatUnt
  • Edurne GORDOA - 31/May/2002. Init lcCrvColBdt
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 24/Nov/2003: Do not remove the points between MMfutures
  • Jordi CAMARASA - 16/Jul/2008: Parse CLINT variable into int before doing the DYNputData
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 22/Jun/2011: Correct compilation warning
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t
Note
This functions may change the number of lines in LdCrv Changes in this functions must be reflected also in MKTyldCalSmpNbdCrv ()

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldCalEoYVal ( char *  CalDat,
void *  LdCrv,
char *  Crv,
int  InxEoY0,
double *  Val 
)

Calculate value for EoY point.

Calculate value for EoY point. Calculate the scope of the Zcp function between the 2 dates previous to EoY Calculate the scope of the Zcp function between the 2 dates next to EoY Get the average scope between the two formerly calculated scopes Set this average scope between the previous date to EoY and first EoY date Set this average scope between the next date to EoY and second EoY date Requires that LdCrv has already been calculated for CalDat

Parameters
CalDatCalculation date
LdCrvList with the points of a curve
CrvCourve code
InxEoY0Index of the first EoY point
Val(out) Returned value: EoY point
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 05/Oct/2001
Modified
Basilio TAMAYO - 18/Oct/2001. Correct formula, using number of years instead of number of days

char *  Bdt,

double  EdtDfc,
double *  Fwd 
)

Calculates the forward yield of a flow between its two dates

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldCalMmf2Nbd ( char *  Dat,
char *  Dev,
void *  LdFut 
)

Calculates the number of days for a MMfuture point list.

Calculates begin and end dates for MMfuture point list Group the future points by begining date method (FIXED31, ...) For each method calculate a list of begin dates. For each future point, get the begin date from its correspondant list of begin dates and calculate the end date. If end date is closed, get the nearest open date, according to adjustment method

Parameters
DatCalculation date.
DevCurve currency.
LdFut(in, out) List of MMfuture points of the curve. Must have "ffx", "mat", "per","adj" and "pfl" columns and this function will add "bdt", "edt", "pdt", "nbd" and "nbp"
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 21/Feb/2000
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Jul/2000: Remove parameter LdMmf, all necessary fields are in LdFut
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 04/Dec/2006: Deleted function MKTmxfMthEnu, use datFraMth instead.
  • Jordi CAMARASA - 16/Jul/2008: Parse CLINT variable into int before doing the DYNputData
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Sep/2012: DYNaddColumns and DYNajoutexCol must have size with type size_t

char *  Dat,
void *  LdMkt,

)

Calculate Tweaking with Contract Spread.

Calculate Tweaking with Contract Spread Calculate the spread of bond contract Duplicate the tweaking curve of LdMkt Add the spread to the Zero Coupon of the shifted curves of the given curve Recalculate the discount factor of modified curves. This calcul requires that LdMkt has Yld, Pri, Ctr and Twe objects.

CrvCurve code

LdMktMarket data

Note
The new structure is not stored in LdMkt because there could be one of them for each bond contract and it would take large memory. It is responsability of the user to delete the new structure with function MKTcrvTweFre

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldChk ( void *  LdTra,
AFUdatCurHis  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt,
int  RemEoY 
)

Controls yield curves and sets warning messages in case the needed market data is missing.

Controls yield curves. We check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdTra) all curves come in the "crv" and "crvEst" columns.
  • Forex deals: they have an additional curve, which comes in the "crm" column. There is also a Forex reference curve in the "Frf" object of LdMkt which must exist in the presence of forex deals.
  • Repo curves: There are GENERIC and SPECIFIC repo curves. The specific curves may not exist, in which case we use the generic one. The mechanism is as follows: if a curve exists with the name of the bond contract (which comes in the "ctr" column of the LdBndr object) this is the repo specific curve, the one that will be used. Otherwise we need the generic curve (which comes in the "crv" column). If a repo curve exists it must have the correct values (i.e. there may not be NULL or zero value points).
  • Bond prices: In order to calculate the bond prices with their spread, the curve of the contract is needed. It is set in LdPri by the MKTpriGet function. We take it too.
  • Cps and Cpi curves: to calculate those curves they require that their CPS yield curves are already calculate, so those CPS yield curves are also needed.
  • MC instruments: We need the rate interest curve of the instrument and the forward curve of the assets when they are interest rates.
  • For reasons above explained, before calling to this function it must be done the check of bond prices (MKTpriChk), CDS curves (MKTcdsChk) and CDSI curves (MKTcdiChk). Otherwise, we will keep in our structure more yield curves than the extrictly needed with a waste of time and performance and the generation of warnings of missing market data that are not really needed.
Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historical data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historic)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
RemEoYWhether remove EoY points without value
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Isma ETXEBERRIA - 02/Feb/1999
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/May/2001 : Consider zero as a normal value, do not set as an error.
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 17/Oct/2001 : Sort LdRepo in aim to use DYNgenSearch.
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 16/Jan/2002 : Check if not valid cash points, and change warnings msgs to OverNight and Tom.Next.
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 21/Jan/2002 : If Crv is null, continue (It can be if no prices in spread)
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 08/Jul/2002. Add parameter RemEoY
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/Mar/2003: Use function MKTyldChkOneCrv for individual curve's checks
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 24/May/2004: Set as not valid the empty yield curves
  • Iker ZURIARRAIN - 12/Oct/2005. Add parameter IsCur and give MIS_HIS_CRV warning. Also change MISSING_CRV to MIS_CRV
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/Feb/2006: Check also the yield curves to calculate CPS curves from CDS curves.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 26/May/2006: Check also the yield curves to calculate CPS curves from CDSI curves.
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 02/May/2007: Get also the MciCrv when recovering curves
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 27/Dec/2007: Corrected the way to recover curves for MC instruments
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 07/Jan/2008: Corrected the place where recover curves for MC instruments
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Dec/2014: Add 'Dev' parameter when calling MKTyldChkOneCrv function
  • Nerea RAMOS - 26/Nov/2014: Take into account estimation yield curve (crvEst)
  • Josune BIKUNA - 20/Nov/2014: Get also the yield curves stored in 'CpsYld' column of yield volatilities (Ylv)
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldChkInf ( void *  LdTra,
AFUdatCurHis  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt,
int  RemEoY 
)

Controls yield curves and sets info messages in case the needed market data is missing.

Controls yield curves. We check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdTra) all curves come in the "crv" and "crvEst" columns.
  • Forex deals: they have an additional curve, which comes in the "crm" column. There is also a Forex reference curve in the "Frf" object of LdMkt which must exist in the presence of forex deals.
  • Repo curves: There are GENERIC and SPECIFIC repo curves. The specific curves may not exist, in which case we use the generic one. The mechanism is as follows: if a curve exists with the name of the bond contract (which comes in the "ctr" column of the LdBndr object) this is the repo specific curve, the one that will be used. Otherwise we need the generic curve (which comes in the "crv" column). If a repo curve exists it must have the correct values (i.e. there may not be NULL or zero value points).
  • Bond prices: In order to calculate the bond prices with their spread, the curve of the contract is needed. It is set in LdPri by the MKTpriGet function. We take it too.
  • Cps and Cpi curves: to calculate those curves they require that their CPS yield curves are already calculate, so those CPS yield curves are also needed.
  • MC instruments: We need the rate interest curve of the instrument and the forward curve of the assets when they are interest rates.
  • For reasons above explained, before calling to this function it must be done the check of bond prices (MKTpriChk), CDS curves (MKTcdsChk) and CDSI curves (MKTcdiChk). Otherwise, we will keep in our structure more yield curves than the extrictly needed with a waste of time and performance and the generation of warnings of missing market data that are not really needed.
Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historical data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historic)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
RemEoYWhether remove EoY points without value
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 03/Feb/2014
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldChkOneCrv ( char *  Crv,
char *  Dev,
void *  LdCrv,
int  ErrLev,
int  RemEoY 
)

Check an individual yield curve.

Check an individual yield curve. These are the controls carried out:

  • + If curve has Overnight point, it must have a valid value. If it has not, try to update it with the value of the first following cash point. If no value is found, set an information/warning message
  • + If curve has Tom next point, it must have a valid value. If it has not, try to update it with the value of the first following cash point. If no value is found, set an information/warning message
  • + If curve has not Overnight point, it must have at least one cash point

  • + If curve has not Overnight point, it must have at least one cash point with a valid value

    Parameters
    CrvCurve code
    DevCurrency of the curve
    LdCrvList of points of the curve
    ErrLevError level (LEV_INFO to set info messages of LEV_WARNING to set warning messages)
    RemEoYWhether remove EoY points without value
    Returns
    Error code (0: OK)
    Author
    Basilio TAMAYO - 14/Mar/2003 modifed:
    • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 27/Ma/2004: Use ERRchk instead of ERRass when calling to DYNcbnChk
    • Jon BARRUTIA - 07/Nov/2007: NO_VAL_PNT is an MKT_TRT error (generic for all MKT files)
    • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Dec/2014: In case there are O/N and/or T/N points and their values are not valid, try to update their values with the first following valid cash point value.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldDistortion ( char *  CalDat,
void *  LdCrv,
void *  LdCurPt 
)

Distortionate a curve list.

Distortionate a curve list, this is, shift a curve list with the distortion values stored in another list. The distortion points and their values are given in LdCurPt. LdCurPt is a list which has 3 columns: mat, unt, val.

Parameters
CalDatCalculation date
LdCrvYield curves list
LdCurPtDistortion points list
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 07/Jun/1999
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Mar/2000. Add parameter LdMkt.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Jul/2000. Remove parameter LdMkt.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Nov/2001. Search for maturity and unit to get the point the distortion will be applied to.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldFlt ( void *  LdTra,
AFUdatCurHis  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt,
int  RemEoY 
)

Filter yield curves list getting only the necessary one. No controls are done.

  • Filter yield curves list getting only the necessary one. No controls are done
  • In the stock object (LdTra) all curves come in the "crv" and "crvEst" columns.
  • Forex deals: they have an additional curve, which comes in the "crm" column. There is also a Forex reference curve in the "Frf" object of LdMkt which must exist in the presence of forex deals.
  • Repo curves: There are GENERIC and SPECIFIC repo curves. The specific curves may not exist, in which case we use the generic one. The mechanism is as follows: if a curve exists with the name of the bond contract (which comes in the "ctr" column of the LdBndr object) this is the repo specific curve, the one that will be used. Otherwise we need the generic curve (which comes in the "crv" column). If a repo curve exists it must have the correct values (i.e. there may not be NULL or zero value points).
  • Bond prices: In order to calculate the bond prices with their spread, the curve of the contract is needed. It is set in LdPri by the MKTpriGet function. We take it too.
  • Cps and Cpi curves: to calculate those curves they require that their CPS yield curves are already calculate, so those CPS yield curves are also needed.
  • MC instruments: We need the rate interest curve of the instrument and the forward curve of the assets when they are interest rates.
  • For reasons above explained, before calling to this function it must be done the check of bond prices (MKTpriChk), CDS curves (MKTcdsChk) and CDSI curves (MKTcdiChk). Otherwise, we will keep in our structure more yield curves than the extrictly needed with a waste of time and performance and the generation of warnings of missing market data that are not really needed.
Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historical data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historic)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
RemEoYWhether remove EoY points without value
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 03/Feb/2014
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldFndWthDev ( void *  Yld,
char *  Dev,
void **  LdCrv 
)

Search for a curve of a given currency in a curve list. The curve should be found.

DevCurrency
LdCrv(out) Curve list pointer (do not destroy!!) - NULL if not found
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 28/Oct/2014
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 02/Dec/2014: Do not use the column indexes lcYldColXxx. The given lists could have different structures
See Also
MKTyldFind, MKTyldSearch

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load historic yield curves into a single data structure.

Load historic yield curves into a single data structure. We may have some indications in LdMkt on which curves are necessary.

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Note
No specific code for "tsr" curve
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatCalculation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 09/Aug/1999
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Aug/1999. Substitute DYNlookUpInfo with DYNlookUp
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Mar/2000. Get pty and pnt and other function (MKTyldCalDates) to get the pay date.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 05/SEP/2000. Not calculate curve dates, it will be done in calculation phase
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/Sep/2000. Get also column src
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/May/2001. Consider zero as a normal value
  • Edurne GORDOA - 27/Feb/2002. Modifications to get historica data from correct table depending on if we are in FOX or GV
  • Edurne GORDOA - 23/Jul/2002. Impact the renaming of mkt_dta_rdd_aud to mkt_dta_trt_aud
  • Edurne GORDOA - 23/Jan/2004: lcMKTyldFree made public.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2006: Add parameter MktHis
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 27/Jul/2007: Use MKTcrvFre to free structure.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 03/Oct/2007: Use standard function MKTcrvGetHis.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
