AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldInterpolCrv ( void *  LdCrv,
char *  Dat,
double *  Rat 
)

Interpolate a value for a date in a yield curve.

Interpolate a rate for a date specified in the "Dat" argument in a curve passed as the "LdCrv" argument (usually a yield curve but it can be another curve type as a forex swap point curve). The curve list has to have the following columns:

  • pty: Point type
  • rat: Rate for each curve point
  • pdt: Date used to interpolate Note that we cannot use static variables for column indexes (lcCrvColXXX) because this function is also used in mktFsp.c.
Parameters
LdCrvList of points.
DatDate to interpolate the rate.
Rat(out) Interpolated value.
Returns
Error code (0 if OK).
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Mar/2000
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 15/May/2000. Bug in overflow cases.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 23/May/2000. In underflow cases, return the value of first point
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 14/Jul/2000. Column "val" instead of "rat"
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 19/Oct/2001. EoY points are like MMfutures
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 06/Nov/2001. There may be points with no valid value
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Nov/2001. Column "rat" instead of "val"
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 15/Oct/2003. Initialise Vbles. 'Dat2', 'Nbd2' to avoid w2k lint warnings
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 14/Jun/2006: Do not use static variables
See Also
MKTyldCalFwd

CrvCurve
DatDate
LdObjObject list
LdYld(out) Yield curves
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Edurne GORDOA - 08/Apr/2002
Modified
  • Edurne GORDOA - 18/Apr/2002. Set warning if there are not prices. Set in the object list the prices list
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2006: Added parameter MktHis to MKTgetHisDta
  • Josune BIKUNA - 16/Jul/2007: From now on, there is a curve model in with the 'x' axis is formed with a column called 'default' (dfl) instead of maturity/unit, so the value for this new column must be recovered when recovering the points.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 16/Jul/2007: The way to format the imc value depends on the curve model
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter to MKTgetHisDta
  • Alex RODRIGUEZ - 16/Jun/2009: Add Ctx parameter to MKTmcdSetImc function.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 02/Dec/2009: Use unified function lcMKTyldReaYld.
  • Asier SAMPIETRO - 27/Oct/2017: changed function call to new one lcMKTyldReaYld->MKTyldReaYld

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTyldTweaking ( char *  CalDat,
void *  LdYld,
void **  LdMkt,
double  ShiftVal 
)

Tweaking of a list of curves.

Given a list of curves (LdYld), a set of new curves is created. Each one of the original curve will generate a curve for every point except the EoY ones. Each one of the new curves will be similar to the original one but one point will be shifted, the first curve will have the first point shifted, the second curve will have the second point shifted, ....

Parameters
CalDatCalculation date
LdYldList of curves
LdMktMarket data where the tweaking curves will be saved
ShiftValOffset to shift
Returns
Error code (0 if OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 07/Jun/1999
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 10/Jul/2000. Remove parameter LdMkt
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 19/Jul/2000. The input is a list of curves
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Sep/2000. No use to recalculate imc. Remove it
  • Ramon MARTINEZ - 07/Aug/2001. Dfc is not set to 0.0 because it's done in MKTyldCalCrv
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Oct/2001. Do not duplicate curves for EoY points
  • Josune BIKUNA - 05/Feb/2015: Do not use the column indexes lcYldColXxx. The given lists could have different structures

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTylvCal ( void *  Ctx,
char *  CalDat,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Initialise date columns of all curves.

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTylvCalCplCrv ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdYldCrv,
void *  LdYlvCrv,
void *  LdAsoYldCrv,
char *  Dev,
char *  Dat,
double  Mrg,
int  Pcs,
void **  LdRes 
)

Calculate the stripped volatilities for a given curve on caplet periods.

This function makes a stripping process on a given spot volatility curve. The resultant list consists on several points that represent the caplets correspondent to the volatility curve, each with its stripped volatility. This stripped or forward volatility cannot be calculated directly from the spot volatility, and thus an iterative estimation is performed until the correct stripped volatility is found (further explained on code)

Parameters
CtxDatabase context
LdYldCrvYield curve (can be different from LdAsoYldCrv)
LdYlvCrvYield volatility curve
LdAsoYldCrvAssociated yield curve for the yield volatility curve
DevCurrency
DatCalculation date
MrgMargin on which the stripped volatility is estimated
PcsPrecision. The bigger the number, the bigger (+ 1 decimal) the precision
LdRes(out) Stripped volatility list with caplet periods
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Mikel URQUIA - 16/Nov/2014
Modified
  • Edurne GORDOA - 15/May/2015: Avoid HP compilation warning: warning #2174-D: expression has no effect
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTylvCalDatesCrv ( char *  CalDat,
char *  Dev,
void *  LdCrv 
)

Calculate the date columns for one volatility curve.

Calculate the date columns for one volatility curve.

  • nbd: days from CalDat till edt.
  • nbp: days from CalDat till pdt.
  • bdt: Begin date
  • edt: End date
  • pdt: Payment date
Parameters
CalDatCalculation, revaluation date.
DevCurrency of the curve.
LdCrv(in/out): LdCrv (pty, pnt, adj, pfl, ffx, per, mat, unt) -> LdCrv (nbd, bdt, edt, pdt)
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 12/Jan/2004
AFUMCR_EXP int MKTylvChk ( void *  LdTra,
AFUdatCurHis  IsCur,
void *  LdMkt 
)

Control yield volatility curves.

Control yield volatility curves. Check that all the required curves have been loaded with correct values. All curves that are not used will be destroyed, so that we don't need to calculate it.

  • In the stock object (LdTra) all curves come in the "ylv" column.
Parameters
LdTraStock list
IsCurCurrent or historical data (datCur: Current, datHis: Historical)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data object dynamic list
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Jan/2004
Modified
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 24/May/2004: Set as not valid the empty yield curves
  • Gotzon ETXEBERRIA - 27/May/2004: Use ERRchk instead of ERRass when calling to DYNcbn[Chk]
  • Iker ZURIARRAIN - 12/Oct/2005. Add IsCur parameter and give MIS_HIS_CRV warning. Also change MISSING_CRV to MIS_CRV
  • Jon BARRUTIA - 07/Nov/2007: NO_VAL_PNT is an MKT_TRT error (generic for all MKT files)

void *  LdCtr,
void **  LdYlv

Get from database the yield volatilities curve codes defined for the given contracts.

Get from database the list of yield volatilities curve codes defined for the given contracts.

  • The function will return a list with these columns:
  • - ctr: contract associated to the yield volatility curve
  • - crv: yield volatility curve code
  • - dev: currency of the yield volatility curve code

AFUMCR_EXP int MKTylvGetHis ( void *  Ctx,
char *  Dat,
char *  Pro,
char *  Trt,
int  MktHis,
void **  LdMkt 
)

Load historic yield volatility curves into a single data structure.

Load historic yield volatility curves into a single data structure. We may have some indications in LdMkt on which curves are necessary.

  • If the database connection is MO, it will take historic market data
  • If the database connection is FO, it will take historic market data for the given treatment, for example, revaluation
Parameters
CtxDatabase context
DatCalculation date
ProProfile
TrtTreatment for which the historic market data must be recovered in case of FO book. if it is empty or NULL, revaluation treatment will be used.
MktHisFlag to get all market data (mkt_his_all) or only used prices (mkt_his_use)
LdMkt(in/out) Market data structure
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Basilio TAMAYO - 09/Jan/2004
Modified
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 16/May/2006: Add parameter MktHis
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 27/Jul/2007: Use MKTcrvFre to free structure.
  • Basilio TAMAYO - 17/Oct/2007: Use standard function MKTcrvGetHis.
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter when calling to MKTcrvGetHis
  • Josune BIKUNA - 01/Nov/2007: Add treatment parameter (Trt) for indicating which is the treatment the market data must be recovered for
  • Josune BIKUNA - 15/Dec/2015: Use MKTylvFre instead of MKTcrvFre to free structure. From now on, the yield volatilities structure have another sublist

AFUMCR_EXP int SPOTget ( void *  ldSpot,
int  nbRecord,
char *  DevRef,
char *  DevCvt,
double *  txChg 
)

Get a Spot from a dyn list of the type of obtained with SPOTinit.

Get a Spot from a dyn list of the type of obtained with SPOTinit txChg's is in: DevRef / DevCnv

Parameters
ldSpotSpot list
nbRecordNumber of elements in ldSpot
DevRefReference currency or Main currency
DevCvtResult o converted currency
txChgResulting spot
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
To convert QntJpy (in JPY) to QntEur (in EUR):
SPOTget (ldSpot, nb, "EUR", "JPY", &txChg) (see that txChg is in EUR / JPY )
QntEur = QntJpy * txChg
Author
Keyvan SHAMSA - 14/NOV/1995
Modified
  • Josune BIKUNA - 13/Dec/2000: Do binary searches instead of sequential.
  • David IGLESIAS - 04/Apr/2002: Do error teratment and set error message. searches
  • David ROMERO - 20/Apr/2015: Avoid Sonar warning (redundant asignment to itself) for unused parameter
  • Josune BIKUNA - 25/Oct/2016: Shorter lines with more than 100 characters

AFUMCR_EXP int SPOTinitForLdDat ( void *  Ctx,
void *  LdDat,
char *  Dev,
void **  LdSpo,
int *  NbSpo 
)

Recover the list of spots for a list of dates.

Recover the list of spots for a list of dates, ordering the list by dev1 and dev2

Parameters
CtxDataBase conexion
LdDatList of dates for which the spots are wanted. "Dat" column must exist
DevConsolidation currency
LdSpo(out) Spot list
NbSpo(out) Number of elements in LdSpo
Returns
Error code (0: OK)
Author
Josune BIKUNA - 25/Oct/2016
